original: In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth.
translation: Long taim bipo God i mekim heven na graun.

original: Now the earth was formless and void, and darkness was over the surface of the deep. And the Spirit of God was hovering over the surface of the waters.
translation: Graun i no gat forma na i stap kukim, na dak i go daun long siposits bilong dip. Na Spirut bilong God i go daun, i stap klostu long siposits bilong wata.

original: And God said, “Let there be light,” and there was light.
translation: Na God i tok, "Wanpela lait i kam," na lait i kam.

original: And God saw that the light was good, and He separated the light from the darkness.
translation: Na God i lukim olsem lait i gutpela, na Em i partim lait na dai bilong darkness.

original: God called the light “day,” and the darkness He called “night.” And there was evening, and there was morning—the first day.
translation: God i kolim lait “de”, na darkness em i kolim “nait”. Na em i bin gat apinun, na em i bin gat moning – de namba wan.

original: And God said, “Let there be an expanse between the waters, to separate the waters from the waters.”
translation: Na God i tok, "Wanpela spes olsem i kam long mit bilong wata, olsem i partim wata long wata."

original: So God made the expanse and separated the waters beneath it from the waters above. And it was so.
translation: Sopas God i mekim bikim skai na i pulimapim wara long underside long em, na wara long top long em. Na em i kam olsem.

original: God called the expanse “sky.” And there was evening, and there was morning—the second day.
translation: God i kolim spes bilong heven "skaei". Na i bin EVENING, na i bin MORNING—dei namba tu.

original: And God said, “Let the waters under the sky be gathered into one place, so that the dry land may appear.” And it was so.
translation: Na God i tok, “Olgeta wara i stap anidas long skai, inap bai ol i kam bihaen long wanpela ples, ole lan i dai i kamap.” Na em i kamap olsem.

original: God called the dry land “earth,” and the gathering of waters He called “seas.” And God saw that it was good.
translation: God i kolim graun dri "graun", na em i kalim bikpela samting bilong wara olsem "solwara". Na God i lukim olgeta em i gut.

original: Then God said, “Let the earth bring forth vegetation: seed-bearing plants and fruit trees, each bearing fruit with seed according to its kind.” And it was so.
translation: God i tok, "Graun i bringim ol kain plan: plan i gat sik na diwai i karim fut, na olgeta i bringim fut wantaim sik long stap bla kain." Na olgeta i kamap so.

original: The earth produced vegetation: seed-bearing plants according to their kinds and trees bearing fruit with seed according to their kinds. And God saw that it was good.
translation: Gro long graun i kamapim planti: plantis i givim sik bilong ol, ole kain bilong ol, na diwai i karim frut na sik, ole kain bilong ol. Na God i lukim olgeta, em i gutpela.

original: And there was evening, and there was morning—the third day.
translation: Na i kamapim bek apinun, na i kamapim bek moning – dei namba tri.

original: And God said, “Let there be lights in the expanse of the sky to distinguish between the day and the night, and let them be signs to mark the seasons and days and years.
translation: Na God i tok, "Kisim lait igo long hevi, inap wari long dei na nait, na ol i stap olsem sain i mekim taim bilong yia, wik, na dei."

original: And let them serve as lights in the expanse of the sky to shine upon the earth.” And it was so.
translation: Na ol laits i stap long heven, ol i servim na ilaite i shine long graun.” Na em i kam olsem.

original: God made two great lights: the greater light to rule the day and the lesser light to rule the night. And He made the stars as well.
translation: Bikpela i mekim tupela lait bikpela: wanpela lait i go antap olsem bai i bosim dei, na wanpela lait i go daun olsem bai i bosim nait. Na God i mekim sta bilong haiwe tu.

original: God set these lights in the expanse of the sky to shine upon the earth,
translation: God i putim olgeta lait i go long heavens, bilong sky, ol i shine long graun.

original: to preside over the day and the night, and to separate the light from the darkness. And God saw that it was good.
translation: Na God i mekim wan man i go long stap i go pasim de na nait, na long mekim lain igo long lait na draiknes. Na God i lukim olgeta gutpela.

original: And there was evening, and there was morning—the fourth day.
translation: Na i kamapim bek evening, na i kamapim bek moning – dei namba foa.

original: And God said, “Let the waters teem with living creatures, and let birds fly above the earth in the open expanse of the sky.”
translation: Na God i tok, “Wara i kamapim ol krea i stap, na pisin i flai antap long graun long spes bilong skai.”

original: So God created the great sea creatures and every living thing that moves, with which the waters teemed according to their kinds, and every bird of flight after its kind. And God saw that it was good.
translation: Na God i kreasim ol bikpela krecha long solwara na ol samting i gat laip na i wokabaut, ol wara i kamap strong olsem kain bilong ol, na ol pisin bilong flait i go bek long kain bilong en. Na God i lukim olgeta em i gutpela.

original: Then God blessed them and said, “Be fruitful and multiply and fill the waters of the seas, and let birds multiply on the earth.”
translation: Na God blesim ol, ol i kamap planti na ol i multiplai, ol i pakim wata bilong solwara, na pisin i plenti long graun.

original: And there was evening, and there was morning—the fifth day.
translation: Na i kamapim evenin, na i kamapim moning – debe hap di.

original: And God said, “Let the earth bring forth living creatures according to their kinds: livestock, land crawlers, and beasts of the earth according to their kinds.” And it was so.
translation: Na God i tok, "Lain bilong graun i bringim ol kreaatura i gat laip olsem kain bilong ol: ol pipel bilong graun, ol anus, na ol beks bilong graun olsem kain bilong ol." Na em i kam so.

original: God made the beasts of the earth according to their kinds, the livestock according to their kinds, and everything that crawls upon the earth according to its kind. And God saw that it was good.
translation: God i mekim bek na animal bilong graun olsem kain bilong ol, na ol animals husat i kamap bilong ol manmeri olsem kain bilong ol, na everything we i go long graun olsem kain bilong ol. Na God i lukim olgeta, em i gutpela.

original: Then God said, “Let Us make man in Our image, after Our likeness, to rule over the fish of the sea and the birds of the air, over the livestock, and over all the earth itself and every creature that crawls upon it.”
translation: Na God i tok, "Mipela i mekim man long piksa bilong Mipela, bihaen long laip bilong Mipela, ol i bos long fish bilong solwara na pisin bilong heven, long ol anus, na long eni kain kreas bilong graun na olgeta samting bilong graun."

original: So God created man in His own image; in the image of God He created him; male and female He created them.
translation: God i kirapim man longpela piksa bilong em yet; longpela piksa bilong God olsem na em i kirapim; man na meri i kirapim ol.

original: God blessed them and said to them, “Be fruitful and multiply, and fill the earth and subdue it; rule over the fish of the sea and the birds of the air and every creature that crawls upon the earth.”
translation: God i givim blessing long ol, na tokim ol: "Ol i kamap planti na i multiples, ol i pilim graun na ol i winim em; ol i bos long ol fis bilong solwara, ol i bos long ol pisin bilong heven, na ol i bos long ol kain kina creature i go long graun."

original: Then God said, “Behold, I have given you every seed-bearing plant on the face of all the earth, and every tree whose fruit contains seed. They will be yours for food.
translation: Na God i tok, "Lukim, mi givim yu ol gras na planim we i karim sik long pes bilong graun, na ol diwai we i karim kakai na sik. Ol bai kaikai bilong yu."

original: And to every beast of the earth and every bird of the air and every creature that crawls upon the earth—everything that has the breath of life in it—I have given every green plant for food.” And it was so.
translation: Na long olgeta binatang long graun, na long olgeta pisin long heven, na long olgeta kreatua i go long graun – olgeta samting i gat breath bilong laip insait – mi givim olgeta gras bilong kakaruk olsem kaikai. Na em i kam so.

original: And God looked upon all that He had made, and indeed, it was very good. And there was evening, and there was morning—the sixth day.
translation: Na God i lukim olgeta samting em i mekim, na em i gutpela tru. Na besen i kam, na moning i kam – de sipis.

original: Thus the heavens and the earth were completed in all their vast array.
translation: Heven na graun ol i kamap pinis long olgeta namba bilong ol.

original: And by the seventh day God had finished the work He had been doing; so on that day He rested from all His work.
translation: Na long dei sevendi, Bikpela God i kamap pinis long wok bilong en; olsem na em i istir pinis long olgeta wok bilong en.

original: Then God blessed the seventh day and sanctified it, because on that day He rested from all the work of creation that He had accomplished.
translation: Na God i givim blesing long dei sevhen, na em i makim holy, bikos long dei ia em i stap bek long wok bilong mekim ol samting we em i mekim pinis.

original: This is the account of the heavens and the earth when they were created, in the day that the LORD God made them.
translation: Stori bilong heven na graun wewan ol i kamapim, long dei em LORD God mekim ol.

original: Now no shrub of the field had yet appeared on the earth, nor had any plant of the field sprouted; for the LORD God had not yet sent rain upon the earth, and there was no man to cultivate the ground.
translation: Nau, no bilong bus na i kamap yet long erth, na ol kain planis i no grow yet long graun; bikos LORD God i no bin salim rein yet long erth, na i no gat man yet olsem i ken warkim gras.

original: But springs welled up from the earth and watered the whole surface of the ground.
translation: Waras i kam ananit na i wataim olgeta hap graun.

original: Then the LORD God formed man from the dust of the ground and breathed the breath of life into his nostrils, and the man became a living being.
translation: Bikpela God i bikim man long graun na i givim breth bilong laip i go insait long nostrils bilong en, na man i kamap olsem man i gat laip.

original: And the LORD God planted a garden in Eden, in the east, where He placed the man He had formed.
translation: Na Bikpela God i plantim ganin long Eden, long hap bilong solwara, na em i putim man we em i bin mekim i stap long hap.

original: Out of the ground the LORD God gave growth to every tree that is pleasing to the eye and good for food. And in the middle of the garden were the tree of life and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil.
translation: Long graun LORD God i givim gro long olgeta diwai husat i luk good na i gut long kaikai. Na long mitim bilong garden, diwai bilong laip na diwai bilong save long gup na birua i stap.

original: Now a river flowed out of Eden to water the garden, and from there it branched into four headwaters:
translation: Wanpela river i kam aut bilong Eden, na i mekim Gaden bilong Eden i stap grubu, na em i go ap long foa hap bilong em yet.

original: The name of the first river is Pishon; it winds through the whole land of Havilah, where there is gold.
translation: Nem bilong festa river em i Pishon; em i go raitim olgeta graun bilong Havilah, we bilong dispela graun i gat gol.

original: And the gold of that land is pure, and bdellium and onyx are found there.
translation: Na gol bilong kantri ia i stap strong, na bdeliem na oniks i save kamap long en.

original: The name of the second river is Gihon; it winds through the whole land of Cush.
translation: Nem bilong sekend river em i Gihon; em i go raun long hap bilong kantri Kas.

original: The name of the third river is Hiddekel; it runs along the east side of Assyria. And the fourth river is the Euphrates.
translation: Nem bilong river namba tri em i Hiddekel; em i ran i go long sait bilong east bilong Asiria. Na river namba foa em i Yufrates.

original: Then the LORD God took the man and placed him in the Garden of Eden to cultivate and keep it.
translation: Bikpela God i kisim man na putim em long Garden bilong Eden, olsem man i ken wokim na lukautim.

original: And the LORD God commanded him, “You may eat freely from every tree of the garden,
translation: Na Lod God i givim komando long em, "Yupela ken kaikai olgeta fri long diwai bilong gaden".

original: but you must not eat from the tree of the knowledge of good and evil; for in the day that you eat of it, you will surely die.”
translation: Bai yu no ken kaikai long diwai bilong save gut na olsem save nogut; bikos long de yu kaikai bilong em, yu ken dai pinis.

original: The LORD God also said, “It is not good for the man to be alone. I will make for him a suitable helper.”
translation: Bikpela God tok olsem, "I no gutpela long man i stap wanpela tasol. Mi bai mekim meri bilong helpim bilong en."

original: And out of the ground the LORD God formed every beast of the field and every bird of the air, and He brought them to the man to see what he would name each one. And whatever the man called each living creature, that was its name.
translation: Na Bikpela God im mekim ol kain binatang long graun na ol pisin bilong hevi outim long graun, na God i bringim ol kam long man for lookim husat i givim nem. Na wusai man i kolim ol kain kreatua i gat laip, em nam bilong en.

original: The man gave names to all the livestock, to the birds of the air, and to every beast of the field. But for Adam no suitable helper was found.
translation: Man i givim nem long olgeta animal husat i stap, long olgeta pisin bilong heven, na long olgeta beasts bilong graun. Tasol, long Adam igat no wan em i kamap tru.

original: So the LORD God caused the man to fall into a deep sleep, and while he slept, He took one of the man’s ribs and closed up the area with flesh.
translation: GOD LORD i makim man i go insait long slip wei i strong, na wail em i slip, em i kisim wan rib bilong man na i kanakim hap bilong flesh.

original: And from the rib that the LORD God had taken from the man, He made a woman and brought her to him.
translation: Na Bikpela God i tekim rip bilong man, i mekim meri, na i bringim i kam klostu long em.

original: And the man said: “This is now bone of my bones and flesh of my flesh; she shall be called ‘woman,’ for out of man she was taken.”
translation: Man i tok: "Dispela i nau ol bon bilong mi yet na ol flesh bilong mi yet; ol bai kolim em 'meri', wantaim em i kam long man."

original: For this reason a man will leave his father and mother and be united to his wife, and they will become one flesh.
translation: Long dispela resin, man bai lusim papa na mama bilong en, na em bai joi wantaim meri bilong en, na tupela ol i stap klos long olgeta, olsem wan bodi.

original: And the man and his wife were both naked, and they were not ashamed.
translation: Man na meri bilong en, ol i stap naked tu, na ol i no bin shame.

original: Now the serpent was more crafty than any beast of the field that the LORD God had made. And he said to the woman, “Did God really say, ‘You must not eat from any tree in the garden?’”
translation: Na snek i moa kros long olgeta beasts bilong bus na Bikpela God i mekim. Na em i tokim meri, “Bikpela God i tok olsem, ‘Yu no ken kaikai frut bilong eni tree insait long gaaden?’”

original: The woman answered the serpent, “We may eat the fruit of the trees of the garden,
translation: Meri i tokim snek, "Mipela inap kaikai frut bilong diwai long Gaden bilong Eden".

original: but about the fruit of the tree in the middle of the garden, God has said, ‘You must not eat of it or touch it, or you will die.’”
translation: Bareket, long fruit bilong diwai i stap long mit bilong Gaden, God i tok, ‘Yu no ken kaikim na yu no ken tachim, o yu bai i dai.’”

original: “You will not surely die,” the serpent told her.
translation: “Yu no ken dai olsem,” snek i tokim em.

original: “For God knows that in the day you eat of it, your eyes will be opened and you will be like God, knowing good and evil.”
translation: Bikos God i save olsem, long de ya yu kaikai, yu ai bai opim, na yu bai olsem God, kisim save long gutpela na mara.

original: When the woman saw that the tree was good for food and pleasing to the eyes, and that it was desirable for obtaining wisdom, she took the fruit and ate it. She also gave some to her husband who was with her, and he ate it.
translation: Wanpela meri em i lukim diwai, em i gut long kaikai, em i swit moa long ai, na em i nid long pipel i kisim save. Ol i kisim fut na kaikai. Em i givim sampela long husat em i maritim ol i stap wantaim, na em tu i kaikai.

original: And the eyes of both of them were opened, and they knew that they were naked; so they sewed together fig leaves and made coverings for themselves.
translation: Na ai bilong ol tu i op, na ol i save ol yet i narakai, ol i sekim tokwis bilong figi na kisim wokim skurt bilong ol yet.

original: Then the man and his wife heard the voice of the LORD God walking in the garden in the breeze of the day, and they hid themselves from the presence of the LORD God among the trees of the garden.
translation: Na man na meri bilong en harim vojs bilong Bikpela God, Papa bilong olgeta, i go wokabaut long gaden long win blong dei, na ol i kaivim yas ol Yet long ples bilong Bikpela God, Papa bilong olgeta, long bus bilong gaden.

original: But the LORD God called out to the man, “Where are you?”
translation: Bikpela God i singaut long ol man, “Yu stap we?”

original: “I heard Your voice in the garden,” he replied, “and I was afraid because I was naked; so I hid myself.”
translation: “Mi harim voys bilong yu long gaaden,” em i tok, “na mi bin poret bikos mi nagat; olsem na mi kailem.”

original: “Who told you that you were naked?” asked the LORD God. “Have you eaten from the tree of which I commanded you not to eat?”
translation: Lord Bikpela i askim, "Husat i tokim yu olsem yu naket? Yu kaikai pinat bilong diwai we mi bin tokim yu olsem yu no ken kaikai?"

original: And the man answered, “The woman whom You gave me, she gave me fruit from the tree, and I ate it.”
translation: Man i bekim tok, "Meri wanpela Yu givim mi, em i givim mi frut bilong diwai, na mi kai kilim."

original: Then the LORD God said to the woman, “What is this you have done?” “The serpent deceived me,” she replied, “and I ate.”
translation: Bikpela God tok long meri, "Wanem samting yu mekim?" Meri i tok, "Snek i bikim olsem na mi bilip, na mi kaikai."

original: So the LORD God said to the serpent: “Because you have done this, cursed are you above all livestock and every beast of the field! On your belly will you go, and dust you will eat, all the days of your life.
translation: Na GOD Bilong Ol i tok long Snek: "Bikos yu mekim dispela, yu i go daun long hel long olgeta Ol Kain Animi na Ol Kain Moni I Kam Daun long Bus! Yu bai katim gras, na yu bai kaikai mati, long ol dei bilong laip yu.

original: And I will put enmity between you and the woman, and between your seed and her seed. He will crush your head, and you will strike his heel.”
translation: Na mi bai bringim hat betwen yu na meri, na betwen pikinini bilong yu na pikinini bilong em. Em bai krungim hed bilong yu, na yu bai kilim hil bilong em.

original: To the woman He said: “I will sharply increase your pain in childbirth; in pain you will bring forth children. Your desire will be for your husband, and he will rule over you.”
translation: Long meri God i tokim olsem: "Mi bai harim pain bilong yu long bel, yu birua ol pikinini long pain. Yu laik i go long husban bilong yu, na em bai bosim yu."

original: And to Adam He said: “Because you have listened to the voice of your wife and have eaten from the tree of which I commanded you not to eat, cursed is the ground because of you; through toil you will eat of it all the days of your life.
translation: Na ol i tokim Adam: “Bikos yu harim tok bilong meri bilong yu na yu kai ka long diwai we mi tokim yu olsem yu no ken kai, ken gras i birua long yu; long taim yu wokim strong yu ken kaikai bilong en tasol olgeta de bilong laip bilong yu.

original: Both thorns and thistles it will yield for you, and you will eat the plants of the field.
translation: Kunkud na spik em bai kamyut moning long yu, na yu bai kaikai ol kala na graun.

original: By the sweat of your brow you will eat your bread, until you return to the ground—because out of it were you taken. For dust you are, and to dust you shall return.”
translation: Long han bilong yu husat i kamap ol sem moning, yu bai kaikai bret olsem, na yu stap yet olsem til yu go bek gen long graun—bikos yu em i kam long pas. Na yu bai go bek gen long pas, bikos yu em i pas, na bai go bek gen long pas.

original: And Adam named his wife Eve, because she would be the mother of all the living.
translation: Na Adan i givim nem long meri bilong en, Ivi, bikos em bai kamap mama bilong olgeta samting i gat laip.

original: And the LORD God made garments of skin for Adam and his wife, and He clothed them.
translation: Na Bikpela God Makim klos bilong skin long Adam na meri bilong en, na Em i kisim klos i go long ol.

original: Then the LORD God said, “Behold, the man has become like one of Us, knowing good and evil. And now, lest he reach out his hand and take also from the tree of life, and eat, and live forever...”
translation: Na Lod God i tok olsem, "Behold, man i kamap olsem wanpela bilong mipela, i save gut na mare. Na nau, bai em no rikim han na kisim tu frut bilong diwai bilong laip, na kaikai, na stap oltaim..."

original: Therefore the LORD God banished him from the Garden of Eden to work the ground from which he had been taken.
translation: Olsem, LORD God i draivim em longwe long Graun bilong Eden i go wokim graun we em i kam bek long hap.

original: So He drove out the man and stationed cherubim on the east side of the Garden of Eden, along with a whirling sword of flame to guard the way to the tree of life.
translation: Na em i kirapim man go, na em i putim kerubim long sais ist bilong Garden bilong Eden, ol i gat sowrd bilong faia i go raun, ol i lukautim rod long go long tri bilong laip.

original: And Adam had relations with his wife Eve, and she conceived and gave birth to Cain. “With the help of the LORD I have brought forth a man,” she said.
translation: Na Adam i gat sindaun wantaim meri bilong en Eve, na meri i kamap suk na i karim bebi, na i bonarim Cain. “Mipela i gat help bilong LORD, na mipela i bringim forth man,” ol i tok.

original: Later she gave birth to Cain’s brother Abel. Now Abel was a keeper of sheep, while Cain was a tiller of the soil.
translation: Nupela beb i kam, na em i karim bebi Abel, brata bilong Kain. Abel em i man i lukaut ol sip, na Kain em i man i warkim garden.

original: So in the course of time, Cain brought some of the fruit of the soil as an offering to the LORD,
translation: Long taem igo pinis, Kain kisim sampela ka bilong graun, na bringim olsem wanpela ofing long Jehovah.

original: while Abel brought the best portions of the firstborn of his flock. And the LORD looked with favor on Abel and his offering,
translation: Wail Abel i bringim bikpela na nambawan pikinini bilong tupela long mupil, na LORD i lukim wantaim bikpela hamamas long Abel na givim samting bilong woksap long God.

original: but He had no regard for Cain and his offering. So Cain became very angry, and his countenance fell.
translation: Bain i no bin save long Cain na kai bilong en, na Cain i bel kol nau, face bilong en i kamdaun.

original: “Why are you angry,” said the LORD to Cain, “and why has your countenance fallen?
translation: LORDE i tokim Kain, “Wai yus i kros, na wai pes bilong yu i go daun?”

original: If you do what is right, will you not be accepted? But if you refuse to do what is right, sin is crouching at your door; it desires you, but you must master it.”
translation: Sapos yu wokim olgeta samting we i orait, bai yu kamap bilong God? Tasol sapos yu no wokim olgeta samting we i orait, sin i stap klostu long doa bilong yu; em i laikim yu, tasol yu mas winim em.

original: Then Cain said to his brother Abel, “Let us go out to the field.” And while they were in the field, Cain rose up against his brother Abel and killed him.
translation: Na Kain i tokim brata Abel bilong en, "Mipela i go aus long bus." Na long taim ol i stap long bus, Kain em i kirap strong long brata Abel bilong en na i kilim em.

original: And the LORD said to Cain, “Where is your brother Abel?” “I do not know!” he answered. “Am I my brother’s keeper?”
translation: Na Bikpela i tokim Kain olsem, "Brotha Abel bilong yu i stap we?" Kain i tok, "Mi no save." "Mipela inap lukautim brotha bilong mipela?"

original: “What have you done?” replied the LORD. “The voice of your brother’s blood cries out to Me from the ground.
translation: Olrok Bilong Hevi tokthus, "Wanem yu mekim? Wok bilong blekbilong brata yu i singaut long mi from graun."

original: Now you are cursed and banished from the ground, which has opened its mouth to receive your brother’s blood from your hand.
translation: Nau yu kukim olsem kros, na yu drivim i go long graun, ema i opim maus bilong en tasol, i kamas long blod bilong brata bilong yu, we yu kilim.

original: When you till the ground, it will no longer yield its produce to you. You will be a fugitive and a wanderer on the earth.”
translation: Wanpela taim yu wokim gras bilong yu, bai em i no inap givim ka long yu gen. Yu bai kamap man bilong ran i go, na yu bai go walap long graun.

original: But Cain said to the LORD, “My punishment is greater than I can bear.
translation: Kain i tokim Lord, “Penati bilong mi i bikpela moa long mi, mi no inap kisim.”

original: Behold, this day You have driven me from the face of the earth, and from Your face I will be hidden; I will be a fugitive and a wanderer on the earth, and whoever finds me will kill me.”
translation: Lukim, tede yumui drivim mi long fas bilong graun, na yumui kisim mi i go bai sindaun long bek bilong yu; bai mi kamap man i ranawe na ronara long graun, na husat i kisim mi, bai i kilim mi.

original: “Not so!” replied the LORD. “If anyone slays Cain, then Cain will be avenged sevenfold.” And the LORD placed a mark on Cain, so that no one who found him would kill him.
translation: Nogat tasol! OL i tok bek, "If God i kilim Kain, orait Kain bai i gat pasen sevenkala." Na OL i putim wan singsing long Kain, so that no one who found him would kill him.

original: So Cain went out from the presence of the LORD and settled in the land of Nod, east of Eden.
translation: Na Kain i go aut bikos i no stap wantaim Lod, na ol i pundaun long kantri bilong Nod, we esaut long Eden.

original: And Cain had relations with his wife, and she conceived and gave birth to Enoch. Then Cain built a city and named it after his son Enoch.
translation: Na Kain i go long meri bilong em, na meri i kamap na i karim bebi, na i banisim bebi, namel Enoch. Olsem na Kain i wokim taun, na i givim nem bilong pikinini Enoch long taun.

original: Now to Enoch was born Irad, and Irad was the father of Mehujael, and Mehujael was the father of Methusael, and Methusael was the father of Lamech.
translation: Na Enoch i kisim pikinini Irad, na Irad em i papa bilong Mehujael, na Mehujael em i papa bilong Methusael, na Methusael em i papa bilong Lamech.

original: And Lamech married two women, one named Adah and the other Zillah.
translation: Na Lamek i marit tu meri, wan em i kolim Adah na narak em i kolim Zilah.

original: Adah gave birth to Jabal; he was the father of those who dwell in tents and raise livestock.
translation: Adah i karim bebi, em Jabal, na em papa bilong ol i stap long haus bilong ol narapela, ol i save wokim suk na bus.

original: And his brother’s name was Jubal; he was the father of all who play the harp and flute.
translation: Na nem bilong brata i Jubal; em i papa bilong olgeta i pilai harp na flaut, ol i pilai olsem kastam bilong ol.

original: And Zillah gave birth to Tubal-cain, a forger of every implement of bronze and iron. And the sister of Tubal-cain was Naamah.
translation: Na Zila i karim bebé Tubal-kain, em i wan man i wokim olgeta ren long bronze na aian. Na susa bilong Tubal-kain em i Naama.

original: Then Lamech said to his wives: “Adah and Zillah, hear my voice; wives of Lamech, listen to my speech. For I have slain a man for wounding me, a young man for striking me.
translation: Lamech i tokim meri bilong em, Adah na Zillah, harim voys bilong mi; meri bilong Lamech, lisin long toktok bilong mi. Bikos mi kilim man long wundim mi, young man long paitim mi.

original: If Cain is avenged sevenfold, then Lamech seventy-sevenfold.”
translation: Yuzua Kain i kilim bek sevenfala, na Lamek seventy-sevenfala.

original: And Adam again had relations with his wife, and she gave birth to a son and named him Seth, saying, “God has granted me another seed in place of Abel, since Cain killed him.”
translation: Na Adam i go wankain wantaim meri bilong en, na meri bilong en i karim bebi na i kamautim man, tupela i givim nem bilong pikinini olsem Seth, olsem meri bilong en i tok, "God i givim mi narapela pikinini long hap bilong Abel, bekas Kain i kilim em."

original: And to Seth also a son was born, and he called him Enosh. At that time men began to call upon the name of the LORD.
translation: Na long taim dispela, wanpela man i kam born long Set, na em i kisim nem bilong em Enos. Ol man i stat long kolim nem bilong LORD.

original: This is the book of the generations of Adam. In the day that God created man, He made him in His own likeness.
translation: Em i buk bilong genereishon bilong Adam. Long de God kreatim man, God mekim man olsem em yet.

original: Male and female He created them, and He blessed them. And in the day they were created, He called them “man.”
translation: Man meri Em i mekim ol, na Em i givim blesing long ol. Na long de em oli mekim, Em i kolim ol "man".

original: When Adam was 130 years old, he had a son in his own likeness, after his own image; and he named him Seth.
translation: Taim Adam i 130 yia olsem, i gat pikinini man bilong em yet, em i kamap olsem em yet, na em i givim nem Seth long em.

original: And after he had become the father of Seth, Adam lived 800 years and had other sons and daughters.
translation: Na bihaen long em i kamap papa bilong Seth, Adam i stap 800 yia na i gat ol narapela pikinini man na meri.

original: So Adam lived a total of 930 years, and then he died.
translation: Na Adam i stap olgeta em 930 yia, na em i dai pinis.

original: When Seth was 105 years old, he became the father of Enosh.
translation: Taim Seth i 105 yia olsem, na em i kamap papa bilong Enosh.

original: And after he had become the father of Enosh, Seth lived 807 years and had other sons and daughters.
translation: Na em i kamap papa bilong Enosh, Seth i stap 807 yia na i gat moa pikinini man na meri.

original: So Seth lived a total of 912 years, and then he died.
translation: Set i stap olgeta long 912 yia, na em i dai.

original: When Enosh was 90 years old, he became the father of Kenan.
translation: Taim Enosh i gat 90 yia, em i kamap papa bilong Kenan.

original: And after he had become the father of Kenan, Enosh lived 815 years and had other sons and daughters.
translation: Na bihaen long em i kamap papa bilong Kenan, Enosh i stap 815 yia na i gat ol narapela pikinini man na meri.

original: So Enosh lived a total of 905 years, and then he died.
translation: Enosh i stap olgeta em i kap 905 yia, na em i dai pinis.

original: When Kenan was 70 years old, he became the father of Mahalalel.
translation: Taim Kenan i gat 70 yia, em i kamap papa bilong Mahalalel.

original: And after he had become the father of Mahalalel, Kenan lived 840 years and had other sons and daughters.
translation: Na bihaen long Kenan i kamap papa bilong Mahalalel, em i stap 840 yia na i gat moa pikinini man na meri.

original: So Kenan lived a total of 910 years, and then he died.
translation: Kenan i stap olgeta 910 yia, na em i dai.

original: When Mahalalel was 65 years old, he became the father of Jared.
translation: Taim Mahalalel i gat 65 yia, em i bianim papa bilong Jared.

original: And after he had become the father of Jared, Mahalalel lived 830 years and had other sons and daughters.
translation: Na bihaen long Mahalalel i kamap papa bilong Jared, em i stap 830 yia na i gat ol narapela pikinini man na meri.

original: So Mahalalel lived a total of 895 years, and then he died.
translation: Mahalalel i stap olgeta long 895 yarn, na em i dai.

original: When Jared was 162 years old, he became the father of Enoch.
translation: Jared emi 162 yia na emi bin mekim Enoch, pikinini bilong en.

original: And after he had become the father of Enoch, Jared lived 800 years and had other sons and daughters.
translation: Na bihaen long em i kamap papa bilong Enok, Jared i stap 800 yia na i gat moa pikinini man na meri.

original: So Jared lived a total of 962 years, and then he died.
translation: Na Jared i stap olgeta long 962 yia, na em i dai pinis.

original: When Enoch was 65 years old, he became the father of Methuselah.
translation: Enok i 65 yia na em i kisim pikinini Methusela.

original: And after he had become the father of Methuselah, Enoch walked with God 300 years and had other sons and daughters.
translation: Na em i kamap papa bilong Methuselah, Enok i wark long Bikpela 300 yia na i gat ol narapela pikinini man na meri.

original: So Enoch lived a total of 365 years.
translation: Na Enok i stap olgeta long 365 yia.

original: Enoch walked with God, and then he was no more, because God had taken him away.
translation: Enok i go wakabaut wantaim God, na em i no stap gen, bikos God i kisim em i go.

original: When Methuselah was 187 years old, he became the father of Lamech.
translation: Methuselah emi bin 187 yia na i kamap papa bilong Lamech.

original: And after he had become the father of Lamech, Methuselah lived 782 years and had other sons and daughters.
translation: Na bihain long em i kamap papa bilong Lamech, Methuselah i stap 782 yia na i gat moa pikinini man na meri.

original: So Methuselah lived a total of 969 years, and then he died.
translation: Na Methusela i stap olgeta 969 yia, na bihain em i dai.

original: When Lamech was 182 years old, he had a son.
translation: Taim Lamech em i 182 yia na i go dai, em i karim pikinini.

original: And he named him Noah, saying, “May this one comfort us in the labor and toil of our hands caused by the ground that the LORD has cursed.”
translation: Na em i givim nem Noah long em, olsem, "Dispela man bai inap kisim bel hevi long painim wok na het long han bilong yumi, olgeta kamap bikos Bikpela i bin katim gras."

original: And after he had become the father of Noah, Lamech lived 595 years and had other sons and daughters.
translation: Na bihaen em i kamap papa bilong Noa, Lamek i stap 595 yia na i gat ol narapela pikinini man na meri.

original: So Lamech lived a total of 777 years, and then he died.
translation: Na Lamek i stap olgeta em i 777 yia, na em i dai pinis.

original: After Noah was 500 years old, he became the father of Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
translation: Bihaen long Noa i kamap 500 yia na, em i bikim papa long Shem, Ham, na Jafet.

original: Now when men began to multiply on the face of the earth and daughters were born to them,
translation: Taim ol man i stat long multipul long anes long graun na meri i kamap long ol,

original: the sons of God saw that the daughters of men were beautiful, and they took as wives whomever they chose.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong God i lukim ol meri bilong ol man ol i stap nais, na ol i kisim whosover ol i laik ol meri bilong ol man bilong wai.

original: So the LORD said, “My Spirit will not contend with man forever, for he is mortal; his days shall be 120 years.”
translation: Bikpela i tok, "Spiriti bilong mi no inap kisim fait wantaim man bilong mata long taem olgeta, bikos em i man bilong mata; dei bilong en i go 120 yia."

original: The Nephilim were on the earth in those days—and afterward as well—when the sons of God had relations with the daughters of men. And they bore them children who became the mighty men of old, men of renown.
translation: Nephilim i stap long graun long dispela taim - na bihain tu - wail em sups opela bilong God i gat wes wikim na pikinini bilong ol meri. Na ol i bonim pinis pikinini, ol man bilong strong, ol man bilong bipo, ol man bilong bikpela nem.

original: Then the LORD saw that the wickedness of man was great upon the earth, and that every inclination of the thoughts of his heart was altogether evil all the time.
translation: Bikpela i lukim olsem gutpela nogut bilong man i bikpela long graun, na olgeta laik na tingting bilong het bilong em i olgeta nogut oltaim.

original: And the LORD regretted that He had made man on the earth, and He was grieved in His heart.
translation: Na Papa God i sorim olsem em i mekim man long graun, na em i sori long hart bilong en.

original: So the LORD said, “I will blot out man, whom I have created, from the face of the earth—every man and beast and crawling creature and bird of the air—for I am grieved that I have made them.”
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem, "Mi bai kamautim manmeri we mi mekim, long fas bilong graun - ol man, ol bek, ol krukrete na ol pisin bilong heven - bikos mi paitim long ol, bikos mi mekim ol."

original: Noah, however, found favor in the eyes of the LORD.
translation: Noa, tasol, i gat bikpela hariap long ai bilong LORD.

original: This is the account of Noah. Noah was a righteous man, blameless in his generation; Noah walked with God.
translation: Em i stori bilong Noa. Noa em i man i gat jastis, i stap raite, em i man i nogat hevi long genarashen bilong en; Noa i go wantaim God.

original: And Noah had three sons: Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
translation: Na Noa i gat tripela pikinini: Sem, Ham, na Jafet.

original: Now the earth was corrupt in the sight of God, and full of violence.
translation: Nau graun bilong yumi i bin bagarap long ai bilong Bikpela, na i fulap long strongpela pasin.

original: And God looked upon the earth and saw that it was corrupt; for all living creatures on the earth had corrupted their ways.
translation: Na God i lukim i go long graun na i si olsem em i bagarap; bikos olgeta kain kain animol long graun ol i bin bagarapim wei bilong ol.

original: Then God said to Noah, “The end of all living creatures has come before Me, because through them the earth is full of violence. Now behold, I will destroy both them and the earth.
translation: Na God i tokim Noah, "Taim bilong dai bilong ol kreatua i kam bifor Mi, long ol i mekim erth i fulap long violence. Nau lukim, Mi bai bagarap ol dispela na erth."

original: Make for yourself an ark of gopher wood; make rooms in the ark and coat it with pitch inside and out.
translation: Wokim bokis bilong yu long timber gophah, mekim rum long ol insait, na kambekim em wantaim pik insait na nausaid.

original: And this is how you are to build it: The ark is to be 300 cubits long, 50 cubits wide, and 30 cubits high.
translation: Na dispela em i rot bilong bilon bilum: Arki em i mas long 300 kubiti, waid 50 kubiti, na hait 30 kubiti.

original: You are to make a roof for the ark, finish its walls a cubit from the top, place a door in the side of the ark, and build lower, middle, and upper decks.
translation: Yu mas wokim ruf bilong arka, kampletim wal bilong en wan fut from hap, putim doa long sait bilong arka, na wokim dek bilong klos, dek bilong mit, na dek bilong hap.

original: And behold, I will bring floodwaters upon the earth to destroy every creature under the heavens that has the breath of life. Everything on the earth will perish.
translation: Na lukim, mi bai bringim wata i go daun long graun, olgeta krea i gat breth blong laip aninit long heven, bai bagarapim. Olgeta samting long graun bai dai finis.

original: But I will establish My covenant with you, and you will enter the ark—you and your sons and your wife and your sons’ wives with you.
translation: Mi bai plantim kaantri bilong mi wantaim yu, na yu bai go insait long arki - yu, ol pikinini bilong yu, meri bilong yu, na meri bilong ol pikinini bilong yu, olgeta bai go wantaim yu.

original: And you are to bring two of every living creature into the ark—male and female—to keep them alive with you.
translation: Na yu mas bringim tu ol kreatua i gat laif, man na meri, i go insait long ark, ol i stap alive wantaim yu.

original: Two of every kind of bird and animal and crawling creature will come to you to be kept alive.
translation: Tu olsem kain pispis, aninal, na krukuruk bai tu i go we kam long yu, bai yu kam long yu, olgeta long stap alive.

original: You are also to take for yourself every kind of food that is eaten and gather it as food for yourselves and for the animals.”
translation: Yu yet mas kisim long han bilong yu ol kain kaikai i kukim na kisim olsem kaikai bilong yumi yet na bilong ol animol.

original: So Noah did everything precisely as God had commanded him.
translation: Na Noa em i mekim olgeta olsem God i givim tok bilong en preciseli.

original: Then the LORD said to Noah, “Go into the ark, you and all your family, because I have found you righteous in this generation.
translation: Na God i tokim Niu long taim, “Yu go insait long ak, yu na ol famili bilong yu, bikos mi finis yu i kamap rait long jenarisen ia.”

original: You are to take with you seven pairs of every kind of clean animal, a male and its mate; a pair of every kind of unclean animal, a male and its mate;
translation: Yu mas kisim i go wantaim yu seven pe na ol kain animol cleansing, man na meri bilong em; wan pe na ol kain animol not cleansing, man na meri bilong em;

original: and seven pairs of every kind of bird of the air, male and female, to preserve their offspring on the face of all the earth.
translation: Na seven ples bilong bird olsem na ol i kamap long hap tu, man na meri, ol i save mekim genaration bilong ol i go i go, long fas bilong graun olegta.

original: For seven days from now I will send rain on the earth for forty days and forty nights, and I will wipe from the face of the earth every living thing I have made.”
translation: Long sikis de pe bai i kam, mi bai sendim ren long graun olsem forty de na forty nait, na mi bai wipim long faci bilong graun ol samting em i gat laif we mi mekim.

original: And Noah did all that the LORD had commanded him.
translation: Na Noa en mekim olgeta we long LORD i bin givim em.

original: Now Noah was 600 years old when the floodwaters came upon the earth.
translation: Nau Nua em i 600 yia olsem wen dai bilong baigna i kam long graun.

original: And Noah and his wife, with his sons and their wives, entered the ark to escape the waters of the flood.
translation: Na Noa wantaim meri bilong en, na ol pikinini bilong en wantaim meri bilong ol, i go insait long arka, bikos wanpela escapim long wara bilong daunin.

original: The clean and unclean animals, the birds, and everything that crawls along the ground
translation: Ol animol i go long ples na ol animol i no go long ples, ol pisin, na ol samting ol i wark long graun

original: came to Noah to enter the ark, two by two, male and female, as God had commanded Noah.
translation: Ol i kam bek long Noa, ol i go insait long ak, man na meri, tu bi tu, olsem God i tokim Noa.

original: And after seven days the floodwaters came upon the earth.
translation: Bihaen long sikis de, wara bilong daunim graun i kam bilong daunim graun.

original: In the six hundredth year of Noah’s life, on the seventeenth day of the second month, all the fountains of the great deep burst forth, and the floodgates of the heavens were opened.
translation: Long yia sesen hanred bilong laip bilong Noa, long dei sebintein bilong mun tu, olgeta spring water bilong dip hap i go antap, na olgeta gat bilong heven i opim.

original: And the rain fell upon the earth for forty days and forty nights.
translation: Na ren i kam daun long graun fori dei na fori nait.

original: On that very day Noah entered the ark, along with his sons Shem, Ham, and Japheth, and his wife, and the three wives of his sons—
translation: Long dispela dei, Noa wantaim ol pikinini bilong en, Sem, Ham, na Jafet, wanpela wantaim meri bilong en, na ol meri tri bilong ol pikinini bilong en, i go insait long ark.

original: they and every kind of wild animal, livestock, crawling creature, bird, and winged creature.
translation: Ol i go na ol kain animal bilong bus, animit long graun, krukbilong graun, pisin, na krukbilong hevi.

original: They came to Noah to enter the ark, two by two of every creature with the breath of life.
translation: Ol i kam long Noa, go insait long ark, tu bi tu bilong everi kain krea we i gat breth blong laip.

original: And they entered, the male and female of every living thing, as God had commanded Noah. Then the LORD shut him in.
translation: Na ol man na meri, ol i go insait, olsem ol samting i gat laip, olsem God i givim tok long Noa. Na LORD i klosim em.

original: For forty days the flood kept coming on the earth, and the waters rose and lifted the ark high above the earth.
translation: Long fifo de, disla hap bilong wara i kam stap na i go antap, na wara i liftpela ark wantaim, na ark i go het long gras bilong earth.

original: So the waters continued to surge and rise greatly on the earth, and the ark floated on the surface of the waters.
translation: Na waras i kam antap tru, i go antap moa yet long graun, na bokis bilong Noa i flot long sop bilong waras.

original: Finally, the waters completely inundated the earth, so that all the high mountains under all the heavens were covered.
translation: Wara i kamapim gut long olgeta hap graun, na ol maunten hap antap long olgeta hap heven i go daun, na wara i kapim ol.

original: The waters rose and covered the mountaintops to a depth of fifteen cubits.
translation: Warai i go hap, kamapim hap long top bilong maunten long dep na fiftin kabiti.

original: And every living thing that moved upon the earth perished—birds, livestock, animals, every creature that swarms upon the earth, and all mankind.
translation: Na olgeta samting i gat laip, ol i bin go antap long graun, ol i bin dai pinis—pisin, anus, animal, olgeta kain kreatua i kamap long graun, na ol manmeri.

original: Of all that was on dry land, everything that had the breath of life in its nostrils died.
translation: Long olgeta samting we i stap long graun, olgeta samting we i gat win blong laip insait long nosel i dai finis.

original: And every living thing on the face of the earth was destroyed—man and livestock, crawling creatures and birds of the air; they were blotted out from the earth, and only Noah and those with him in the ark remained.
translation: Na olgeta samting i gat laip long pes bilong graun, ol man, animp long graun, krukim na snakim ol samting, na pisin bilong heven, ol i bin dai finish, ol i bin rausim pinis long graun. Tasol Noa na ol arapela i stap wantaim em inside ark bilong em i stap yet.

original: And the waters prevailed upon the earth for 150 days.
translation: Na wara i winim long graun olsem 150 de.

original: But God remembered Noah and all the animals and livestock that were with him in the ark. And God sent a wind over the earth, and the waters began to subside.
translation: Bikpela i memorim Noa na ol kanaka na ol pipol bilong bus ol i stap wantaim em insait long bos. Na Bikpela i senpim win long graun, na wara i statim go daun.

original: The springs of the deep and the floodgates of the heavens were closed, and the rain from the sky was restrained.
translation: Ol springs bilong dip na ol gate bilong heven i go bek, na ren bilong sky i stop.

original: The waters receded steadily from the earth, and after 150 days the waters had gone down.
translation: Warai i go daun i stap long graun, na bihaen 150 de, warai i pinis go daun.

original: On the seventeenth day of the seventh month, the ark came to rest on the mountains of Ararat.
translation: Long seventeenth dei bilong sevengrass mons, ark i kam bek long ples resis long maunten bilong Ararat.

original: And the waters continued to recede until the tenth month, and on the first day of the tenth month the tops of the mountains became visible.
translation: Na wara i go bek, i kam daun olsem, tasol i stap long mun tenth, na long dei fest bilong mun tenth, tops bilong maunten i kamap nau.

original: After forty days Noah opened the window he had made in the ark
translation: Bihaen long forty de, Noa i opim windoa em i mekim long ak.

original: and sent out a raven. It kept flying back and forth until the waters had dried up from the earth.
translation: Na em i kirapim kokomo, i stap flai go bek gen, go bek gen, na monin bai wara i drai pinis long graun.

original: Then Noah sent out a dove to see if the waters had receded from the surface of the ground.
translation: Na Noa em bungim pisin i go lukim igo tasol bai wara i kamdaun pinis long sipas bilong graun.

original: But the dove found no place to rest her foot, and she returned to him in the ark, because the waters were still covering the surface of all the earth. So he reached out his hand and brought her back inside the ark.
translation: Bata pigin i no finim ples bilong en tasol, na em i kam bek gen long em insait bos bilong ol, bikos wara i stap yet kova gras bilong olgeta erth. Olsem em i stretim han bilong en, na i bringim bek i go insait bos bilong ol.

original: Noah waited seven more days and again sent out the dove from the ark.
translation: Na Noa weiti moa long wik sevn de, na em bai usim dok bilong en go bek gen long bos bilong en.

original: And behold, the dove returned to him in the evening with a freshly plucked olive leaf in her beak. So Noah knew that the waters had receded from the earth.
translation: Na lukim, pisin i kam bek long em long apinun wetem lip olive i kisim pinis nau long bek bilong en. Na Noa i save olsem wara i go daun pinis long graun.

original: And Noah waited seven more days and sent out the dove again, but this time she did not return to him.
translation: Na Noa i weita moa long sevenpela de, na em i kirapim dok gen, tasol taim ini em i no kam bek gen long en.

original: In Noah’s six hundred and first year, on the first day of the first month, the waters had dried up from the earth. So Noah removed the covering from the ark and saw that the surface of the ground was dry.
translation: Long taim Noa i kamap 601 yia, long dei namba wan bilong mun namba wan, wara i drai pinis long graun. Na Noa i kisim baket long Arka bilong en, na i lukim surface bilong graun em i drai.

original: By the twenty-seventh day of the second month, the earth was fully dry.
translation: Long dei twenty-seven bilong mun two, giraun i drai pinis.

original: Then God said to Noah,
translation: Na God i tok long Noa,

original: “Come out of the ark, you and your wife, along with your sons and their wives.
translation: Kam aut bilong arks, yu na meri bilong yu, longlong yu, sut bilong yu na meri bilong ol.

original: Bring out all the living creatures that are with you—birds, livestock, and everything that crawls upon the ground—so that they can spread out over the earth and be fruitful and multiply upon it.”
translation: Kisim oltgeta krea, ol pisin, ol bulmakau, na ol samting we i go long graun, na was long nau, go daun long graun na spred ol i go, kamap planti na igat moa long en.

original: So Noah came out, along with his sons and his wife and his sons’ wives.
translation: Na Noa i kam aut, wantaim ol pikinini bilong en, meri bilong en na meri bilong ol pikinini bilong en.

original: Every living creature, every creeping thing, and every bird—everything that moves upon the earth—came out of the ark, kind by kind.
translation: Olgeta krea, olgeta samting we i kukim gras, na olgeta pisin – olgeta samting we i wok long graun – ol i kam aut long arka, kain na kain.

original: Then Noah built an altar to the LORD. And taking from every kind of clean animal and clean bird, he offered burnt offerings on the altar.
translation: Na Noa em bilon altia long LORD. Na em i kisim animal i koipela na pisin i koipela, na em i bringim ofring na kaikai i go daun long faia long altia.

original: When the LORD smelled the pleasing aroma, He said in His heart, “Never again will I curse the ground because of man, even though every inclination of his heart is evil from his youth. And never again will I destroy all living creatures as I have done.
translation: Taim LORD pilai swayp long switpela smel, Em i tok long het bilong em, “Mi no go cursem graun gen long taim bilong man, even doe olgeta kain tingting bilong heart bilong em i no gut from yum. Na mi no go kilim olgeta kain animal olsem mi mekim bifo.”

original: As long as the earth endures, seedtime and harvest, cold and heat, summer and winter, day and night shall never cease.”
translation: Olsem lon taim graun i stap, taim bilong planim na taim bilong kaikai, kolkol na hot, taim bilong ren na taim bilong klia, de na nait bai i no ken hap mas.

original: And God blessed Noah and his sons and said to them, “Be fruitful and multiply and fill the earth.
translation: Na God i givim berkat long Noa na ol pikinini bilong em, na i tokim ol, "Ol i kamap planti, ol i multiplem, na ol i pilim apaun graun."

original: The fear and dread of you will fall on every living creature on the earth, every bird of the air, every creature that crawls on the ground, and all the fish of the sea. They are delivered into your hand.
translation: Agivim na wikim i kam long yu, i go daun long olgeta kain kreatua long graun, olgeta pisin bilong heven, olgeta kain kreatua i go long graun, na olgeta pis bilong solwara. Ol i givim long han bilong yu.

original: Everything that lives and moves will be food for you; just as I gave you the green plants, I now give you all things.
translation: Olgeta samting i gat laip na i wakabaut bai ol i kamapim kaikai bilong yu; olsem mi givim yu gris pipia olgeta, na nau mi givim yu olgeta samting.

original: But you must not eat meat with its lifeblood still in it.
translation: Yu no ken kaikai mit na blut i stap yet.

original: And surely I will require the life of any man or beast by whose hand your lifeblood is shed. I will demand an accounting from anyone who takes the life of his fellow man:
translation: Na mi bai askim laip bilong eni man o animal husat i kilim blood bilong yu. Mi bai kirapim akounting long eni man husat i kilim brata bilong en, bikos valu bilong laip bilong manmeri em i bikpela, na responisbiliti long kilim man em i stap long han bilong yu.

original: Whoever sheds the blood of man, by man his blood will be shed; for in His own image God has made mankind.
translation: Husat i go long kilim man, ol man bai kilim blod bilong em tu; wantaim God, Bikpela, i bin mekim mipela ol man na meri long ples bilong pikinini bilong Em.

original: But as for you, be fruitful and multiply; spread out across the earth and multiply upon it.”
translation: Bikpela i tok olsem: “Na yu, kamap olgeta na i multiplai, go waid igo long hap graun, kamap olgeta na i multiplai long en.”

original: Then God said to Noah and his sons with him,
translation: Na God i tok olsem long Noah na ol pikinini bilong em,

original: “Behold, I now establish My covenant with you and your descendants after you,
translation: Lukim, mi nau long stapim kovenaet bilong mi wantaim yu na generaesen bilong yu i kam bihain.

original: and with every living creature that was with you—the birds, the livestock, and every beast of the earth—every living thing that came out of the ark.
translation: Na wantaim olgeta kreatua i gat laif, pisin, animals graun, na olgeta binatang long graun, olgeta samting i gat laif i kam aut bilong ark, i bin stap wantaim yu.

original: And I establish My covenant with you: Never again will all life be cut off by the waters of a flood; never again will there be a flood to destroy the earth.”
translation: Mi statim covenant bilong me wantaim yu: Nogat yet, ol laip bai katim of aut na bagarapim graun long wara bilong wari ikam; nogat yet, bai no gat wari ikam i kam bagarapim graun.

original: And God said, “This is the sign of the covenant I am making between Me and you and every living creature with you, a covenant for all generations to come:
translation: Na God i tok, "Dispela em i sain bilong kovenaunt mipela i mekim bipela yu na olgeta kreatua na olgeta samting i gat laip na i kam wantaim yu, olgeta jenarason i kam bihain."

original: I have set My rainbow in the clouds, and it will be a sign of the covenant between Me and the earth.
translation: Mi bin plantim reinbo bilong mi long kloud, na em bai i kamap olsem senis bilong kaivoseri, olsem promis bilong mi long yu na graun.

original: Whenever I form clouds over the earth and the rainbow appears in the clouds,
translation: Wanpela taim mi mekim kolodus long graun na renbo i kamap long kolodus,

original: I will remember My covenant between Me and you and every living creature of every kind. Never again will the waters become a flood to destroy all life.
translation: Mi bai rimembim pakt long mipela, bipotaim yu na mi, olgeta kain kreatua i gat laip. Nogat taem gen ol wata bai kamap sem bilong dai i mekim ol man i dai.

original: And whenever the rainbow appears in the clouds, I will see it and remember the everlasting covenant between God and every living creature of every kind that is on the earth.”
translation: Na wain bow i kamap long claud, mi lukim i go, na mi rememberim pikinini covenant we i stap long taim tru, i go long antap long God na olgeta krea bilong eni kain we i stap long graun.

original: So God said to Noah, “This is the sign of the covenant that I have established between Me and every creature on the earth.”
translation: Soten God i tokim Noah, "Dispela em i sain bilong kaivakam we mi setim long mi na olgeta kreasen long graun."

original: The sons of Noah who came out of the ark were Shem, Ham, and Japheth. And Ham was the father of Canaan.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Noa i kam aut long arka em i Shem, Ham, na Jafet. Na Ham em papa bilong Kanaan.

original: These three were the sons of Noah, and from them the whole earth was populated.
translation: Tripela man i kaleba long Noa, na ol i kamapim mipela olgeta long graun.

original: Now Noah, a man of the soil, proceeded to plant a vineyard.
translation: Nau Nua, man bilong graun, em go plantim vineya.

original: But when he drank some of its wine, he became drunk and uncovered himself inside his tent.
translation: Bipo em dringim liklik win bilong en, na em bel hevi, tasol em kisim skelim bilong en i go insait long haus bilong en.

original: And Ham, the father of Canaan, saw his father’s nakedness and told his two brothers outside.
translation: Na Ham, papa bilong Kanaan, hamamasim ol father bilong em na tokim tu brata bilong en i stap outside.

original: Then Shem and Japheth took a garment and placed it across their shoulders, and walking backward, they covered their father’s nakedness. Their faces were turned away so that they did not see their father’s nakedness.
translation: Na Sem na Jafet i kisim wanpela klos, ol i putim klos ia naba skulda bilong ol, ol i go bek long wei baksaid, na ol i kova bes na nakes bilong papa bilong ol. Ol i lusim ai bilong ol, ol no lukim nakes bilong papa bilong ol, bilong respek.

original: When Noah awoke from his drunkenness and learned what his youngest son had done to him,
translation: Noa i kam bek gen long spirit bilong en na i save olsem pikinini bilong en i mekim wanem long em.

original: he said, “Cursed be Canaan! A servant of servants shall he be to his brothers.”
translation: Em i tok, "Kanan i no gutpela! Em bai wokman bilong wokman long brata bilong en."

original: He also declared: “Blessed be the LORD, the God of Shem! May Canaan be the servant of Shem.
translation: Em i tok tu olsem: “Gat bel isi Lod, God bilong Sem! Kanaan inap i wokman long Sem.

original: May God expand the territory of Japheth; may he dwell in the tents of Shem, and may Canaan be his servant.”
translation: Mipela husat i laikim God bai larim graun bilong Jafet i go stret olsem, em i mas stap long haus bilong Sem, na Canaan i mas warkim servisan bilong em.

original: After the flood, Noah lived 350 years.
translation: Bihaenim long banis, Noa i stap 350 yia.

original: So Noah lived a total of 950 years, and then he died.
translation: Noa i stap olgeta 950 yia, na em bai i dai.

original: This is the account of Noah’s sons Shem, Ham, and Japheth, who also had sons after the flood.
translation: Dispela em stori bilong pikinini Noah, yaia Sem, Ham, na Jafet, ol i gat pikinini tu bihainim famut.

original: The sons of Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, na Tiras.

original: The sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Gomer: Ashkenaz, Riphath, na Togarmah.

original: And the sons of Javan: Elishah, Tarshish, the Kittites, and the Rodanites.
translation: Na ol pikinini bilong Javan: Elishah, Tarshish, ol Kittites, na ol Rodanites.

original: From these, the maritime peoples separated into their territories, according to their languages, by clans within their nations.
translation: Long dispela, pipol long solwara i stap we i go daun long kantri bilong ol yet, ol i go daun long tok ples bilong ol, ol i go daun long clan bilong ol yet long nesen bilong ol.

original: The sons of Ham: Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Ham: Kus, Mitsraim, Put, na Kanaan.

original: The sons of Cush: Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah, and Sabteca. And the sons of Raamah: Sheba and Dedan.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Cush: Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah, na Sabteca. Na ol pikinini bilong Raamah: Sheba na Dedan.

original: Cush was the father of Nimrod, who began to be a mighty one on the earth.
translation: Kus em papa bilong Nimrod, hu i stat long kamap strongpela man long graun.

original: He was a mighty hunter before the LORD; so it is said, “Like Nimrod, a mighty hunter before the LORD.”
translation: Em i hanter bilong pawa long hap bilong LORD; olsem ol i tok, "Olsem Nimrod, hanter bilong pawa long hap bilong LORD."

original: His kingdom began in Babylon, Erech, Accad, and Calneh, in the land of Shinar.
translation: Paitim bilong em i kamap long Babilon, Erek, Akad, na Kalne, long lan bilong Shinar.

original: From that land he went forth into Assyria, where he built Nineveh, Rehoboth-Ir, Calah,
translation: Long graun em i go bekim bekim, na em i go long Asiria, na ol i bikim siti: Ninifa, Rehoboth-Ir, Kala.

original: and Resen, which is between Nineveh and the great city of Calah.
translation: Na Resen, em i stap bilo Nineveh na ples bilong Calah, em i gat bikpela namel.

original: Mizraim was the father of the Ludites, the Anamites, the Lehabites, the Naphtuhites,
translation: Mizraim em papa bilong Ludait, Anamait, Lehabait, na Naphtuhait,

original: the Pathrusites, the Casluhites (from whom the Philistines came), and the Caphtorites.
translation: Ol Pathrusites, ol Casluhites (husat i go bek long Filistia), na ol Caphtorites.

original: And Canaan was the father of Sidon his firstborn, and of the Hittites,
translation: Na Kanaan em papa bilong Sidon, pikinini namba wan bilong en, na bilong Hiti.

original: the Jebusites, the Amorites, the Girgashites,
translation: Ol Jebusi, ol Amori, ol Girgasiti,

original: the Hivites, the Arkites, the Sinites,
translation: Ol Hiviti, ol Arkaiti, ol Sinati,

original: the Arvadites, the Zemarites, and the Hamathites. Later the Canaanite clans were scattered,
translation: Ol Arvadites, ol Zemarites, na ol Hamathites. Bihain ol klan bilong Canaanite i go daris

original: and the borders of Canaan extended from Sidon toward Gerar as far as Gaza, and then toward Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboiim, as far as Lasha.
translation: Na borda bilong Kanana i go longwe, stat long Sidon, na i go long Gerar olsem ol i go kas long Gaza, na kamap long Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah, na Zeboiim, na go inap long Lasha.

original: These are the sons of Ham according to their clans, languages, lands, and nations.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Ham olsem ol i kamap long ol clan, tok ples, graun, na ol narion.

original: And sons were also born to Shem, the older brother of Japheth; Shem was the forefather of all the sons of Eber.
translation: Na ol pikinini i kam long Shem, em i bada bilong Japheth; Shem em i papa bilong tumbuna bilong olgeta pikinini bilong Eber.

original: The sons of Shem: Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud, and Aram.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Sem: Elam, Asiria, Afaksad, Lud, na Aram.

original: The sons of Aram: Uz, Hul, Gether, and Mash.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Aram: Uz, Hul, Gether, na Mash.

original: Arphaxad was the father of Shelah, and Shelah was the father of Eber.
translation: Arphaxad em i papa bilong Shelah, na Shelah em i papa bilong Eber.

original: Two sons were born to Eber: One was named Peleg, because in his days the earth was divided, and his brother was named Joktan.
translation: Tu hap bilong Eber i kam: wan i kolim Peleg, long taim bilong em, graun i parting, na brata bilong em i kolim Joktan.

original: And Joktan was the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
translation: Na Joktan em papa bilong Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,

original: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
translation: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah, ol nem bilong ples long stori bilong God.

original: Obal, Abimael, Sheba,
translation: Obal, Abimael, Siba, ol i stap long lis blo nem.

original: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All these were sons of Joktan.
translation: Ophir, Havilah, na Jobab. Ol i pikinini man bilong Joktan.

original: Their territory extended from Mesha to Sephar, in the eastern hill country.
translation: Olgeta graun bilong ol i go longwe Mesha na i kam inap long Sefara, long eastern hap kaunti.

original: These are the sons of Shem, according to their clans, languages, lands, and nations.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Sem, ol ikam long ol klan bilong ol, tok ples, graun, na ol narion.

original: All these are the clans of Noah’s sons, according to their generations and nations. From these the nations of the earth spread out after the flood.
translation: Ol klans bilong pikinini Noah, ol i kamap olsem genarashon na nem bilong ol narawan pes. Na ol narawan pes bilong graun i go dai waid igo bihain long dai flod.

original: Now the whole world had one language and a common form of speech.
translation: Olgeta kantri i gat wanpela tok, na ol i usim wanpela kindim tok.

original: And as people journeyed eastward, they found a plain in the land of Shinar and settled there.
translation: Na ol manmeri i go bek long-east, ol i kisim wanpela plein long kantri bilong Sinar na ol i stap we.

original: And they said to one another, “Come, let us make bricks and bake them thoroughly.” So they used brick instead of stone, and tar instead of mortar.
translation: Na ol i toklong ol yet, “Kam, mipela mekim biks na rausim ol i gutpela.” Ol i usim biks long hap bilong ston, na tar long hap bilong mota.

original: “Come,” they said, “let us build for ourselves a city with a tower that reaches to the heavens, that we may make a name for ourselves and not be scattered over the face of all the earth.”
translation: “Kam,” ol i tok, “mipela yet i go bilden kantri bilong mipela, na wanpela ta ni go ric long heven, mipela mekim nem bilong mipela i stap, na mipela no ken skatera ol abaot long fas bilong graun.”

original: Then the LORD came down to see the city and the tower that the sons of men were building.
translation: Na LORD i kam daun bilong lukim taun na tower ol man i mekim.

original: And the LORD said, “If they have begun to do this as one people speaking the same language, then nothing they devise will be beyond them.
translation: Papa God i tok, “Ol i stat long mekim dispela olsem wanpela gras, na ol i tokim wanpela tok ples, den nogat samting bai harim ol, bikos ol i ken mekim ol samting ol i tingim.”

original: Come, let Us go down and confuse their language, so that they will not understand one another’s speech.”
translation: Kam, yumui go daun na bagarapim toktok bilong ol, bilong ol i no inap understoodim tok bilong wan another.

original: So the LORD scattered them from there over the face of all the earth, and they stopped building the city.
translation: Na Bikpela i kirapim ol, ol i go wail long graun bilong olgeta, na ol i stap, ol i no ken buildim taun gen.

original: That is why it is called Babel, for there the LORD confused the language of the whole world, and from that place the LORD scattered them over the face of all the earth.
translation: Olegeda em i kolim Babel, wantaim LORD i birua toktok bilong olgeta hap graun, na LORD i sperim ol i go long hap graun.

original: This is the account of Shem. Two years after the flood, when Shem was 100 years old, he became the father of Arphaxad.
translation: Em i stori bilong Sem. Tupela yia bihain long taun olgeta i go daun, na em Sem i 100 year old yet, em i bikim papa bilong Arpakshad.

original: And after he had become the father of Arphaxad, Shem lived 500 years and had other sons and daughters.
translation: Na bihaen em i kamap papa bilong Arphaxad, Shem i stap 500 yia na i gat moa pikinini man na meri.

original: When Arphaxad was 35 years old, he became the father of Shelah.
translation: Taim Arpakshad i 35 yia olsem, em i bikim papa bilong Shelah.

original: And after he had become the father of Shelah, Arphaxad lived 403 years and had other sons and daughters.
translation: Na bihaen long em i kamap papa bilong Sileh, Apakshad i stap 403 yia na i gat ol narapela pikinini man na meri.

original: When Shelah was 30 years old, he became the father of Eber.
translation: Taim Shelah i go 30 yia, na em i bikim papa bilong Eber.

original: And after he had become the father of Eber, Shelah lived 403 years and had other sons and daughters.
translation: Na after em i kamap papa bilong Eber, Shelah i stap 403 yia na i gat ol narapela pikinini man na meri.

original: When Eber was 34 years old, he became the father of Peleg.
translation: Taim Eber i 34 yia olsem, na em i kamap papa bilong Peleg.

original: And after he had become the father of Peleg, Eber lived 430 years and had other sons and daughters.
translation: Na bihaen em i kamap papa bilong Peleg, Eba i stap 430 yia na i gat ol narapela pikinini man na pikinini meri.

original: When Peleg was 30 years old, he became the father of Reu.
translation: Taim Peleg i gat 30 yia, na em i kamap papa bilong Reu.

original: And after he had become the father of Reu, Peleg lived 209 years and had other sons and daughters.
translation: Na bihaen Peleg i kamap papa bilong Reu, em i stap 209 yia na i gat ol narapela pikinini man meri.

original: When Reu was 32 years old, he became the father of Serug.
translation: Taim Reu i 32 yia olsem, em i kamap papa bilong Serug.

original: And after he had become the father of Serug, Reu lived 207 years and had other sons and daughters.
translation: Na bihaen long em i kamap papa bilong Serug, Reu i stap 207 yia na i gat moa pikinini man na meri.

original: When Serug was 30 years old, he became the father of Nahor.
translation: Taim Serug em i 30 yia olsem, em i bianim papa bilong Nahor.

original: And after he had become the father of Nahor, Serug lived 200 years and had other sons and daughters.
translation: Na bihaen long Serug i kamap papa bilong Nahor, em i stap 200 yia na i gat moa pikinini man na meri.

original: When Nahor was 29 years old, he became the father of Terah.
translation: Nahor em i 29 yia na em bin kamap papa bilong Terah.

original: And after he had become the father of Terah, Nahor lived 119 years and had other sons and daughters.
translation: Na bihaen long Nahor i kamap papa bilong Terah, em i stap 119 yia na i gat ol narapela manmeri na pikinini.

original: When Terah was 70 years old, he became the father of Abram, Nahor, and Haran.
translation: Wanpela taim Terah em i 70 yia na em bai kamap papa bilong Abram, Nahor, na Haran.

original: This is the account of Terah. Terah became the father of Abram, Nahor, and Haran. And Haran became the father of Lot.
translation: Dispela em stori bilong Terah. Terah i kamap papa bilong Abram, Nahor, na Haran. Na Haran i kamap papa bilong Lot.

original: During his father Terah’s lifetime, Haran died in his native land, in Ur of the Chaldeans.
translation: Bilong taim papa Terah i ailan yet, Haran i dai i go bek long graun bilong em, long Ur bilong Kaldea.

original: And Abram and Nahor took wives for themselves. Abram’s wife was named Sarai, and Nahor’s wife was named Milcah; she was the daughter of Haran, who was the father of both Milcah and Iscah.
translation: Na Abram na Nahor i kisim meri bilong ol yet. Meri bilong Abram i kolim Sarai, na meri bilong Nahor i kolim Milcah; em i daughta bilong Haran, papa bilong Milcah na Iska.

original: But Sarai was barren; she had no children.
translation: Sarai i no save karim bebi, em i no gat pikinini.

original: And Terah took his son Abram, his grandson Lot son of Haran, and his daughter-in-law Sarai the wife of Abram, and they set out from Ur of the Chaldeans for the land of Canaan. But when they arrived in Haran, they settled there.
translation: Na Terah i kisim pikinini bilong em Abram, nipela bilong em Lot san bilong Haran, na meri bilong em Sarai, meri bilong Abram, na ol i go bek long ples Ur bilong Kaldea olsem ol i go long kantri Kanaan. Tasol wen ol i kamap long Haran, ol i stap davai long hap.

original: Terah lived 205 years, and he died in Haran.
translation: Terah i libe 205 yia, na em i dai long Haran.

original: Then the LORD said to Abram, “Leave your country, your kindred, and your father’s household, and go to the land I will show you.
translation: Na LORD i tokim Abram, “Lusim kantri bilong yu, ol famili bilong yu, na haus bilong papa bilong yu, na go long ples we mi bai soim yu.”

original: I will make you into a great nation, and I will bless you; I will make your name great, so that you will be a blessing.
translation: Mipela bai mekim yu ol i go pasin long wanpela bikpela nesen, mipela bai givim yu blessin, na mipela bai mekim nem bilong yu i go het long olgeta hap, olesem yu ken i go bekim blessin long ol narapela.

original: I will bless those who bless you and curse those who curse you; and all the families of the earth will be blessed through you.”
translation: Mi blesim olsem ol i blesim yu, na mi katim olsem ol i katim yu; na ol pisin bilong hap gras bilong erth bai i kamap strong na bles tu from yu.

original: So Abram departed, as the LORD had directed him, and Lot went with him. Abram was seventy-five years old when he left Haran.
translation: Abram i go bek olsem LORD i tokim em, na Lot i go wantaim em. Abram i 75 yia na em i lusim Haran.

original: And Abram took his wife Sarai, his nephew Lot, and all the possessions and people they had acquired in Haran, and set out for the land of Canaan. When they came to the land of Canaan,
translation: Na Abram i kisim meri bilong en Sarai, na nepew bilong en Lot, na ol samting bilong ol, na ol pipol, olgeta samting ol i winim long Haran, na i go long plaun bilong Kanaan. Na wen ol i kam long plaun bilong Kanaan,

original: Abram traveled through the land as far as the site of the Oak of Moreh at Shechem. And at that time the Canaanites were in the land.
translation: Abram i go bek long kantri, long wei em i kam kas long ples we Oak of Moreh i stap, long Shechem. Na long taem ya, Kananaet i stap long kantri.

original: Then the LORD appeared to Abram and said, “I will give this land to your offspring.” So Abram built an altar there to the LORD, who had appeared to him.
translation: Bikpela i kam ap long Abram na tokim em, "Mi bai givim kantri dispela long pikinini bilong yu." Na Abram i bikim wanpela altia hap ia long Bikpela, nau em i kam ap long em.

original: From there Abram moved on to the hill country east of Bethel and pitched his tent, with Bethel to the west and Ai to the east. There he built an altar to the LORD, and he called on the name of the LORD.
translation: Long hap em Abram i go bek long kantri hailans east bilong Betel na i putim tent bilong en, wantaim Betel i stap long wes na Ai i stap long ist. Long hap em, Abram i wokim ston bilong betel long LORD, na i kolim nem bilong LORD.

original: And Abram journeyed on toward the Negev.
translation: Na Abram i go bek long wei, i kamap long sait bilong Negev.

original: Now there was a famine in the land. So Abram went down to Egypt to live there for a while because the famine was severe.
translation: Bai kai kisim i kam, na Abiram i go daun long Ejip bai stap long hap bilong en, bikos kai kisim i strongpela.

original: As he was about to enter Egypt, he said to his wife Sarai, “Look, I know that you are a beautiful woman,
translation: Em i stap kam long Egypt, em tokim meri bilong em Sarai, “Look, mi save olsem yu meri sweetpela,”

original: and when the Egyptians see you, they will say, ‘This is his wife.’ Then they will kill me but will let you live.
translation: Na wanpela taim Egipshan i lukim yu, ol i stap tok, 'Em i meri bilong em.' Ol i kilim mi, tasol ol i givim yu laip.

original: Please say you are my sister, so that I will be treated well for your sake, and on account of you my life will be spared.”
translation: Yu tok olsem yu bilong mi susa, nau bai mi kisim gutpela karem long stret bilong yu, na laif bilong mi bai i sparim bikim yu.

original: So when Abram entered Egypt, the Egyptians saw that the woman was very beautiful.
translation: Taim Abram go insait long Ijip, pipel Ijip ilukim meri i kamap strongpela swit.

original: When Pharaoh’s officials saw Sarai, they commended her to him, and she was taken into the palace of Pharaoh.
translation: Taim ofisala bilong Faraon i lukim Sarai, ol i givim tok bilong em yet na givim go long en, na em i kam insait long haus bilong Faraon.

original: He treated Abram well on her account, and Abram acquired sheep and cattle, male and female donkeys, menservants and maidservants, and camels.
translation: Em i givim Abram gutpela samting olgeta long hap bilong em, na Abram i kamap na kisim sip, bulmakau, male na female donki, man servist, meri servist, na kemel.

original: The LORD, however, afflicted Pharaoh and his household with severe plagues because of Abram’s wife Sarai.
translation: Bikos LORD i tok olsem, em i bringim siki long Farao na husat i stap wantaim em long ol pekpek sickness bilong meri bilong Abram, Sarai.

original: So Pharaoh summoned Abram and asked, “What have you done to me? Why didn’t you tell me she was your wife?
translation: Faraon i kolim Abram na tokim em, "Yu mekim wanem olsem long mi? Yu no tokim mipela long meri bilong yu?"

original: Why did you say, ‘She is my sister,’ so that I took her as my wife? Now then, here is your wife. Take her and go!”
translation: Olsem wanem yu tok, 'Em i susa bilong mi,' na mi kisim em olsem meri bilong mi? Nau, em meri bilong yu, yumi harim. Kisim em i go!

original: Then Pharaoh gave his men orders concerning Abram, and they sent him away with his wife and all his possessions.
translation: Na Faraon i givim tok bilong papa long ol kaman bilong en, na ol i rausim Abram, wantaim meri bilong en na olgeta samting bilong en.
