original: but when I screamed for help, he left his cloak beside me and ran out of the house.”
translation: Bareikedai mi kirap strong long help, em i lusim laplap bilong en besaid me na ranawe long haus.

original: When his master heard the story his wife told him, saying, “This is what your slave did to me,” he burned with anger.
translation: Taim mastta i harim stori meri bilong en i tokim em, olsem, "Dispela wokman i mekim olsem long mi," mastta i birua wantaim bel hevi.

original: So Joseph’s master took him and had him thrown into the prison where the king’s prisoners were confined. While Joseph was there in the prison,
translation: Masta bilong Joseph i kisim em na i pilim em i go long haus kuk wahan ol prisner bilong king i stap. Wail em Joseph i stap long haus kuk,

original: the LORD was with him and extended kindness to him, granting him favor in the eyes of the prison warden.
translation: Bikpela i stap wantaim em, na i givim em gutpela hap, long ai bilong kiap bilong kalabus.

original: And the warden put all the prisoners under Joseph’s care, so that he was responsible for all that was done in the prison.
translation: Na ofisa bilong kalabus i givim karem ol kalabus long Joseph, na em i mas kasal long ol samting ol i mekim long kalabus, long karem bilong prisin.

original: The warden did not concern himself with anything under Joseph’s care, because the LORD was with Joseph and gave him success in whatever he did.
translation: Ofisa bilong kisim kek i no bin tokim long eni samting i stap unders Joseph, bikos LORD i stap wantaim Joseph na i givim em win long olgeta samting em mekim.

original: Some time later, the king’s cupbearer and baker offended their master, the king of Egypt.
translation: Olfala taim igo pinis, man i lukauta wain bilong king na man i mekim ka bilong king bilong Ijip ibin givim ofisa long ol, na ol i bagarap long ai bilong king.

original: Pharaoh was angry with his two officers, the chief cupbearer and the chief baker,
translation: Faraon i masalai wantaim tupela ofisa bilong en, em yet man i lukautim kapa bilong Faraon na man i mekim bret bilong Faraon.

original: and imprisoned them in the house of the captain of the guard, the same prison where Joseph was confined.
translation: Na ol i kilim ol long haus bilong kapten bilong gadi, olsem sampela kalabus we Joseph i go daun long em.

original: The captain of the guard assigned them to Joseph, and he became their personal attendant. After they had been in custody for some time,
translation: Kapten bilong gadi i givim wok long Joseph, na em i kam ap long ol sem. Ol i stap insait long taim, na Joseph i wok olsem man i help ol.

original: both of these men—the Egyptian king’s cupbearer and baker, who were being held in the prison—had a dream on the same night, and each dream had its own meaning.
translation: Ol tu man nau, man we i lukautim kopa bilong king bilong Egypt na man we i mekim ka, ol i stap insait long haus kuk, na ol i bin kisim draim long nait ikam, na draim bilong ol i gat toktok bilong en.

original: When Joseph came to them in the morning, he saw that they were distraught.
translation: Wanpela taim Yusuf i kam klostu long ol long moning, em i lukim ol i stap strong inap long sorow.

original: So he asked the officials of Pharaoh who were in custody with him in his master’s house, “Why are your faces so downcast today?”
translation: Em askim ofisala bilong Faraon ol i stap wantaim im long hap insait long haus bilong bos, "Wai pes bilong yu ol i go daun olsem?"

original: “We both had dreams,” they replied, “but there is no one to interpret them.” Then Joseph said to them, “Don’t interpretations belong to God? Tell me your dreams.”
translation: Mipela istap long dreim, tupela, olegomen. Ino gat man i ken interpretim ol. Joseph hamamas long dispela, na tokim ol, Interpretation i bilong God tasol? Yumi tokim dreim bilong yu, na mipela bai harim we i min.

original: So the chief cupbearer told Joseph his dream: “In my dream there was a vine before me,
translation: Na chief cupbearer i tokim Joseph long draem bilong en: "Long taim bai mi save draem, na mi lukim wanpela wain bin stanap biforai mi".

original: and on the vine were three branches. As it budded, its blossoms opened and its clusters ripened into grapes.
translation: Long vine, em i gat tripela branis. Taim em i kamap nau, flora bilong en i opim na bun bilong en i rip olsem drai na kamap wine.

original: Pharaoh’s cup was in my hand, and I took the grapes, squeezed them into his cup, and placed the cup in his hand.”
translation: Kap bilong Pharaoh i stap long han bilong mi, na mi kisim grape, mipela pisim grape, mia putim ol i go insait long kap, na mi putim kap i go long han bilong em.

original: Joseph replied, “This is the interpretation: The three branches are three days.
translation: Yusuf i tokim, "Dispela em i tok bilong interpretetion: Tripla branis ol i kamap olsem tripla de."

original: Within three days Pharaoh will lift up your head and restore your position. You will put Pharaoh’s cup in his hand, just as you did when you were his cupbearer.
translation: Bai yumi go long three dei, Faraon bai kam bekim hed bilong yu na bringim bekim pes bilong yu. Yu bai putim kap bilong Faraon long han bilong em, olsem yu bin mekim bifo wok bilong man i lukaut kap long haus kot bilong Faraon.

original: But when it goes well for you, please remember me and show me kindness by mentioning me to Pharaoh, that he might bring me out of this prison.
translation: Wewan tru long yu, stap strong, yumusim olsem na yumi rememba mipela, yu sutim bel haiwet long mipela, tokim olsem long Pharaoh long ai bilong yu, inap em i kirapim mipela na kamautim mipela long nambis.

original: For I was kidnapped from the land of the Hebrews, and even here I have done nothing for which they should have put me in this dungeon.”
translation: Long taim bifo, ol i kisim me i go bai force from graun bilong Hebu, na hia, mi no wokim sampela samting nogut, tasol ol i putim me insait long hap lotu.

original: When the chief baker saw that the interpretation was favorable, he said to Joseph, “I too had a dream: There were three baskets of white bread on my head.
translation: Taim bikpela bakaa i lukim toksik i kamap strong, em i tokim Joseph, "Mi tu i gat wanpela dopi: Ol basket tri bilong bret hap ret i stap long hed bilong mi."

original: In the top basket were all sorts of baked goods for Pharaoh, but the birds were eating them out of the basket on my head.”
translation: Longpela baket i go antap, em i gat ol samting bilong kukim bilong Pharaoh, tasol ol pisin i kaikai pinis ol samting bilong kukim, na baket ya em i stap long hed bilong mi.

original: Joseph replied, “This is the interpretation: The three baskets are three days.
translation: Yusuf i tok bek, "Dispela em i tok pkinini: Ol basket tripela i minitim tripela de."

original: Within three days Pharaoh will lift off your head and hang you on a tree. Then the birds will eat the flesh of your body.”
translation: Inap tripe de pe, Faraon bai i kisim hed bilong yu na putim i hap long diwai, na ol pisin bai kaikaim kus bilong bodi bilong yu.

original: On the third day, which was Pharaoh’s birthday, he held a feast for all his officials, and in their presence he lifted up the heads of the chief cupbearer and the chief baker.
translation: Long long tri dei, dei bilong Faraoh i kam, em i mekim kaikai bilong en long ai bilong ol ofisa, na em i kisim hed bilong man i lukautim kava na man i mekim kaikai, ol i kisim hed bilong ol i go hap.

original: Pharaoh restored the chief cupbearer to his position, so that he once again placed the cup in Pharaoh’s hand.
translation: Faraon i bringim bek chief cupbearer long ples bilong en, na em i putim kap long han bilong Faraon gen.

original: But Pharaoh hanged the chief baker, just as Joseph had described to them in his interpretation.
translation: Na Pharaoh i hangim bikpela baek man, olsem Joseph i tokim ol long toktok bilong en.

original: The chief cupbearer, however, did not remember Joseph; he forgot all about him.
translation: Bikpela man i kam long drai kava, ol i no rememba Joseph, em i lusim Joseph long bek.

original: After two full years had passed, Pharaoh had a dream: He was standing beside the Nile,
translation: Bihaenpela tupela yia i go pinis, Faraon i kirapim wanpela tumbuna: Em i stap klostu long Nile

original: when seven cows, sleek and well-fed, came up from the river and began to graze among the reeds.
translation: Wanpela taim, sevenpela bulmakau i kam bek long namba wan river, ol i stong na i kamap strong, na ol i go pas long sait bilong ol reeds, na ol i stat kaikai gras.

original: After them, seven other cows, sickly and thin, came up from the Nile and stood beside the well-fed cows on the bank of the river.
translation: Bihaen long ol, seven narakain bulmakau, sik na skin, kam up long Nil na stanasisit besaida long strongpela bulmakau long bank bilong wara.

original: And the cows that were sickly and thin devoured the seven sleek, well-fed cows. Then Pharaoh woke up,
translation: Na bulmakau i no strong, na i no gat planti flesh, ol i kaikai na kilim sevenpela bulmakau i gat planti flesh, na ol i look sharis. Na King bilong Ijip em i wakem up.

original: but he fell back asleep and dreamed a second time: Seven heads of grain, plump and ripe, came up on one stalk.
translation: Be em i go bek long slip, na em i drim strong moning gen: Seven hed bilong grain, ol i strong na mature, olgeta i kam antap long wanpela stalk.

original: After them, seven other heads of grain sprouted, thin and scorched by the east wind.
translation: Bihaen long ol, seven hap moa hed bilong graun i kam aut, na ol i no gat mani flesh, na ol bin katim olgeta from win bilong east.

original: And the thin heads of grain swallowed up the seven plump, ripe ones. Then Pharaoh awoke and realized it was a dream.
translation: Na hed bilong graun i go daun i kaikai sevenpela hed bilong graun i pulap, i rip. Na Pharaoh em i wok long narapela taim na em i save olsem em bin harim drem.

original: In the morning his spirit was troubled, so he summoned all the magicians and wise men of Egypt. Pharaoh told them his dreams, but no one could interpret them for him.
translation: Long moning, spirit bilong em i bin kros, na em i kallisim ol saman na ol man bilong save long Egip. Faraon i tokim ol long ol drim bilong en, tasol nogat wanman ina save givim meaning long ol draim bilong en.

original: Then the chief cupbearer said to Pharaoh, “Today I recall my failures.
translation: Na kep bilong kopa i tokim Pharaoh, "Tude mi rimembirim ol samting nogut mi mekim."

original: Pharaoh was once angry with his servants, and he put me and the chief baker in the custody of the captain of the guard.
translation: Faraon em i bin pasal long servants bilong en, na em i putim mi na kap baka long hap bilong kaptin bilong gadi.

original: One night both the chief baker and I had dreams, and each dream had its own meaning.
translation: Wan nait, bos bilong bakesan na mi yet, yumitupela i go long stap i kisim tok bilong spirit, na nipela tok bilong spirit em i gat mining bilong em yet.

original: Now a young Hebrew was there with us, a servant of the captain of the guard. We told him our dreams and he interpreted them for us individually.
translation: Nau wanpela yong Hebrew i stap wantaim mipela, em i servis man bilong kapten bilong gadien. Mipela talem em tok bilong mipela dreims, na em tokplain olgeta long mipela wanwan.

original: And it happened to us just as he had interpreted: I was restored to my position, and the other man was hanged.”
translation: Na em i kamap long mipela olsem na: mi go bek long ples bilong mi, na man narakain i go hang.

original: So Pharaoh sent for Joseph, who was quickly brought out of the dungeon. After he had shaved and changed his clothes, he went in before Pharaoh.
translation: Na Faraon i kirapim Yosef, na Yosep i kamaut long hole bilong prison. Yosep i kisim sikis na chanim klos, na bihain Yosep i go insait long haus bilong Faraon.

original: Pharaoh said to Joseph, “I had a dream, and no one can interpret it. But I have heard it said of you that when you hear a dream you can interpret it.”
translation: Faraon i tokim Jozef, "Mi bin hariam wanpela dreme, nogat man i ken toktok long em. Mi bin harim ol i tok long yu, olsem yu harim dreme, yu save toktok long em."

original: “I myself cannot do it,” Joseph replied, “but God will give Pharaoh a sound answer.”
translation: “Mi maself no ina save mekim,” Joseph i tok, “tasol God bai givim Pharaoh wanpela klia toktok.”

original: Then Pharaoh said to Joseph: “In my dream I was standing on the bank of the Nile,
translation: Na Pharaoh i tokim Joseph: “Long draim bilong mi, mi bin stap we long banis bilong Nail.

original: when seven cows, well-fed and sleek, came up from the river and began to graze among the reeds.
translation: Wanpela taim, sevenpela bulmakau i kam up long nariva, strong na gutpela, na i jonjo namel long graun bilong ripos.

original: After them, seven other cows—sickly, ugly, and thin—came up. I have never seen such ugly cows in all the land of Egypt!
translation: Bihaen long ol, sevén narpa bulmakau—sik i go daun, bagarap, na skin i go insait—i kam bek. Mi no see yet olsem bagarap long lain bilong Ijip!

original: Then the thin, ugly cows devoured the seven well-fed cows that were there first.
translation: Na kau ol i gat skinkin na yelo, ol i kaikai sevencow narakain stap, ol i gutpela.

original: When they had devoured them, however, no one could tell that they had done so; their appearance was as ugly as it had been before. Then I awoke.
translation: Taim ol i kaikai pinis, nogat wanpela i save oli kamap namani; ol i stap olsem bilong bipo, nogat senis. Na mi kam conscious.

original: In my dream I also saw seven heads of grain, plump and ripe, growing on a single stalk.
translation: Long taim bilong mi stap slip, na mi lukim seven hed bilong graun, ol i karim growe narakai na maut, na ol i growe long wanpela stalk tasol.

original: After them, seven other heads of grain sprouted—withered, thin, and scorched by the east wind.
translation: Bihaen long ol, seven narapela hed bilong graun i kam kot — ol i bin drai, i no thick, na i bin katim olgeta long tokples bilong hardness na jedjment.

original: And the thin heads of grain swallowed the seven plump ones. I told this dream to the magicians, but no one could explain it to me.”
translation: Na hed bilong grain i kamap narak na kaivim seven hed bilong grain i stap strong. Mi tokim dispela stori bilong mi long ol man bilong majik, tasol inap long ol i givim mi saveman long em.

original: At this, Joseph said to Pharaoh, “The dreams of Pharaoh are one and the same. God has revealed to Pharaoh what He is about to do.
translation: Long taim i kam, Yusuf i tokim Faraon, “Siporo bilong Faraon em i wan wan tasol. God i sharakolim Faraon olsem bai hem i mekim.

original: The seven good cows are seven years, and the seven ripe heads of grain are seven years. The dreams have the same meaning.
translation: Sivenpela gutpela bulmakau em i rapela sivenpela yia, na sivenpela ripol hed bilong graun em i rapela sivenpela yia. Ol dispel i gat wanem samting.

original: Moreover, the seven thin, ugly cows that came up after them are seven years, and so are the seven worthless heads of grain scorched by the east wind—they are seven years of famine.
translation: Na sip (7) kuk bilong kok, kuk i no gat gris, i kam behain long ol, em i sikis (7) yia, na sip (7) hed bilong graun, i no gat valu, i bin katim na kraim na bruk long win bilong solwara, em tu i sikis (7) yia bilong bikpela hangre.

original: It is just as I said to Pharaoh: God has shown Pharaoh what He is about to do.
translation: Em i stret olsem na: God i sho Faraon olgeta samting em bai mekim.

original: Behold, seven years of great abundance are coming throughout the land of Egypt,
translation: Lukim, sipara yia bilong bikpela plenti i kam bek long olgeta hap bilong kantri bilong Egypt.

original: but seven years of famine will follow them. Then all the abundance in the land of Egypt will be forgotten, and the famine will devastate the land.
translation: Na wei yia i go bek gen long seven yia, bai taim bilong hangre i kam, olgeta plenti i stap long kantri bilong Ijip, olgeta man i forgetim, na hangre bai bagarapim kantri.

original: The abundance in the land will not be remembered, since the famine that follows it will be so severe.
translation: Plenti i kamap long kantri, ol i no ken rememba, wantaim kaikai i paul long taim bipo, em i strongpela tru.

original: Moreover, because the dream was given to Pharaoh in two versions, the matter has been decreed by God, and He will carry it out shortly.
translation: Na dispela dream i kam long Pharaoh bilong em dispensel i kam long Pharaoh long tupela wais, olsem mater i go daun olsem God i tok, na Em bai mekim olsem planti tumas.

original: Now, therefore, Pharaoh should look for a discerning and wise man and set him over the land of Egypt.
translation: Nau, olsem nau, Faraon i mas suskim na lukim man i gat save na i bikpela, na putim em i go bos bilong kantri Egypt.

original: Let Pharaoh take action and appoint commissioners over the land to take a fifth of the harvest of Egypt during the seven years of abundance.
translation: Pharaoh mas wokim na anatem ol komishona long kantri, oli save kisim 1/5 bilong ka long harves bilong Egypt long naitpela yia bilong plenti.

original: Under the authority of Pharaoh, let them collect all the excess food from these good years, that they may come and lay up the grain to be preserved as food in the cities.
translation: Bilong autoriti bilong Pharaoh, oli mas kisim ol kaikai i stap yet, na oli go paitim graun, ili stap olsem kaikai long ol ples.

original: This food will be a reserve for the land during the seven years of famine to come upon the land of Egypt. Then the country will not perish in the famine.”
translation: Dispela kaikai bai i stap olsem samting bilong save long naitenpela yia bilong taim bilong hangre i kam long kantri bilong Ijip, na kantri ibin Strong ol i no inap dai long taim bilong hangre.”

original: This proposal pleased Pharaoh and all his officials.
translation: Dispela tok bung i laikim Pharaoh na ol ofisala bilong en.

original: So Pharaoh asked them, “Can we find anyone like this man, in whom the Spirit of God abides?”
translation: Faraon i askim ol, "Inap finisim narapela man olsem dispela man, we Spirut bilong God i stap insait long en?"

original: Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Since God has made all this known to you, there is no one as discerning and wise as you.
translation: Na Pharaoh i tokim Joseph, "Bikos God i bin givim yu save long dispela, i no gat man arapm na wis olsem yu."

original: You shall be in charge of my house, and all my people are to obey your commands. Only with regard to the throne will I be greater than you.”
translation: Yu bai bos bilong haus bilong mi, na ol pipol bilong mi yet oli mas obeiim tok bilong yu. Tasol long stori bilong thrown, mi yet bai stap bam bos long yu.

original: Pharaoh also told Joseph, “I hereby place you over all the land of Egypt.”
translation: Faraon i tokim Joseph, “Mi go na putim yu long olgeta graun bilong Ejip.”

original: Then Pharaoh removed the signet ring from his finger, put it on Joseph’s finger, clothed him in garments of fine linen, and placed a gold chain around his neck.
translation: Na Faraon kisim rin bilong autograf, putim long finga bilong Joseph, kisim klos bilong linen bilong kwik, putim long skin bilong em, na putim chai bilong gol long nek bilong em.

original: He had Joseph ride in his second chariot, with men calling out before him, “Bow the knee!” So he placed him over all the land of Egypt.
translation: Em bai putim Joseph sindaun long nambatu kareta bilong bikpela man, wantaim ol man i singaut befò bem, "Bilipim knee!" Na em bai putim hem i go olgeta ples long Ejip.

original: And Pharaoh declared to Joseph, “I am Pharaoh, but without your permission, no one in all the land of Egypt shall lift his hand or foot.”
translation: Na Pharaoh i tokim olsem long Joseph, "Mi em Pharaoh, tasol bikos yu, nogat man i go long kantri bilong Ijip inap strongim han o leg."

original: Pharaoh gave Joseph the name Zaphenath-paneah, and he gave him Asenath daughter of Potiphera, priest of On, to be his wife. And Joseph took charge of all the land of Egypt.
translation: Faraon i givim Joseph wanpela nupela nem, Zafenat-Paneah, na em i givim em Asenati meri bilong Potifera, prist bilong On, olsem meri bilong em. Na Joseph i kamap bos bilong olgeta graun bilong Ijip.

original: Now Joseph was thirty years old when he entered the service of Pharaoh king of Egypt. And Joseph left Pharaoh’s presence and traveled throughout the land of Egypt.
translation: Nau Yusuf i 30 yia olsem wanem taim em i go insait long sarvis bilong Faraon king bilong Egip. Na Yusuf i lusim prisens bilong Faraon na i wakabaut long wel hariap bilong grin bilong Egip.

original: During the seven years of abundance, the land brought forth bountifully.
translation: Long seven yia bilong plenti, graun i bringim forth longweiy.

original: During those seven years, Joseph collected all the excess food in the land of Egypt and stored it in the cities. In every city he laid up the food from the fields around it.
translation: Long dispela seven yia, Yosep i kam bikim ol ka we i over long kantri bilong Ijip na i putim aside long ol taun. Long every taun, i putim ka we i kam long gras bilong planim kai bubu i putim long en.

original: So Joseph stored up grain in such abundance, like the sand of the sea, that he stopped keeping track of it; for it was beyond measure.
translation: Na Yusif i save ka long planti, olsem san bilong solwara, na em i lusim countim; bikos i go pasis long hap bilong measure.

original: Before the years of famine arrived, two sons were born to Joseph by Asenath daughter of Potiphera, priest of On.
translation: Bipo yia bilong hangre i kam, tu pilai i kam i stap long Joseph long Asenat, dau bilong Potifera, pries bilong On.

original: Joseph named the firstborn Manasseh, saying, “God has made me forget all my hardship and all my father’s household.”
translation: Yusuf i givim nem Manase long pikinini bilong en i kam first, ol i tok, “God i mekim mi lusim taitim na hardsip, na mi lusim haus bilong papa.”

original: And the second son he named Ephraim, saying, “God has made me fruitful in the land of my affliction.”
translation: Na dina son, em i givim nem Ephraim, olsem em i tok, "God i mekim mi barak long graun bilong sore na pain bilong mi."

original: When the seven years of abundance in the land of Egypt came to an end,
translation: Wanem taim seven yia bilong plenti i kamap pinis long lan bilong Ijip,

original: the seven years of famine began, just as Joseph had said. And although there was famine in every country, there was food throughout the land of Egypt.
translation: Sikis yia bilong hangre ibin kamap olsem Yosep ibin tok, na hangre ibin harim ap long olgeta kantri, tasol ka ibin i stap long olgeta graun bilong Egip.

original: When extreme hunger came to all the land of Egypt and the people cried out to Pharaoh for food, he told all the Egyptians, “Go to Joseph and do whatever he tells you.”
translation: Taim bilong bikpela hangre kamap long kantri bilong Egyptian, na ol pipol kisim aut long Faraon long kaikai, em tokim ol Egyptian, “Go long Josep na wokim ol samting em i tok.”

original: When the famine had spread over all the land, Joseph opened up all the storehouses and sold grain to the Egyptians; for the famine was severe in the land of Egypt.
translation: Taim famin i go daun ol ples, Joseph i opim ol ples bilong ka, na i selim ka long ol Egyptian; famin i strongpela tru long Egip.

original: And every nation came to Joseph in Egypt to buy grain, because the famine was severe over all the earth.
translation: Na olgeta nesen i kam long Joseph long Egip bai baim ka, wantaim famin i strong tumas long olgeta graun.

original: When Jacob learned that there was grain in Egypt, he said to his sons, “Why are you staring at one another?”
translation: Taim Yakob harim olsem ka i stap long Ijip, na em i tokim ol pikinini bilong em, “Wai yupela i stap daulo long lukim wanano?”

original: “Look,” he added, “I have heard that there is grain in Egypt. Go down there and buy some for us, so that we may live and not die.”
translation: Lukim, mipela harim tok long Ijip ol i gat ka. Go daun na baim ka bilong mekim mipela i stap na no dai.

original: So ten of Joseph’s brothers went down to buy grain from Egypt.
translation: Tenpela bratha bilong Yosef i go daun long Ijip ol i go baim ka.

original: But Jacob did not send Joseph’s brother Benjamin with his brothers, for he said, “I am afraid that harm might befall him.”
translation: Jakob i no salim Benjamin brata bilong Joseph wantaim brata bilong en, olsem em i tok, "Mi pem na bagarap ina kam long en."

original: So the sons of Israel were among those who came to buy grain, since the famine had also spread to the land of Canaan.
translation: Na ol pikinini bilong Isrel i kam bai ka, bikos bikpela hangre i go ol abaot long kantri bilong Kanaan.

original: Now Joseph was the ruler of the land; he was the one who sold grain to all its people. So when his brothers arrived, they bowed down before him with their faces to the ground.
translation: Yosef em i bikpela bos bilong kantri; em i salim ka bilong kamdaun long ol pipol bilong kantri. Na taim brata bilong em i kam, ol i kisim han bilong go daun bifo em, ol i pakim ai bilong ol long graun.

original: And when Joseph saw his brothers, he recognized them, but he treated them as strangers and spoke harshly to them. “Where have you come from?” he asked. “From the land of Canaan,” they replied. “We are here to buy food.”
translation: Na Yusuf i lukim brata bilong em, em i save olsem nau, tasol em i wari long ol na em i tok strong long ol. Em i askim ol, “Yu kam bek long wei?” Ol i ansa, “Bikos yumai kam long kantri Canaan.” Ol i tok, “Mipela i kam bek long baim ka.”

original: Although Joseph recognized his brothers, they did not recognize him.
translation: Masusi Joseph i save ol brotha bilong em, tasol ol i no save em.

original: Joseph remembered his dreams about them and said, “You are spies! You have come to see if our land is vulnerable.”
translation: Yusuf i rememba ol tok bilong em yet, na em i tok, "Yupela i spia! Yupela i kam lukim olgeta kantri bilong mipela i no nap."

original: “Not so, my lord,” they replied. “Your servants have come to buy food.
translation: Nogat olsem, papa bilong yu, mipela i kam baim ka.

original: We are all sons of one man. Your servants are honest men, not spies.”
translation: Mipela ol i pikinini bilong wanpela man. Serviseman bilong yu em ol man i kamap strong, nogat spia.

original: “No,” he told them. “You have come to see if our land is vulnerable.”
translation: “Nogat,” em i tokim ol, “ Yus save kam lukim gras bilong yumi em i no strong.”

original: But they answered, “Your servants are twelve brothers, the sons of one man in the land of Canaan. The youngest is now with our father, and one is no more.”
translation: Ol i bekim tok, "Nambawan servis man bilong yumi ol i twelve brata, ol pikinini bilong wan man long kantri bilong Kanaan. Nupela pikinini i stap na stap wantaim papa bilong yumi, na wan i no inap."

original: Then Joseph declared, “Just as I said, you are spies!
translation: Na Yusuf i mekim olsem, "Olsem na mi bin tok, yupela i stap long hap bilong spia!"

original: And this is how you will be tested: As surely as Pharaoh lives, you shall not leave this place unless your youngest brother comes here.
translation: Na dispela em i go long yu: Olsem Faraoni i stap yet, yu no inap go we long hap bilong yu, maski sapos yu no bringim pikinini brotha bilong yu i kam hia.

original: Send one of your number to get your brother; the rest of you will be confined so that the truth of your words may be tested. If they are untrue, then as surely as Pharaoh lives, you are spies!”
translation: Sindaun wanpela long yu, ol narapela bai i go long haus kuk, na bai yusim tingting bilong yu em i tru, bikos em bai i trian. I sapos olsem tasol, olsem Faraon i stap, strongpela tru, yu hamas ol man i go lusim ai bilong ol, yupela i spies!

original: So Joseph imprisoned them for three days,
translation: Na Yusuf i kisim ol i go long hap, i kilim ol long tripe de.

original: and on the third day he said to them, “I fear God. So do this and you will live:
translation: Na long dei thrid em i tokim ol, "Mipela i gat respek long God. Olsem na yu mas mekim dispela, nau yu bai stap: mipela pekam tu God.

original: If you are honest, leave one of your brothers in custody while the rest of you go and take back grain to relieve the hunger of your households.
translation: Sapos yu triu, lekim wanpela brata bilong yu i go daun long hes, na yumi ol i go na kisim bek grain bilong putim bel bilong husat i go daun long hous.

original: Then bring your youngest brother to me so that your words can be verified, that you may not die.” And to this they consented.
translation: Kisim na bai bringim pikinini brotha bilong yu i kam long me, bilong makim ol tok bilong yu i kamap tru, bilong yu no ken dai. Na ol i givim agrikman long dispela.

original: Then they said to one another, “Surely we are being punished because of our brother. We saw his anguish when he pleaded with us, but we would not listen. That is why this distress has come upon us.”
translation: Ol tok stret long ol yet, “Mipela i penalti bekim brother bilong mipela. Ol lukim hen i sori tru long taim em i prarim long mipela, tapi bai yumupla no lisin. Nambis, dispela trabel i kam long mipela.”

original: And Reuben responded, “Didn’t I tell you not to sin against the boy? But you would not listen. Now we must account for his blood!”
translation: Na Ruben i bekim tok, "Inap mi tokim yu olsem, no ken sin long boy ya? Yu no harim, na nau yumi mas kisim bek long blod bilong em!"

original: They did not realize that Joseph understood them, since there was an interpreter between them.
translation: Ol i no save long Joseph i save long tok bilong ol, wantaim wanpela man i ken interpretim tok long ol.

original: And he turned away from them and wept. When he turned back and spoke to them, he took Simeon from them and had him bound before their eyes.
translation: Na em i tulim i go bek long ol na kalap. Em i kam bek gen, tokim ol, na ol i kisim Simeon, bindim em long ai bilong ol.

original: Then Joseph gave orders to fill their bags with grain, to return each man’s silver to his sack, and to give them provisions for their journey. This order was carried out,
translation: Na Josep i givim tok olsem: "Ol mas pilim bek bilong ol long kaukau, givim bek silva bilong ol man i go bak insait long bek bilong en, na givim kaikai long ol long rod bilong ol." Tok oli givim em i wokim,

original: and they loaded the grain on their donkeys and departed.
translation: Ol i save karim ka long wei bilong ol donki na ol i go.

original: At the place where they lodged for the night, one of them opened his sack to get feed for his donkey, and he saw his silver in the mouth of the sack.
translation: Long ples ol i stap na katikati bilong nait, wanpela blo ol i opim sak bilong en i go bekim ka bilong donki bilong en, na em i lukim silva bilong en i stap insait long maus bilong sak.

original: “My silver has been returned!” he said to his brothers. “It is here in my sack.” Their hearts sank, and trembling, they turned to one another and said, “What is this that God has done to us?”
translation: “Siliva bilong me i kam bek,” em tokim brata bilong en. “Em i stap hia long bag bilong me.” Hati bilong ol i pakim bel, na ol i skulim i go, ol turnim asde long ol yet, ol tok, “Dispela Bikpela i mekim wanem long yumi?”

original: When they reached their father Jacob in the land of Canaan, they described to him all that had happened to them:
translation: Taim ol i kam apostim papa Jakob long grun bilong Kanaan, ol i tokim em olgeta samting i bin hapen long ol.

original: “The man who is lord of the land spoke harshly to us and accused us of spying on the country.
translation: Man i bikpela long kantri i tok strong olsem na toktok harim gut againstim mipela, i kam bekim tok bilong mipela olsem mipela i go lusim ai bilong kantri.

original: But we told him, ‘We are honest men, not spies.
translation: Mipela tokim em, ‘Mipela ol man i gat tru, nogat mipela i bikman.’

original: We are twelve brothers, sons of one father. One is no more, and the youngest is now with our father in the land of Canaan.’
translation: Mipela i gat brotha twelve, ol pikinini bilong wan papa. Wan i no stap gen, na nambawan pikinini i stap wantaim papa bilong mipela long kantri bilong Kanaan.

original: Then the man who is lord of the land said to us, ‘This is how I will know whether you are honest: Leave one brother with me, take food to relieve the hunger of your households, and go.
translation: Bikpela man bilong graun i tokim mipela, 'Mipela bai save long dispela rot: Lusim wanpela brata bilong yu stap wantaim mi, kisim ka long givim bel bilong yumi, na go.

original: But bring your youngest brother back to me so I will know that you are not spies but honest men. Then I will give your brother back to you, and you can trade in the land.’”
translation: Kisim brotha bilong yu i las i kam bek long me, mipela bai save olsem yu no spia, yu ol man i gat trut na save. Na bipo yu kisim brotha bilong yu i go bek long yu, ken yu ken bergen sampela ka moni long kantri.

original: As they began emptying their sacks, there in each man’s sack was his bag of silver! And when they and their father saw the bags of silver, they were dismayed.
translation: Taim ol i statim emptim sak bilong ol, bihaen long sak bilong each man, bag bilong silva bilong em i stap. Na taim ol mana na papa bilong ol i lukim bag bilong silva, ol i bel kol, na ol i sori tumas.

original: Their father Jacob said to them, “You have deprived me of my sons. Joseph is gone and Simeon is no more. Now you want to take Benjamin. Everything is going against me!”
translation: Tambolo Jacob i tokim ol long tok, "Yupla i bagarapim pikinini bilong mi. Joseph i go daun na Simeon i no moa. Nau yupla i laik kisim Benjamin. Olgeta samting i go agensim mi!"

original: Then Reuben said to his father, “You may kill my two sons if I fail to bring him back to you. Put him in my care, and I will return him.”
translation: Ruben i tokim papa bilong en, "Yu ken kilm ol tu pikinini bilong mi if mi no bringim i kam bek long yu. Putim em insait long hap bilong mi, na bai mi bringim i kam bek long yu."

original: But Jacob replied, “My son will not go down there with you, for his brother is dead, and he alone is left. If any harm comes to him on your journey, you will bring my gray hair down to Sheol in sorrow.”
translation: Bai Yakob i tok bek, "Pikinini bilong me i no go daun long hap bilong yu, bikos brata bilong em i dai pinis, na em i stap wanpela tasol. Sapos olsem, sampela ka narapela i kam longen long wik journey, bai yu bringim grae bilong hed bilong mi i daun long Hel, na mi bagarap olgeta."

original: Now the famine was still severe in the land.
translation: Tikpaus bilong kaikai i stap strong yet long kantri.

original: So when Jacob’s sons had eaten all the grain they had brought from Egypt, their father said to them, “Go back and buy us a little more food.”
translation: Wenem ol pikinini bilong Jacob i go finis kaikai ol i kisim bek long Ejip, papa bilong ol i tokim ol, "Go bek gen na baim mipela liklik moa kaikai."

original: But Judah replied, “The man solemnly warned us, ‘You will not see my face again unless your brother is with you.’
translation: Juda i tokim, “Man i wariim mipela strong, ‘yu no ken si face bilong me gen unless brata bilong yu i kam wantaim yu.’”

original: If you will send our brother with us, we will go down and buy food for you.
translation: Sapos yu sendim brata bilong mipela wantaim mipela, mipela bai go daun, baim ka.

original: But if you will not send him, we will not go; for the man told us, ‘You will not see my face again unless your brother is with you.’”
translation: Bai yumi no salim em i go, yumi no go yet; olsem na man i tokim mipela, 'Yumi no lukim pes bilong yu gen unless brata bilong yu i kam wantaim yu.'

original: “Why did you bring this trouble upon me?” Israel asked. “Why did you tell the man you had another brother?”
translation: “Wai yu bringim dispela trabel long mi?” Israel i askim. “Wai yu tokim man i go ol i gat brata narak?”

original: They replied, “The man questioned us in detail about ourselves and our family: ‘Is your father still alive? Do you have another brother?’ And we answered him accordingly. How could we possibly know that he would say, ‘Bring your brother here’?”
translation: Ol i tokim, "Man i askim mipela long stori bilong mipela yet na mipela famili: 'Papa bilong yu i orait yet? Yu gat narapela brata?' Na mipela i givim ansa long namel. Mipela inap i save gut bai em i tok, 'Kisim brata bilong yu i kam.'"

original: And Judah said to his father Israel, “Send the boy with me, and we will go at once, so that we may live and not die—neither we, nor you, nor our children.
translation: Na Juda i tokim papa Isrel bilong en, "Kisim boy ikam wantaim mi, mipela go nau yet, olsem na mipela, yupela, na pikinini bilong mipela bai i stap alive na no dai."

original: I will guarantee his safety. You may hold me personally responsible. If I do not bring him back and set him before you, then may I bear the guilt before you all my life.
translation: Mi bai garanti sekuriti bilong em. Yu inap holim mi long olgeta samting. I sori, mipela no bringim em i kam bek na putim em bifor yu, orait mipela kisim bilong gilty bifo yumi olgeta tasol mipela bai karam long olgeta taim bilong laip bilong mipela.

original: If we had not delayed, we could have come and gone twice by now.”
translation: Mipela i no bihainim, mipela inap go na kom bek gen twais alredy.

original: Then their father Israel said to them, “If it must be so, then do this: Put some of the best products of the land in your packs and carry them down as a gift for the man—a little balm and a little honey, spices and myrrh, pistachios and almonds.
translation: Na papa Israel i tokim ol long tok, "Sapos em i mas bekim olsem, wokim olsem: Kisim ol gutpela kai bilong graun, ol balm, hani, spais, mir, pistachio, na almand, na putim long bag bilong yu, kisim ol i go daun na givim man husat i stap, olsem gift bilong respekts."

original: Take double the silver with you so that you may return the silver that was put back into the mouths of your sacks. Perhaps it was a mistake.
translation: Kam bek gen long han bilong yu na kisim dupla silva, ili yu ken biramim bek silva i go bak long mun bilong sak bilong yupela. Em ino, em i kamap olsem bikos mistake.

original: Take your brother as well, and return to the man at once.
translation: Kisim brotha bilong yu, na go bek long man at once.

original: May God Almighty grant you mercy before the man, that he may release your other brother along with Benjamin. As for me, if I am bereaved, I am bereaved.”
translation: GOD bilong yumi, em i givim yu meri bifo man ia, na bai em i lusim narapela brata bilong yu longsaed Benjamin. Mi tasol, mipela i lusim ol pikinini bilong mi, orait, mipela lusim.

original: So the men took these gifts, along with double the amount of silver, and Benjamin as well. Then they hurried down to Egypt and stood before Joseph.
translation: Ol man i kisim dispela kina gifts, ol i harim tupela taem moa silva, na Benjamin, na ol i go daun long Egip. Ol i sanap bifo Yosef.

original: When Joseph saw Benjamin with his brothers, he said to the steward of his house, “Take these men to my house. Slaughter an animal and prepare it, for they shall dine with me at noon.”
translation: Taim Joseph harim Benjamin wantaim brata bilong en, na em tokim bosboi bilong haus bilong en, “Kisim ol man ya, karam dem go long haus bilong me, slaitim bek, na kukim i redi, bikos ol i kam kaikai wantaim me by lunchtime.”

original: The man did as Joseph had commanded and took the brothers to Joseph’s house.
translation: Man i mekim olsem Joseph i tokim na i karim brata go long haus bilong Joseph.

original: But the brothers were frightened that they had been taken to Joseph’s house. “We have been brought here because of the silver that was returned in our bags the first time,” they said. “They intend to overpower us and take us as slaves, along with our donkeys.”
translation: Brata i save poret long tingim ol ibin kisim go long haus bilong Yosep. "Mipela ibin kam bek long hap long silva we ibin kisim go long bag bilong mipela long taim em i kam bek," ol tok. "Ol i laik bagarapim mipela, na ol i laik mekim mipela man servistaba, wantaim donki bilong mipela."

original: So they approached Joseph’s steward and spoke to him at the entrance to the house.
translation: Ol i go klostu long stua bilong Yosef na ol i tokim em long entris bilong haus.

original: “Please, sir,” they said, “we really did come down here the first time to buy food.
translation: Pipia, siri, mipela kam daun long hap tasol long taim bilong mipela bai mipela baim ka.

original: But when we came to the place we lodged for the night, we opened our sacks and, behold, each of us found his silver in the mouth of his sack! It was the full amount of our silver, and we have brought it back with us.
translation: Bipo mipela i go long ples na stap ol nait, mipela i opim sak bilong mipela, na lukim, hap pasal yumi finisim sila bilong yumi istap long maus bilong sak bilong yumi! Em i sila bilong yumi yet, na mipela i bringim i bek wantaim.

original: We have brought additional silver with us to buy food. We do not know who put our silver in our sacks.”
translation: Mipela kisim silva i kam bek gen long bilong baim ka. Mipela no save husat putim silva bilong mipela insait bilong sak bilong mipela.

original: “It is fine,” said the steward. “Do not be afraid. Your God, the God of your father, gave you the treasure that was in your sacks. I received your silver.” Then he brought Simeon out to them.
translation: Em i gutpela, tok bosboi. No ken kirap, yu no ken bikim feared. Bikpela God bilong papa bilong yu givim yu treasure ol i stap insait long sak bilong yu. Mi kisim silva bilong yu. Na bai em kamautim Simeon i kam long yupela.

original: And the steward took the men into Joseph’s house, gave them water to wash their feet, and provided food for their donkeys.
translation: Na stua bilong haus i bekim ol man, i karim ol i go long haus bilong Yosef, i givim ol water long ol wasim kuk bilong ol, na i kisim ka long helpim ka bilong ol donki.

original: Since the brothers had been told that they were going to eat a meal there, they prepared their gift for Joseph’s arrival at noon.
translation: Brata i harim tok olsem ol i go kam kaikai, nau ol i rediim gif blong ol long apinun taim Joseph i kam.

original: When Joseph came home, they presented him with the gifts they had brought, and they bowed to the ground before him.
translation: Wanpela taim Yusuf i kam bek long hous, ol i givim em gif na moning, na ol i paul ai klostu long graun bifo em.

original: He asked if they were well, and then he asked, “How is your elderly father you told me about? Is he still alive?”
translation: Em i askim olsem bai ol i stap gut, na em i askim, "Tumbuna papa bilong yu ol i tokim mi long en, em i stap yet?"

original: “Your servant our father is well,” they answered. “He is still alive.” And they bowed down to honor him.
translation: Wokman bilong yumi, papa bilong yumi i stap strong, em yet i stap alive. Na ol i kisim kaikai long ai bilong en, na ol i mekim respek long em.

original: When Joseph looked up and saw his brother Benjamin, his own mother’s son, he asked, “Is this your youngest brother, the one you told me about?” Then he declared, “May God be gracious to you, my son.”
translation: Joseph i lukim na si brother Benjamin, pikinini bilong mama bilong em, na em i askim, "Em i pikinini i lakoi, dispela em yu tokim mi long en?" Na em i tok olsem, "Mipela i hop God i givim gras long yu, pikinini."

original: Joseph hurried out because he was moved to tears for his brother, and he went to a private room to weep.
translation: Yusuf harim bek i go na em i kamap bilong taen water, o em i go long rum bilong en na kisim taen.

original: Then he washed his face and came back out. Regaining his composure, he said, “Serve the meal.”
translation: Em washi pes bilong en, em kam bek gen, na em kam strong gen long tingting bilong en, na em tok, “Servim ka.”

original: They separately served Joseph, his brothers, and the Egyptians. They ate separately because the Egyptians would not eat with the Hebrews, since that was detestable to them.
translation: Ol i sarvim Joseph, brata bilong em, na Egyptians apin olsem. Ol i kai kai apin olsem, bikos Egyptians i no ken kai wantaim Hebrews, em i nogut tru long ol.

original: They were seated before Joseph in order by age, from the firstborn to the youngest, and the men looked at one another in astonishment.
translation: Ol i siddaun bifor Joseph long ol ordar bilong umana, from pikanini i kam first i go inap long pikinini i las, na ol man i lukim wan another long astonishmen.

original: When the portions were served to them from Joseph’s table, Benjamin’s portion was five times larger than any of the others. So they feasted and drank freely with Joseph.
translation: Taim kaikai bilong ol i servis long tebol bilong Joseph, Benjamin i gat kaikai i go bek five taim moa long ol narapela. Ol i hamamas long kaikai na dring susa wantaim Joseph.

original: Then Joseph instructed his steward: “Fill the men’s sacks with as much food as they can carry, and put each one’s silver in the mouth of his sack.
translation: Na Joseph i givim tok bilong en long husat i wokim ka, olsem: "Filim sak bilong ol man long ka, olsem ol i ken kisim i go, na putim silva bilong ol wanwan long maus bilong sak bilong em."

original: Put my cup, the silver one, in the mouth of the youngest one’s sack, along with the silver for his grain.” So the steward did as Joseph had instructed.
translation: Putim bekim silva bilong me long maus bilong bag bilong pikinini i kam last, wantaim silva bilong peiment bilong grain bilong em. Na ofisa bilong haus i mekim olsem Josep i bin tok.

original: At daybreak, the men were sent on their way with their donkeys.
translation: Long bikimua long moning, ol man i go pinis wantaim donki bilong ol.

original: They had not gone far from the city when Joseph told his steward, “Pursue the men at once, and when you overtake them, ask, ‘Why have you repaid good with evil?
translation: Ol i no go longwe yet long taun, na Yusif tokim bosboi bilong en, "Bihain i go bek gen long ol man, wanken yu kisim bek ol, ash yu ol, 'Wai yu givim bek bad long good?'""

original: Is this not the cup my master drinks from and uses for divination? What you have done is wicked!’”
translation: Em i no kup bilong masta bilong mi, masta bilong mi drink long em, na ol i usim em long lukim samting bai i kam? Wanem yu mekim em i rong!

original: When the steward overtook them, he relayed these words to them.
translation: Taim steward kam apostem ol, em i givim dispela tok long ol.

original: “Why does my lord say these things?” they asked. “Your servants could not possibly do such a thing.
translation: Bilong wanem papa bilong yu tok olsem? Wokman bilong yu no inap long mekim samting olsem.

original: We even brought back to you from the land of Canaan the silver we found in the mouths of our sacks. Why would we steal silver or gold from your master’s house?
translation: Mipela kisim bek gen long yu sila mipela i finaut insait long maus bilong sampela bilum bilong mipela long kantri bilong Kanaan. Bilong wanem mipela bai stel sila o gol long haus bilong bos bilong yu?

original: If any of your servants is found to have it, he must die, and the rest will become slaves of my lord.”
translation: Sapos wanpela servan bilong yu i kamap imap long en, em mas dai, na ol narapela bai i katol servan bilong papa bilong yu.

original: “As you say,” replied the steward. “But only the one who is found with the cup will be my slave, and the rest of you shall be free of blame.”
translation: Olsem yu tok, stua i tok. “Bai mipela lukim kap long han bilong husat, husat bai em i slave bilong mi, na pipia nating bai fri long balus.”

original: So each one quickly lowered his sack to the ground and opened it.
translation: Na husat i kam, ol i kisim hap na letim i daun na opim bilum bilong ol.

original: The steward searched, beginning with the oldest and ending with the youngest—and the cup was found in Benjamin’s sack.
translation: Ofisa i go lukim, em i stat long ol i gat bikpela tumbuna na i pinis long ol i gat liklik tumbuna—kap i save long bag bilong Benjamin.

original: Then they all tore their clothes, loaded their donkeys, and returned to the city.
translation: Ol i katim kus ol narapela, kisim oka long ol donki, na go bek long taun.

original: When Judah and his brothers arrived at Joseph’s house, he was still there, and they fell to the ground before him.
translation: Taim Juda na bratas i kam, ol i go long haus bilong Josep, na em i stap yet, na ol i pundaun i go daun bifor em.

original: “What is this deed you have done?” Joseph declared. “Do you not know that a man like me can surely divine the truth?”
translation: “Wanem kain wok yu mekim?” Yusif tok klia. “Yu no save olsem man bilong autoriti olsem nipo, em inap tokautim tru?”

original: “What can we say to my lord?” Judah replied. “How can we plead? How can we justify ourselves? God has exposed the iniquity of your servants. We are now my lord’s slaves—both we and the one who was found with the cup.”
translation: Mipela i ken tok wha long dispela lord bilong mipela? Mipela i ken bekim tok long wanem? Mipela i ken givim strongpela tok long mipela yet? God i opim hevi samting ogosta bilong wokmanmeri bilong yu. Nau mipela i stap long han bilong yu, lord - mipela olgeta, na namel wanpela i punda long cup.

original: But Joseph replied, “Far be it from me to do this. The man who was found with the cup will be my slave. The rest of you may return to your father in peace.”
translation: Josep em i tok bek, "Nogat ken olsem long me. Man we i kisim kap, bai yu bicom slave bilong mi. Yupela ol narapela i go bak long papa bilong yu na yu kamap strong."

original: Then Judah approached Joseph and said, “Sir, please let your servant speak personally to my lord. Do not be angry with your servant, for you are equal to Pharaoh himself.
translation: Na Judah i go klostu long Joseph na tok, "Lori, mipela i tok stret wantaim lori bilong mipela. No ken kros long hause boy bilong yu, bikos yu em i wan samting olsem Farao, yu gat autoriti."

original: My lord asked his servants, ‘Do you have a father or a brother?’
translation: Bikman i askim servis man bilong em, 'Papa na brata bilong yu i stap?'

original: And we answered, ‘We have an elderly father and a younger brother, the child of his old age. The boy’s brother is dead. He is the only one of his mother’s sons left, and his father loves him.’
translation: Mipela i tok, 'Mipela i gat papa lapun na bikpela brata, pikinini bilong taim em i go antap. Brata bilong pikinini i dai pinis. Em i las wan pikinini bilong mama i stap, na papa i lakim em.'

original: Then you told your servants, ‘Bring him down to me so that I can see him for myself.’
translation: Yu tokim servantram bilong yu, 'Kisim i kam daun long mi na mi bai lukim em yet.'

original: So we said to my lord, ‘The boy cannot leave his father. If he were to leave, his father would die.’
translation: Mipela i tokim lorden, 'Pikinini no ina go longwe papa bilong en. Em i go, papa bilong en bai kisim sik na dai.'

original: But you said to your servants, ‘Unless your younger brother comes down with you, you will not see my face again.’
translation: Yu tokim servant bilong yu, ‘Sapos brata bilong yu i no kam daun wantaim yu, yu no ina lukim pes bilong mi gen.’

original: Now when we returned to your servant my father, we relayed your words to him.
translation: Taim yumui kam bek long papa bilong yu, yumui tok ples i go aut long em.

original: Then our father said, ‘Go back and buy us some food.’
translation: Papa bilong mipela i tok, ‘Go bek gen na baim kakaruk long mipela.’

original: But we answered, ‘We cannot go down there unless our younger brother goes with us. So if our younger brother is not with us, we cannot see the man.’
translation: Mipela i tok, "Mipela no inap go daun bek, tasol sibilia bilong mipela i ken go wantaim mipela. Sapos sibilia bilong mipela i no stap wantaim mipela, mipela no inap lukim man."

original: And your servant my father said to us, ‘You know that my wife bore me two sons.
translation: Na servan bilong yu, papa bilong mi em i tokim mipela, 'Yupela save olsem, meri bilong mi em i karim twopela pikinini man bilong mi.'

original: When one of them was gone, I said: “Surely he has been torn to pieces.” And I have not seen him since.
translation: Wanpela bilong ol i go already, mi tok: “Em i pulapim olgeta bai.” Na mi no seeim iles.

original: Now if you also take this one from me and harm comes to him, you will bring my gray hair down to Sheol in sorrow.’
translation: Nau if yu tu kisim wanpela dispela long me na hatwok i kamapim olgeta long em, yu bai bringim ol grasepela het bilong me i go daun long Sheol, ples bilong dai, we bilong stap, long sorow.

original: So if the boy is not with us when I return to your servant, and if my father, whose life is wrapped up in the boy’s life,
translation: Sikirai bai pikinini i no stap wantaim mipela wen mi kam bek long servant bilong yu, na papa bilong mi, em life bilong em i holim lif bilong pikinini,

original: sees that the boy is not with us, he will die. Then your servants will have brought the gray hair of your servant our father down to Sheol in sorrow.
translation: I si bem bek i no stap wantaim mipela, em bai dai. Na wokman bilong yu bai bringim graon hare bilong sarvan bilong yu, papa bilong mipela, i go daun long hap bilong ded, na mipela bai kisim sorow.

original: Indeed, your servant guaranteed the boy’s safety to my father, saying, ‘If I do not return him to you, I will bear the guilt before you, my father, all my life.’
translation: Inan, manmeri bilong yu, em i garantim safti bilong yung pilai long papa bilong mi, olsem, 'Mi no bringim bek i go long yu, na bai mi kisim gutpela respons long guilt, na mi bai givim i go long yu, papa bilong mi, olegeta laip bilong mi.'

original: Now please let your servant stay here as my lord’s slave in place of the boy. Let him return with his brothers.
translation: Nau, mipela i askim yu, lusim servant bilong yu stap long hap bilong pikinini, na em i go bek gen long bratas bilong en.

original: For how can I go back to my father without the boy? I could not bear to see the misery that would overwhelm him.”
translation: Mi no inap go bak long papa bilong mi bemain tasol i no gat pikinini, bikos mi no inap lukim sorere i kam strong olgeta long em.

original: Then Joseph could no longer control himself before all his attendants, and he cried out, “Send everyone away from me!” So none of them were with Joseph when he made himself known to his brothers.
translation: Na Joseph em i no inap long kontrollim yet bifo olgeta ol yangpela i wok servis, na em i krai aut, “Miksim ol i go we!” Na bikos ol i harim dispela toktok, ol yangpela i wok servis i go was, na Joseph em i mekim nem bilong en i kamap long brata bilong en.

original: But he wept so loudly that the Egyptians heard him, and Pharaoh’s household soon heard of it.
translation: Na em i krai olsem bikpela sori, na Egyptian i harim em, na husat bilong Pharaoh i go harim tok bilong em i go.

original: Joseph said to his brothers, “I am Joseph! Is my father still alive?” But they were unable to answer him, because they were terrified in his presence.
translation: Yusif i tokim brata bilong em, "Mipela i Yusif! Papa bilong mi i stap yet?" Tasol ol i no inap tokim em, bekos ol i bel hevi long em, na ol i bin poret long ai bilong em.

original: Then Joseph said to his brothers, “Please come near me.” And they did so. “I am Joseph, your brother,” he said, “the one you sold into Egypt!
translation: Na Joseph i tokim brata bilong en, "Kam klostu long me." Na ol i kam klostu. "Mi Joseph, brata bilong yu," itok, "wanpela yu bilasim i go long Egip."

original: And now, do not be distressed or angry with yourselves that you sold me into this place, because it was to save lives that God sent me before you.
translation: Nau, no ken stret long tok, no kros long yuself ol yet, long ol sellim me kam long hap dispela, bikos em i God bingim me i go bifor yu long saveman lif.

original: For the famine has covered the land these two years, and there will be five more years without plowing or harvesting.
translation: Kangar i kamap long kantri dispela tupela yia, na bai i go na ba five yia yet, bougain bai planti tasol, na bai no ken harim.

original: God sent me before you to preserve you as a remnant on the earth and to save your lives by a great deliverance.
translation: Bikpela i sendim mi bifo yupela olgeta long tokwin bilong tisa, olsem yupela i mas stap olsem pikinini i stap yet long graun, na bilong savem laip bilong yupela nau long wanpela bikpela tokwin bilong tisa.

original: Therefore it was not you who sent me here, but God, who has made me a father to Pharaoh—lord of all his household and ruler over all the land of Egypt.
translation: Olegta em i no yu yet kam bek long hap, nogat, bikos God i mekim mi olsem papa long Pharaoh, em i bikman bilong haus belong em, na gavana long olgeta graun bilong Ijip.

original: Now return quickly to my father and tell him, ‘This is what your son Joseph says: God has made me lord of all Egypt. Come down to me without delay.
translation: Kam bek kwiktaim, tokim papa bilong mi, Josephu i tok olsem: God i mekim mi bos bilong olgeta Ijip. Kam daun long me, no ken stap planti taem.

original: You shall settle in the land of Goshen and be near me—you and your children and grandchildren, your flocks and herds, and everything you own.
translation: Yu stap strong long graun bilong Gosen, na yu klos long mi - yu na ol pikinini bilong yu, na ol pikinini bilong ol pikinini bilong yu, ol pikinini animal bilong sheep na ol bulmakau bilong yu, na alles samting yu gat.

original: And there I will provide for you, because there will be five more years of famine. Otherwise, you and your household and everything you own will come to destitution.’
translation: Na bai mi givim yu ka, bikos na bai i gat paitpela yia nau yet, famine bai i kam. Inap yu, haus lain bilong yu, na olgeta samting yu gat bai i go daun long kisim nogat, olsem yu bai i stap long kakaruk.

original: Behold! You and my brother Benjamin can see that I, Joseph, am the one speaking with you.
translation: Susa, yu na brata bilong mi Benjamin i lukim, mi, Joseph, em i man bilong toktok wantaim yu.

original: Tell my father about all my splendor in Egypt and everything you have seen. And bring my father down here quickly.”
translation: Tosim tok long papa bilong me long olgeta gutpela samting bilong me long kantri Egypt, na olgeta samting yu lukim. Kisim papa bilong me i kam daun harim bikos.

original: Then Joseph threw his arms around his brother Benjamin and wept, and Benjamin wept as they embraced.
translation: Na Yusuf i kam bek long brata bilong en Benjamin, i kusim em, na Benjamin i tarai tu ol i kukim wangela.

original: Joseph kissed each of his brothers as he wept over them. And afterward his brothers talked with him.
translation: Yusuf i pisa kisim brother bilong em yet, na em i tarai olgeta igo long ol. Na bihainim, bruker bilong em i tok stret wantaim em.

original: When the news reached Pharaoh’s house that Joseph’s brothers had come, Pharaoh and his servants were pleased.
translation: Taim stori igo kam long haus bilong Pharaoh na Brata bilong Joseph i kam, Pharaoh na servants bilong em i hamamas.

original: Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Tell your brothers, ‘Do as follows: Load your animals and return to the land of Canaan.
translation: Faraon i tokim Joseph, “Tokim ol brata bilong yu, ‘Wok long olsem: Karamapim ol animal bilong yu na go bek gen long kantri bilong Kanaan.’”

original: Then bring your father and your families and return to me. I will give you the best of the land of Egypt, and you shall eat from the fat of the land.’
translation: Kam bek, kisim papa bilong yu na famili bilong yu, na kam bek long me. Mi bai givim yu gutpela graun bilong Egip, na yu bai kaikai planti bilong graun.

original: You are also directed to tell them: ‘Take wagons from the land of Egypt for your young children and your wives, and bring your father and come back.
translation: Yu mas tokim ol long dispela: Kisim wagen long kantri Egypt bilong pikinini i no long taim na meri bilong yu, kisim papa bilong yu na kam bek gen.

original: But pay no regard to your belongings, for the best of all the land of Egypt is yours.’”
translation: No ken long olgeta samting bilong yu, wantaim gutpela hap bilong gras bilong Egypt em iyu yet.

original: So the sons of Israel did as they were told. Joseph gave them wagons as Pharaoh had instructed, and he also gave them provisions for their journey.
translation: Na pikinini bilong Israel i mekim olsem ol i bin tok. Joseph i givim ol wagen long ol, olsem Pharaoh i bin tok, na em i givim ka bilong helpim long ol bilong helpim ol long rod bilong ol.

original: He gave new garments to each of them, but to Benjamin he gave three hundred shekels of silver and five sets of clothes.
translation: Em i givim klos nu lapun long ol, tasol long Benjamin em i givim 300 silva shekel na 5 set bilong klos.

original: And he sent to his father the following: ten donkeys loaded with the best of Egypt, and ten female donkeys loaded with grain and bread and provisions for his father’s journey.
translation: Na em i sendim pes bilong en long papa bilong en: ten donki i kamap strong long ol gutpela samting bilong Egip, na ten donki meri i kamap strong long ka, bret, na kaikai bilong jurney bilong papa bilong en.

original: Then Joseph sent his brothers on their way, and as they were leaving, he said to them, “Do not quarrel on the way!”
translation: Na Joseph i senim ol brata bilong em i go, na ol i go na, i tokim ol long: “Inap yu faet long rot bilong ol!”

original: So the brothers went up out of Egypt and came to their father Jacob in the land of Canaan.
translation: Na bratas i go apo long Egip na kam bek long tumbuna Jakob long kantri bilong Kanan.

original: “Joseph is still alive,” they said, “and he is ruler over all the land of Egypt!” But Jacob was stunned, for he did not believe them.
translation: Yusuf i stap yet, ol i tok, na em i bikpela bos bilong olgeta graun bilong Ijip! Yakob em i kamas, nanin bilivim ol.

original: However, when they relayed all that Joseph had told them, and when he saw the wagons that Joseph had sent to carry him back, the spirit of their father Jacob was revived.
translation: Taim ol i tokim olgeta samting Joseph i tokim ol, na taim em i lukim kareta olsem Joseph i salim long karim em bek, spirit bilong papa Jacob i kamap strong gen.

original: “Enough!” declared Israel. “My son Joseph is still alive! I will go to see him before I die.”
translation: Inap! Oli tok stret long Israel, “Pikinini bilong mi Joseph i stap yet! Mi go lukim em bifo mi dai.”

original: So Israel set out with all that he had, and when he came to Beersheba, he offered sacrifices to the God of his father Isaac.
translation: Na Isrel i kamap na go bek long olgeta samting bilong em, na em i kam bek long Beesheba taun, na em i bringim sakrifis long God bilong papa Isaac.

original: And that night God spoke to Israel in a vision: “Jacob, Jacob!” He said. “Here I am,” replied Jacob.
translation: Na nait i kam, Bikpela i tokim long Israel olsem: "Jakob, Jakob!" Ol i tok. "Mi stap hiri," Jakob i bekim.

original: “I am God,” He said, “the God of your father. Do not be afraid to go down to Egypt, for I will make you into a great nation there.
translation: Mi em God, God bilong papa bilong yu, mi tok olsem. No ken stap i go long ples fear, yu no ken stap i go daun long Ejip, bikos mi bai mekim yu olsem wanpela nesen gret long hap ia.

original: I will go down with you to Egypt, and I will surely bring you back. And Joseph’s own hands will close your eyes.”
translation: Mipela bai go daun wantaim yu long Ijip, na mipela bai kam bek gen long yu. Na Josep im selib bai pasim ai bilong yu.

original: Then Jacob departed from Beersheba, and the sons of Israel took their father Jacob in the wagons Pharaoh had sent to carry him, along with their children and wives.
translation: Na Jakob lusim Beersheba, na ol pikinini bilong Isrel i kisim papa Jacob, i putim em long kareta we Pharao i salim bek long karim em, wantsel long ol pikinini na meri bilong ol.

original: They also took the livestock and possessions they had acquired in the land of Canaan, and Jacob and all his offspring went to Egypt.
translation: Tupela i tokautim ol narapela animal na samting bilong ol, ol samting em i bin kisim long kantri bilong Kanaan, na Yakob wantaim ol pikinini bilong em i go long Egip.

original: Jacob took with him to Egypt his sons and grandsons, and his daughters and granddaughters—all his offspring.
translation: Yakob i kisim ol pikinini bilong em, ol pikinini bilong ol pikinini bilong em, ol meri bilong em, ol pikinini bilong ol meri bilong em, na ol descendants bilong em, na i go long Egip wantaim ol.

original: Now these are the names of the sons of Israel (Jacob and his descendants) who went to Egypt: Reuben, Jacob’s firstborn.
translation: Nau dispela i stap nem bilong pikinini Izrael, Yakob na desenden bilong en, ol i go long Egip: Ruben, em i pikinini namba wan bilong Yakob.

original: The sons of Reuben: Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Reuben: Hanok, Palu, Hezron, na Karmi.

original: The sons of Simeon: Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jachin, Zohar, and Shaul the son of a Canaanite woman.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Simeon: Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jachin, Zohar, na Shaul, em i pikinini bilong meri Canaan.

original: The sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Levi: Gershon, Kohath, na Merari.

original: The sons of Judah: Er, Onan, Shelah, Perez, and Zerah; but Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan. The sons of Perez: Hezron and Hamul.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Yuda: Er, Onan, Shelah, Pelez, na Zerah; tasol Er na Onan i dai long kantri bilong Kanaan. Ol pikinini bilong Pelez: Hezron na Hamul.

original: The sons of Issachar: Tola, Puvah, Job, and Shimron.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Isakar: Tola, Puvah, Job, na Shimron.

original: The sons of Zebulun: Sered, Elon, and Jahleel.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Zebulun: Sered, Elon, na Jahleel.

original: These are the sons of Leah born to Jacob in Paddan-aram, in addition to his daughter Dinah. The total number of sons and daughters was thirty-three.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Leah we i kam long Jakob long ples Paddan-aram, aplus long givim dikim ol meri, Dinah. Namba komplet bilong ol pikinini manmeri em thirty-three.

original: The sons of Gad: Ziphion, Haggi, Shuni, Ezbon, Eri, Arodi, and Areli.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Gad: Sipion, Hagi, Sunai, Ezbon, Eri, Arodi, na Areli.

original: The children of Asher: Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, Beriah, and their sister Serah. The sons of Beriah: Heber and Malchiel.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Asher: Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, Beriah, na susa bilong ol: Serah. Ol man bilong Beriah: Heber na Malchiel.

original: These are the sons of Jacob born to Zilpah—whom Laban gave to his daughter Leah—sixteen in all.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Jakob i kam long Zilpah, Laban i givim Zilpah long dokim Leah, ol i stap siksiten olgeta.

original: The sons of Jacob’s wife Rachel: Joseph and Benjamin.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong meri Rachel bilong Jacob: Joseph na Benjamin.

original: Manasseh and Ephraim were born to Joseph in the land of Egypt by Asenath daughter of Potiphera, priest of On.
translation: Manase na Efrayim ibin kamap long Joseph long lan bilong Ijip, ol i kamap long hap Asenat, bikmeri bilong Potifera, pris bilong On.

original: The sons of Benjamin: Bela, Becher, Ashbel, Gera, Naaman, Ehi, Rosh, Muppim, Huppim, and Ard.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Benjimin: Bela, Becher, Ashbel, Gera, Naaman, Ehi, Rosh, Muppim, Huppim, na Ard.

original: These are the sons of Rachel born to Jacob—fourteen in all.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Rekel we i kamap long Yakob, olgeta em fourteen.

original: The son of Dan: Hushim.
translation: Pikinini bilong Dan: Husim.

original: The sons of Naphtali: Jahzeel, Guni, Jezer, and Shillem.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Naphtali: Jahzeel, Guni, Jezer, na Shillem.

original: These are the sons of Jacob born to Bilhah, whom Laban gave to his daughter Rachel—seven in all.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Yakob we ol i kamap long Bilhaha, wen Laban i givim Bilhaha i go long daugta bilong em, Rekel, ol i stap long olgeta, seven.

original: All those belonging to Jacob who came to Egypt—his direct descendants, besides the wives of Jacob’s sons—numbered sixty-six persons.
translation: Ol desenden ol i dai bilong Yakob i kam long Egip, ol meri bilong ol pikinini man bilong em igat, ol i kanusim sixty-six man.

original: And with the two sons who had been born to Joseph in Egypt, the members of Jacob’s family who went to Egypt were seventy in all.
translation: Na wantaim tupela man pikinini i kamap long Joseph long Egip, ol memba bilong famili bilong Jakob i go long Egip, na ol i kontak seveti insait.

original: Now Jacob had sent Judah ahead of him to Joseph to get directions to Goshen. When Jacob’s family arrived in the land of Goshen,
translation: Nau Jakob salim Juda i go bifor em long Josep, i go askim wei long Gosen. Nara Jacob ikam long ples Gosen, ol i kamap long kantri Gosen.

original: Joseph prepared his chariot and went there to meet his father Israel. Joseph presented himself to him, embraced him, and wept profusely.
translation: Yusuf i prepaem chariot bilong en na i go bek long ples ia bungim papa bilong en, Israel. Yusuf i kam bek long en na sindaun, na i kisim em na i hap, na i rai i go long stretpela wail.

original: Then Israel said to Joseph, “Finally I can die, now that I have seen your face and know that you are still alive!”
translation: Na Israel i tokim Joseph, "Nau mi belisim dai pinis, long taim mi kam lukim pes bilong yu, na mi save olsem yu i stap yet!"

original: Joseph said to his brothers and to his father’s household, “I will go up and inform Pharaoh: ‘My brothers and my father’s household from the land of Canaan have come to me.
translation: Yosep i tokim brata bilong em na husat i stap long haus bilong papa bilong em, "Mi go ap, na bai mi givim tok bilong Pharaoh: 'Brata bilong me na ol i stap long haus bilong papa bilong me husat i kam from Kanaan i kam long me.'"

original: The men are shepherds; they raise livestock, and they have brought their flocks and herds and all that they own.’
translation: Ol man i stap long lukim ol animal, ol i mekim wok bilong paspata, na ol i bringim olgeta sip na bulmakau bilong ol, na olgeta samting ol i gat.

original: When Pharaoh summons you and asks, ‘What is your occupation?’
translation: Wanpela taim Faraon i singautim yu na i askim, 'Wanem ka wok bai yu wokim?'

original: you are to say, ‘Your servants have raised livestock ever since our youth—both we and our fathers.’ Then you will be allowed to settle in the land of Goshen, since all shepherds are detestable to the Egyptians.”
translation: Yu mas tok, 'Wokmanmeri bilong yu i save raisim ol kind bilong busna moni long taim bipo yet, stat long yut yet — na mipela yet, na papa bilong mipela.' Denyu bai yu inap stap i go long laine bilong Gosen, bikos ol man i lukaut ol pipel bilong kanu i nogat gut long Ejipito.

original: So Joseph went and told Pharaoh: “My father and my brothers, with their flocks and herds and all they own, have come from the land of Canaan and are now in Goshen.”
translation: Na Josephu i go tanim Pharaoh: "Papa bilong mi na ol brata bilong mi, wantaim ol bulmakau na ol sikarol bilong ol, mipela i kam bek long kantri Kanaan, nau ol i stap long Gosen."

original: And he chose five of his brothers and presented them before Pharaoh.
translation: Na em i kisim faiv bilong ol brata bilong en, na em i bringim ol i go bek long Pharaoh.

original: “What is your occupation?” Pharaoh asked Joseph’s brothers. “Your servants are shepherds,” they replied, “both we and our fathers.”
translation: Faraon i askim brata bilong Josep, "Wanem wok bai yu mekim?" Ol i bekim tok, "Servants bilong yu ol i save lukauten ol sip, mitupela na papa bilong mitupela, mipela ol i stap lukautim ol sip."

original: Then they said to Pharaoh, “We have come to live in the land for a time, because there is no pasture for the flocks of your servants, since the famine in the land of Canaan has been severe. So now, please allow your servants to settle in the land of Goshen.”
translation: Mipela i kam bihaen bai mipela i stap long kantri olsem taim, bikos i no gat grasn bilong kaiim ol wap bilong yu yet, na kaikai i paul long kantri bilong Kanaan, tasol nau, Faraon, yu kirapim ol bikman bilong mipela bai yumi i stap long kantri bilong Gosin.

original: Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Now that your father and brothers have come to you,
translation: Faraon i tokim Joseph, “Nau papa na brata bilong yu i kam long yu,”

original: the land of Egypt is before you; settle your father and brothers in the best part of the land. They may dwell in the land of Goshen. And if you know of any talented men among them, put them in charge of my own livestock.”
translation: Kantri bilong Ijip i op long yu; planti papa bilong yu na brata bilong yu long hap bilong kantri i gutpela, ol i mas stap long kantri bilong Gosen. Na sapos yu save olsem, i gat man talen bung ol i stap, yu mas putim ol i go lokim busna moni bilong mi.

original: Then Joseph brought in his father Jacob and presented him before Pharaoh, and Jacob blessed Pharaoh.
translation: Na Yusuf i kam bringim papa bilong em, Yakob, na em i bringim papa bilong en go bek long Faraoh, na Yakob i givim blesing long Faraoh.

original: “How many years have you lived?” Pharaoh asked.
translation: Faraon i askim, “Hamas ol yia yu stap long laip bilong yu?”

original: “My travels have lasted 130 years,” Jacob replied. “My years have been few and hard, and they have not matched the years of the travels of my fathers.”
translation: “Ol trip bilong mi ibin stap long 130 yia,” Jacob i tok. “Yia bilong mi i bikpela liklik na i painim ol samting nogut, na ol i no inap makim ol yia bilong ol trip bilong papa bilong mi.”

original: Then Jacob blessed Pharaoh and departed from his presence.
translation: Na Jacob i blesim bikman Faraon, na em i go bek gen long ples bilong en.

original: So Joseph settled his father and brothers in the land of Egypt and gave them property in the best part of the land, the district of Rameses, as Pharaoh had commanded.
translation: Yusuf i stapim papa na brata bilong em long kantri bilong Ejip, na i givim olgeta property long distrik bilong Rameses, hap bilong kantri we i nais, olsem tok bilong Pharaoh.

original: Joseph also provided his father and brothers and all his father’s household with food for their families.
translation: Yusuf i givim papa bilong en, na brata bilong en, wantaim ol hap famili bilong papa bilong en, plenti kaikai long ol famili bilong ol.

original: There was no food, however, in all that region, because the famine was so severe; the lands of Egypt and Canaan had been exhausted by the famine.
translation: Kaika i no stap long olgeta ples, bikos belly simpela i kamap strong; ol kantri bilong Misraim na Kanana i bin rabeim finis long kai klostaim.

original: Joseph collected all the money to be found in the land of Egypt and the land of Canaan in exchange for the grain they were buying, and he brought it into Pharaoh’s palace.
translation: Yusuf i kambekim pinis ol moni long graun bilong Ejip na graun bilong Kanaan long moni bilong grain ol i bin baim, na i bringim i go insait long haus bilong Pharaoh.

original: When the money from the lands of Egypt and Canaan was gone, all the Egyptians came to Joseph and said, “Give us food. Why should we die before your eyes? For our funds have run out!”
translation: Wanpela taim moni bilong gras bilong Egypt na Canaan i go daun, ol Egipcan i kam long Joseph na tok, "Givim mipela kaikai. Bilong wanem mipela i dai bifo ai bilong yu? Dispela moni bilong mipela i pinis!"

original: “Then bring me your livestock,” said Joseph. “Since the money is gone, I will sell you food in exchange for your livestock.”
translation: “Kisim olgeta animal bilong yu, bringim me,” tok Joseph. “Em moni i go daun finis, na mi bai selim ka long yu badili long olgeta animal bilong yu.”

original: So they brought their livestock to Joseph, and he gave them food in exchange for their horses, their flocks and herds, and their donkeys. Throughout that year he provided them with food in exchange for all their livestock.
translation: Na ol i bringim ol animol bilong ol, hos, ol fok bilong sheep, ol bulmakau, na ol donki long Joseph, na em i givim kaikai long ol in behaine long ol animol. Na throughout yia ia, em i saplikim kaikai long ol in behaine long olgeta animol bilong ol.

original: When that year was over, they came to him the second year and said, “We cannot hide from our lord that our money is gone and all our livestock belongs to you. There is nothing left for our lord except our bodies and our land.
translation: Wanpela yia i go pinis, ol i kam bek long em yarua, na ol i tok, "Mipela no inap hidim pes bilong mipela long bikpela, moni bilong mipela i go pinis, na ol kai kai bilong mipela i bilong yu. Nating i stap, bikos ol geta bodi na graun bilong mipela, tasol mipela givim ol long bikpela."

original: Why should we perish before your eyes—we and our land as well? Purchase us and our land in exchange for food. Then we, along with our land, will be slaves to Pharaoh. Give us seed that we may live and not die, and that the land may not become desolate.”
translation: Bai yumi ol i dai bifo ai bilong yu — yumui na graun bilong yumui tu? Baim yumui na graun bilong yumui long moni bilong ka, nau yumui na graun bilong yumui bai i go wok manmeri long Faraon. Givim yumui pipia bilong planim, nau yumui i ken livim, nogat dai, na graun igat planti, nogat bagarap.

original: So Joseph acquired for Pharaoh all the land in Egypt; the Egyptians, one and all, sold their fields because the famine was so severe upon them. The land became Pharaoh’s,
translation: Yusuf baim olgeta lan bilong Ejipit long Pharaoh; Ejipit i sellim olgeta ples bilong ol, wanwan, bikos kaikai i no gat, bikpela hungre i kam strong long ol. Olsem na lan bilong ol i go long Pharaoh, Pira bilong Em i kamap narapela gras bilong kantri.

original: and Joseph reduced the people to servitude from one end of Egypt to the other.
translation: Na Yusif i bringim piple long servise, stat long wanpela en bilong Egipiti go long narpela en.

original: However, he did not acquire the priests’ portion of the land, for it had been given to them by Pharaoh. They ate the rations that Pharaoh supplied; so they did not sell their land.
