translation: Em i no bin kisim kaikai bilong padi long graun, bikos Faraon i saplong givim ol padi long em. Ol i kai kaikai bilong wok Faraon i saplong givim ol; ol sa i no selim graun bilong ol.

original: Then Joseph said to the people, “Now that I have acquired you and your land for Pharaoh this day, here is seed for you to sow in the land.
translation: Na Yusuf i tokim ol pipol, “Nau mi kisim yu na graun bilong yu long han bilong Pharaon dispela de, mipela givim sip long yu, bai yu planim long graun.”

original: At harvest time, you are to give a fifth of it to Pharaoh, and four-fifths will be yours as seed for the field and food for yourselves and your households and children.”
translation: Wanpela taim bilong ka, yu mas givim 1/5 bilong em i go long Pharaoh, na 4/5 bai i stap long yu olsem sip bilong graun na kaikai bilong yuself, husat, na pikinini.

original: “You have saved our lives,” they said. “We have found favor in our lord’s eyes, and we will be Pharaoh’s servants.”
translation: “Yu kilim lif blo yumi,” ol i tok. “Mipela kisim gutpela hap bilong ai blo bikpela, na mipela bai kamap wokman bilong Farao.”

original: So Joseph established a law that a fifth of the produce belongs to Pharaoh, and it is in effect in the land of Egypt to this day. Only the priests’ land does not belong to Pharaoh.
translation: Na Joseph i kamapim wanpela loa, olsem hap kas bilong ka moni i belong long Pharaoh, na loa dispela i stap yet long kantri Egypt. Tasol, bikos ol pries bilong God, ol i gat graun bilong ol yet, em ino belong long Pharaoh.

original: Now the Israelites settled in the land of Egypt, in the region of Goshen. They acquired property there and became fruitful and increased greatly in number.
translation: Nau Yisrael i stap i go long kantri Egypt, insait long hap Goshen. Ol i kamap liklik masta long ples na graun, na ol i planim planti pikinini na i multiplai i go long wei.

original: And Jacob lived in the land of Egypt seventeen years, and the length of his life was 147 years.
translation: Na Jakob i stap long kantri Ijip tenpela yia sikisitin, na laip em i go long wan hanred na foety-sikis yia.

original: When the time drew near for Israel to die, he called his son Joseph and said to him, “If I have found favor in your eyes, put your hand under my thigh and promise to show me kindness and faithfulness. Do not bury me in Egypt,
translation: Taim i kam antap long nait long Israel, em i kisim pikinini bilong em Joseph na tokim em, "Mi luk gud long ai bilong yu, putim han bilong yu anidas long laig bilong mi na promis mi long givim skul na trutru. No ken buri mi long Egip."

original: but when I lie down with my fathers, carry me out of Egypt and bury me with them.” Joseph answered, “I will do as you have requested.”
translation: Tasol bai wanpela dei klostu i go daun wantaim papa bilong mi, inap yu karim mi i go aut long Egip na bekim mi i go daun stap wantaim ol. Yusuf i tok, "Mi bai mekim olsem yu askim."

original: “Swear to me,” Jacob said. So Joseph swore to him, and Israel bowed in worship at the head of his bed.
translation: “Kirap long me,” Yakob i tok. Na Yusuf i kirap long em, na Isrel i kona i go daun long hed bilong bet blong en long wei bilong lotu.

original: Some time later Joseph was told, “Your father is ill.” So he set out with his two sons, Manasseh and Ephraim.
translation: Olia taim igo pinis, Joseph i tambuain, “Papa bilong yu em i sik.” Nogat, em i go bek long ples bilong papa wantaim two pikinini bilong em, Manase na Efraim.

original: When Jacob was told, “Your son Joseph has come to you,” Israel rallied his strength and sat up in bed.
translation: Wanpela taim ol i tokim Jakob, "Pikinini bilong yu Josep i kam," Isrel i kamap strong na i sindaun long bet.

original: Jacob said to Joseph, “God Almighty appeared to me at Luz in the land of Canaan, and there He blessed me
translation: Yakob i tokim Jozef, “God olgeta i kamap long me long Luz long lan bilong Kanaan, na em i givim blessing long me.”

original: and told me, ‘Behold, I will make you fruitful and multiply you; I will make you a multitude of peoples, and will give this land to your descendants after you as an everlasting possession.’
translation: Ol i tokim mi, ‘Lukim, bai mi mekim yu kamap planti na bai mi multiplai yu; bai mi mekim yu i go long olpela narapela pipel, na bai mi givim dispela graun long ol descendants bilong yu olsem posesion we em i go inap long taim.’

original: And now your two sons born to you in Egypt before I came to you here shall be reckoned as mine; Ephraim and Manasseh shall be mine, just as Reuben and Simeon are mine.
translation: Na nau, yu tu pikinini i kam long Egypt bifora mi kam gen harim long yu, ol bai ol i stap wantaim mi; Efraim na Manase bai ol i bilong mi, olsem na Ruben na Simeon ol i bilong mi.

original: Any children born to you after them shall be yours, and they shall be called by the names of their brothers in the territory they inherit.
translation: Ol pikinini i kam bihain long ol, bai ol i bilong yu, na ol i kolim nem bilong ol brata ol i gat long graun we ol i inheritem.

original: Now as for me, when I was returning from Paddan, to my sorrow Rachel died along the way in the land of Canaan, some distance from Ephrath. So I buried her there beside the road to Ephrath” (that is, Bethlehem).
translation: Nau long me, wane em i go bek gen long Paddan, Rachel i dai pinis, na em i bringim sori long mi long rot, long kantri bilong Kanaan, long we distans from Efreta. Na mi putim em i go daun gras long ples we i klose long rot go long Efreta, em i betlehem.

original: When Israel saw the sons of Joseph, he asked, “Who are these?”
translation: Taim Israel i lukim pikinini bilong Josep, na em i askim, “Ol husat i go?”

original: Joseph said to his father, “They are the sons God has given me in this place.” So Jacob said, “Please bring them to me, that I may bless them.”
translation: Yusuf i tokim papa bilong en, "Ol dispela i pikinini Bikpela i givim mi long hap bilong dispela." Na Yakob i tok, "Kam bringim ol i kam klostu long me, bilong me blesim ol."

original: Now Israel’s eyesight was poor because of old age; he could hardly see. Joseph brought his sons to him, and his father kissed them and embraced them.
translation: Na taim bilong lapun i kam, ai bilong Isrel i no gutpela, em i no ina save luk gut. Josep bringim ol pikinini bilong em i kam long en, na tambu bilong em i kisim ol, i givim ol welkam, na showim luv tumas long ol.

original: “I never expected to see your face again,” Israel said to Joseph, “but now God has let me see your children as well.”
translation: “Mi no bin tink bai mi kam lukim pes bilong yu gen,” Israel i tokim Joseph, “tasol nau God i givim mi chance long lukim ol pikinini bilong yu.”

original: Then Joseph removed his sons from his father’s knees and bowed facedown.
translation: Na Josep i kisim wei ol pikinini bilong em long niu bilong papa na i katakwe graun na kasilip.

original: And Joseph took both of them—with Ephraim in his right hand toward Israel’s left hand, and Manasseh in his left hand toward Israel’s right hand—and brought them close to him.
translation: Na Yusuf i kisim tupela ol i go - Efrayim i long han rait bilong en, i go kamdaun long han lef bilong Isrel, na Manase i long han lef bilong en, i go kamdaun long han rait bilong Isrel - na em i bringim ol i kam klus long em.

original: But Israel stretched out his right hand and put it on the head of Ephraim, the younger; and crossing his hands, he put his left on Manasseh’s head, although Manasseh was the firstborn.
translation: Bareket, Israel em i stretim han rit bilong en na putim long hed bilong Efrem, yanga; na em i krosim han bilong en, putim han lef bilong en long hed bilong Manase, dogare Manase em i pikinini bilong bipo.

original: Then he blessed Joseph and said: “May the God before whom my fathers Abraham and Isaac walked, the God who has been my shepherd all my life to this day,
translation: Na em i givim bikim Joseph, em i tok: 'O God we papa bilong me, Abraham na Isaac i go stap i go long hap bilong em, God we i bin stap long hap bilong me olsem sheperd bilong me from taim bilong liklik bilo i kam inap long tede.'

original: the angel who has redeemed me from all harm—may He bless these boys. And may they be called by my name and the names of my fathers Abraham and Isaac, and may they grow into a multitude upon the earth.”
translation: Enjel i bin saveman mi from ol geta harm—em i givim blesing long dispela man. Na ol i kolim nam bilong mi, na nam bilong papa bilong mi, Abrahamu na Aisak, na ol i kamap planti ol long graun.

original: When Joseph saw that his father had placed his right hand on Ephraim’s head, he was displeased and took his father’s hand to move it from Ephraim’s head to Manasseh’s.
translation: Yusuf harim olsem papa bilong em i putim han rit bilong em long het bilong Efrayim, em i bel kol na nogut hamor, na em kisim han bilong papa i kam long het bilong Manase from long het bilong Efrayim.

original: “Not so, my father!” Joseph said. “This one is the firstborn; put your right hand on his head.”
translation: Nogat olsem, papa bilong mi! Joseph i tokim. Dispela em i pikinini bilong papa; putim han rait bilong yu long hed bilong em.

original: But his father refused. “I know, my son, I know!” he said. “He too shall become a people, and he too shall be great; nevertheless, his younger brother shall be greater than he, and his offspring shall become a multitude of nations.”
translation: Tasol papa bilong en i refusim. "Mi save, pikinini bilong mi, mi save!" em i tok. "Em bai kamap olsem wanpela grubu, na em bai bikpela tu; tasol, brata narakai bilong en bai bikpela olsem em, na desenden bilong en bai kamap olsem planti nesen."

original: So that day Jacob blessed them and said: “By you shall Israel pronounce this blessing: ‘May God make you like Ephraim and Manasseh.’” So he put Ephraim before Manasseh.
translation: Na dispela de Yakob blesim ol Iserel, em i tokim ol: "Ol Iserel bai yusim yu long dispela blesing: 'God i mekim yu olsem Efrem na Manase.'" Na em i putim Efrem i go bifor Manase.

original: Then Israel said to Joseph, “Look, I am about to die, but God will be with you and bring you back to the land of your fathers.
translation: Na Isrel i tokim Josoph, "Mi laik dai nau, tasol God bai stap wantaim yu na bai bringim yu bek long kantri bilong tumbuna ol."

original: And to you, as one who is above your brothers, I give the ridge of land that I took from the Amorites with my sword and bow.”
translation: Na long yu, olsem wan man we i stap antap long ol brata bilong yu, mi givim ples hap bilong graun we mi tekem bek long Amori na sip na banar bilong mi.

original: Then Jacob called for his sons and said, “Gather around so that I can tell you what will happen to you in the days to come:
translation: Na Jakob i kolim ol pikinini bilong em, bai em tokim ol: Kam na sindaun longwanem, bai mi tokim yu long ol samting bai kam long yumi long de bebeka i kam.

original: Come together and listen, O sons of Jacob; listen to your father Israel.
translation: Kam tugeta, ol pikinini bilong Jakob, harim tok bilong papa bilong yu, Isrel.

original: Reuben, you are my firstborn, my might, and the beginning of my strength, excelling in honor, excelling in power.
translation: Rupen, yu bilong mi, pikinini namba wan, yu i mi-strong, na stap long hap bilong pawa bilong mi, yu i gat moa hanor, yu i gat moa strong.

original: Uncontrolled as the waters, you will no longer excel, because you went up to your father’s bed, onto my couch, and defiled it.
translation: Olsem wara igat hevi, yu no inap winim moa bikos yu go ap long bet bilong papa bilong yu, na kam longpela sit bilong mi, na yu mekim olgeta bagarap.

original: Simeon and Levi are brothers; their swords are weapons of violence.
translation: Simeon na Levi ol brata; sua bilong ol i weaponry bilong strongim tait.

original: May I never enter their council; may I never join their assembly. For they kill men in their anger, and hamstring oxen on a whim.
translation: Mi no ken go insait long tok bilong ol, mi no ken joiim ol long wok bilong ol, bikos ol i kilim man long rausim bel, na ol i kisim ka long kok bilong bulmakau long wanem samting ol laik.

original: Cursed be their anger, for it is strong, and their wrath, for it is cruel! I will disperse them in Jacob and scatter them in Israel.
translation: Kros i kam long anger bilong ol, bikos em i strong, na wragi bilong ol, bikos em i katkat! Mi bai kirapim ol long ol ples long Yakob, na mi bai tromoi ol long ol ples long Israel.

original: Judah, your brothers shall praise you. Your hand shall be on the necks of your enemies; your father’s sons shall bow down to you.
translation: Juda, bratas bilong yu oli praisim yu. Han bilong yu bai stap long nek bilong eni enemy bilong yu; susa bilong papa bilong yu oli kuku long yu.

original: Judah is a young lion—my son, you return from the prey. Like a lion he crouches and lies down; like a lioness, who dares to rouse him?
translation: Juda em i liklik mani - pikinini bilong mi, yu go bek gen from save bilong ka. Olsem mani em i pundaun na kat i go daun; olsem meri bilong mani, husat ino gat gutpela het bai rausim em?

original: The scepter will not depart from Judah, nor the staff from between his feet, until Shiloh comes and the allegiance of the nations is his.
translation: Seketa bai no lusim hap Judea, na stap bai no lusim long bihain leg bilong en, long taim Shiloh i kam, na loyal bilong ol nesen i bilong em.

original: He ties his donkey to the vine, his colt to the choicest branch. He washes his garments in wine, his robes in the blood of grapes.
translation: Em tasim donki bilong en long paip, em tasim pikinini hos bilong en long braanch we i gat mani strongpela ka. Em wasim rausim klos bilong en long wain, em wasim mal mal bilong en long bled bilong grape.

original: His eyes are darker than wine, and his teeth are whiter than milk.
translation: Ai bilong em i dai olsem wain, na titi bilong em i waite olsem susu.

original: Zebulun shall dwell by the seashore and become a harbor for ships; his border shall extend to Sidon.
translation: Zebulun ol bai stap long sait bilong solwara na bai kamap ples bilong ship; bonda bilong en bai go stret olsem i go kas long Sidon.

original: Issachar is a strong donkey, lying down between the sheepfolds.
translation: Isaka em i strongpela donki, i stap klostu long hap bilong ol pipel wea i kukim ol sip.

original: He saw that his resting place was good and that his land was pleasant, so he bent his shoulder to the burden and submitted to labor as a servant.
translation: Em i lukim ples bilong en i gutpela, na graun bilong en i swit, so em i kisim bek long hap bilong en na raitim bek long wok, na em i kukim bek long wok olsem wanpela servit.

original: Dan shall provide justice for his people as one of the tribes of Israel.
translation: Dan bai givim rait long ol piginini bilong en, olsem wanpela tribe bilong Israel.

original: He will be a snake by the road, a viper in the path that bites the horse’s heels so that its rider tumbles backward.
translation: Em i go nau olsem snek long rot, vapa long ples we i kaikai kileng bilong hos, na bai raita i tumbuna bek.

original: I await Your salvation, O LORD.
translation: Mi waitim salvesen bilong yu, O Lo.

original: Gad will be attacked by raiders, but he will attack their heels.
translation: Gad bai i go daun, na ol i save bagarap em, tasol em bai i givim bak long ol, na kilim hil bilong lek bilong ol.

original: Asher’s food will be rich; he shall provide royal delicacies.
translation: Kaikai bilong Esara em i plenti, na em bai kisim kaikai bilong king.

original: Naphtali is a doe set free that bears beautiful fawns.
translation: Naphtali em i dok bilong malol i stap fri long nap, i karim pikinini kunai i kamap strong na gut.

original: Joseph is a fruitful vine—a fruitful vine by a spring, whose branches scale the wall.
translation: Yusuf em i wan vin wei i karim planti frut klostu long wan spring, na branis bilong en i go antap long fenisi.

original: The archers attacked him with bitterness; they aimed at him in hostility.
translation: Arua i paitim em wantaim bel het, ol i tanim em long bel bilong ol.

original: Yet he steadied his bow, and his strong arms were tempered by the hands of the Mighty One of Jacob, in the name of the Shepherd, the Rock of Israel,
translation: Em i strongim banar bilong en, na arm bilong en i strong na i kamap gutpela olsem wan i warkim long han bilong Wan i Strongpela bilong Jacob, long nem bilong Pasinda, Rok bilong Israel.

original: by the God of your father who helps you, and by the Almighty who blesses you, with blessings of the heavens above, with blessings of the depths below, with blessings of the breasts and womb.
translation: Long God bilong papa bilong yu hu i hepim yu, na long Bikpela hu i givim yu blesings, wantaim blesings bilong heven antap, wantaim blesings bilong dai bun daunbilo, wantaim blesings bilong susu na bel.

original: The blessings of your father have surpassed the blessings of the ancient mountains and the bounty of the everlasting hills. May they rest on the head of Joseph, on the brow of the prince of his brothers.
translation: Blessings bilong papa yu i winim blessings bilong maunten ol i go bek long taim bifo, na givim plenti bilong maunten ol i stap foreva. Oli mas sindaun long hed bilong Joseph, long banis bilong prins bilong brata bilong em.

original: Benjamin is a ravenous wolf; in the morning he devours the prey, in the evening he divides the plunder.”
translation: Benjamin em i wol i gat bikpela bel; long moning em i kaikai olgeta samting we em i kisim, long apinun em i salim olgeta samting we em i winim.

original: These are the tribes of Israel, twelve in all, and this was what their father said to them. He blessed them, and he blessed each one with a suitable blessing.
translation: Dispela ol tribes bilong Israel, olgeta twelva, na dispela em i tok bilong tamberi papa bilong ol. Em i givim apini long ol, na em i givim strongpela apini bilong en long wanwan bilong ol.

original: Then Jacob instructed them, “I am about to be gathered to my people. Bury me with my fathers in the cave in the field of Ephron the Hittite.
translation: Jakob i tokim ol, "Mi go kamap i dai na bai mi go stap wantaim papa na mama bilong mi. Pitim skel bilong mi wantaim skel bilong tumbuna bilong mi long hole bilong ples bilong Efron Hiti, long ples bilong buri tumbuna."

original: The cave is in the field of Machpelah near Mamre, in the land of Canaan. This is the field Abraham purchased from Ephron the Hittite as a burial site.
translation: Guava i stap long ples Machpelah nambis Kamanre, long kantri Kananan. Em i ples Abraham baim long Ephron Hiti olsem ples bilong bikim belo.

original: There Abraham and his wife Sarah are buried, there Isaac and his wife Rebekah are buried, and there I buried Leah.
translation: Long hap em, Abram na meri bilong en Sara i stap kisim pekela, long hap em Aisak na meri bilong en Rebeka i stap kisim pekela, na long hap em mi kisim Pekela bilong Lia.

original: The field and the cave that is in it were purchased from the Hittites.”
translation: Graun na hole igat em baim bek long Hiti.

original: When Jacob had finished instructing his sons, he pulled his feet into the bed and breathed his last, and he was gathered to his people.
translation: Wanpela taim Yakob i pinis long tisa ol pikinini bilong en, em i kilim bek fut bilong en i go insait long bet, na em i pusim win, na em i kamap wantaim ol arafam bilong en.

original: Then Joseph fell upon his father’s face, wept over him, and kissed him.
translation: Na Josep i pundaun long pes bilong papa, nogut olsem na kisim taranga long em, na kisim em.

original: And Joseph directed the physicians in his service to embalm his father Israel. So they embalmed him,
translation: Na Yusuf i givim tok imprishon long dokta ol i mekim ol samting bilong stopim bodi i go daun, long servise bilong en, ol i mekim bodi bilong papa bilong en, Isrel, i stap.

original: taking the forty days required to complete the embalming. And the Egyptians mourned for him seventy days.
translation: Takin 40 de pe, na ol i kamapim pinis long wokim bodi i stap strong. Na Egipita ol i bin sorim bikos em long 70 de pe.

original: When the days of mourning had passed, Joseph said to Pharaoh’s court, “If I have found favor in your eyes, please tell Pharaoh that
translation: Taim bilong sori i go pinis, Joseph i tokim husat i stap long kaunti bilong Pharaoh, "Mi findim gudpela chans long ai bilong yu, yu tokim Pharaoh olsem"

original: my father made me swear an oath when he said, ‘I am about to die. You must bury me in the tomb that I dug for myself in the land of Canaan.’ Now let me go and bury my father, and then return.”
translation: Papa bilong me hem mekim me nambaut long ath, olsem: 'Mi go i kamap dai. Yu mas wokim bodi bilong mi insait long holem bilong ded em papa bilong me digim long kanana.' Nau lilim mi go wokim bodi bilong papa bilong mi, na bihain bai mi kam bek.

original: Pharaoh replied, “Go up and bury your father, as he made you swear to do.”
translation: Faraon i tok, "Kisim bodi bilong papa bilong yu go wai, olsem yu promis long mekim."

original: Then Joseph went to bury his father, and all the servants of Pharaoh accompanied him—the elders of Pharaoh’s household and all the elders of the land of Egypt—
translation: Na Joseph i go wokim berevement long papa bilong en, na ol servants bilong Pharaoh, ol bikpela man bilong haus bilong Pharaoh, na ol bikpela man bilong graun bilong Ijip, ol i go wantaim em.

original: along with all of Joseph’s household, and his brothers, and his father’s household. Only their children and flocks and herds were left in Goshen.
translation: Wantaim ol arufelo na husat bilong Yosep, brata bilong en, na husat bilong papa bilong en. Nupela pikinini, lok na bulmakau tasol i stap long Gosen.

original: Chariots and horsemen alike went up with him, and it was an exceedingly large procession.
translation: Kar na haus mon meri ol i go apo wantaim em, na em i bikpela train long ol pipol, olsem i Hammer long wol tumas.

original: When they reached the threshing floor of Atad, which is across the Jordan, they lamented and wailed loudly, and Joseph mourned for his father seven days.
translation: Tupela i go daun long ples bilong Atad, em i stap klostu long Jordan, ol i bikim sori na kisim bikpela hari, na Joseph i sori tru long tete bilong en, na i wail strong long seven de.

original: When the Canaanites of the land saw the mourning at the threshing floor of Atad, they said, “This is a solemn ceremony of mourning by the Egyptians.” Thus the place across the Jordan is called Abel-mizraim.
translation: Taim Kanani bilong kantri i lukim sori long plen gras bilong krungutim pik bilong Atad, ol i tok, “Em i seremoni bilong sori tru bilong Ijip.” Olsem ples antap long Jordan em i kolim Abel-mizraim.

original: So Jacob’s sons did as he had charged them.
translation: Sons bilong Yakob i mekim olsem em i tokim ol long taim bipo.

original: They carried him to the land of Canaan and buried him in the cave at Machpelah in the field near Mamre, which Abraham had purchased from Ephron the Hittite as a burial site.
translation: Ol i kam bekim em na kisim em go long kantri Kanana na bilim em insait long hole long Makpele long ples nambis Mamre, em baim olgeta long Efren Hiti olsem ples bilong birim.

original: After Joseph had buried his father, he returned to Egypt with his brothers and all who had gone with him to bury his father.
translation: Long Joseph kam apim na katim papa bilong em, na em i go bek gen long Egip wantaim brata bilong em na ol man meri i go wai bek long katim papa bilong em.

original: When Joseph’s brothers saw that their father was dead, they said, “What if Joseph bears a grudge? Then he will surely repay us for all the evil that we did to him.”
translation: Taim brata bilong Joseph harim papa bilong ol i dai pinis, ol i tok, "Sapos Joseph i gat bel hevi, orait em bai kam bek na givim pes bilong ol long olgeta nogut ol i mekim long em."

original: So they sent word to Joseph, saying, “Before he died, your father commanded,
translation: Ol i salim tok long Joseph, ol i tok, “Bipo em i dai, papa bilong yu i givim komando,”

original: ‘This is what you are to say to Joseph: I beg you, please forgive the transgression and sin of your brothers, for they did you wrong.’ So now, Joseph, please forgive the transgression of the servants of the God of your father.” When their message came to him, Joseph wept.
translation: Mi rogol yu, bikim bekim olgeta samting nogut long ol bikhet na sin bilong brata yumi, ol i mekim rong long yu. Nau, Joseph, mi rogol yu, bikim bekim ol bikhet bilong wokman bilong God bilong papa bilong yu. Taim em i kam long em, Joseph i krai.

original: His brothers also came to him, bowed down before him, and said, “We are your slaves!”
translation: Brata bilong em i kam, ol i paul long graun na tok, "Yumi servist bilong yu!"

original: But Joseph replied, “Do not be afraid. Am I in the place of God?
translation: Bare Joseph i tokim ol, "No ken skelim yu. Mi stap long ples bilong God?"

original: As for you, what you intended against me for evil, God intended for good, in order to accomplish a day like this—to preserve the lives of many people.
translation: Olsem yu bin laikim long me ol samting nogut, tasol God bin laikim long guod, olsem nau i kam bek long taim ples, long save ol lif blong planti manmeri.

original: Therefore do not be afraid. I will provide for you and your little ones.” So Joseph reassured his brothers and spoke kindly to them.
translation: Nogat, no ken bikim fear. Mi bai sapotim yu na ol pikinini bilong yu. Na Joseph i stilim bel bilong ol brata na em toktok long tem, wok bilong papa, lukautim ol pikinini.

original: Now Joseph and his father’s household remained in Egypt, and Joseph lived to the age of 110.
translation: Na Yusuf na husat i stap long haos bilong papa bilong em, ol i stap yet long Egip, na Yusuf i livim na rikim pinis taim bilong 110 yia.

original: He saw Ephraim’s sons to the third generation, and indeed the sons of Machir son of Manasseh were brought up on Joseph’s knees.
translation: Em i lukim pikinini bilong Ephraim long genarason thri, na tru, pikinini bilong Machir, pikinini bilong Manasseh, ol i grow up long kni bilong Joseph.

original: Then Joseph said to his brothers, “I am about to die, but God will surely visit you and bring you up from this land to the land He promised on oath to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.”
translation: Na Yusif i tokim ol brata bilong en, "Mi kam dai pinis, tasol God bai kam bek gen i visitim yupela na bai karim yupela i go ap long graun we God i promis tok long tromoi long Abraham, Aitik, na Jakob."

original: And Joseph made the sons of Israel take an oath and said, “God will surely attend to you, and then you must carry my bones up from this place.”
translation: Na Yusuf i makim oas long ol pikinini bilong Isrel, ol i tok, "God bai katolim yu, na bihain bai yu mas kisim bon bilong mi i go antap long ples ia."

original: So Joseph died at the age of 110. And they embalmed his body and placed it in a coffin in Egypt.
translation: Yosep i dai long taim em i 110 yia. Ol i save bodi bilong em olsem kastom bilong ol pipol long taim bipo, na ol i putim em insait bokis bilong dai, na wakim i go het long Egypt.

original: These are the names of the sons of Israel who went to Egypt with Jacob, each with his family:
translation: Nem bilong pikinini Israel i go long Egip taem Jacob, ol i go wantaim famili bilong ol.

original: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah;
translation: Ruben, Simeon, Lefai, na Juda;

original: Issachar, Zebulun, and Benjamin;
translation: Isakara, Sebuluna, na Benjamen; nem bilong tripe ol i kam long en.

original: Dan and Naphtali; Gad and Asher.
translation: Dan na Naphtali; Gad na Asher.

original: The descendants of Jacob numbered seventy in all, including Joseph, who was already in Egypt.
translation: Ol desenden bilong Yakob i kamap seventy olgeta, inklusim Jozef, em i stap already long Egip.

original: Now Joseph and all his brothers and all that generation died,
translation: Nau Yosep na ol brata bilong em, na ol generashen ol i dai pinis.

original: but the Israelites were fruitful and increased rapidly; they multiplied and became exceedingly numerous, so that the land was filled with them.
translation: Barekat ol Israelait i bringim planti pikinini na i kamap bikpela, ol i multiplai na kamap traem bikpela, soreni plaesa i fulap long ol.

original: Then a new king, who did not know Joseph, came to power in Egypt.
translation: Nupela king i kamap nau long ples bilong pawa long Ejip, em i no save long Joseph.

original: “Look,” he said to his people, “the Israelites have become too numerous and too powerful for us.
translation: Em i tokim ples bilong em, “Luke, ol Isrelite i kamap planti na strongpela tru long mipela.”

original: Come, let us deal shrewdly with them, or they will increase even more; and if a war breaks out, they may join our enemies, fight against us, and leave the country.”
translation: Kam, mipela i ken usim lak bilong mipela long ol, o ol i go ap moa yet; na sapos woit i kamap, bai ol joiim enemy bilong mipela, ol bai faitim mipela, na ol bai lim kantri.

original: So the Egyptians appointed taskmasters over the Israelites to oppress them with forced labor. As a result, they built Pithom and Rameses as store cities for Pharaoh.
translation: Na Egipcio i givim bos bilong wok long Israel, olsem oli bai mekim wok we ol i dai long mekim. Ol i mekim Pithom na Rameses olsem sitibodi bilong Pharaoh.

original: But the more they were oppressed, the more they multiplied and flourished; so the Egyptians came to dread the Israelites.
translation: Be ol i kamap i mas pikinini, olsem ol i plenti na kamap strongpela; na hivim Ijipita i bikim afraid long Isrelita.

original: They worked the Israelites ruthlessly
translation: Ol i wokim wark long Oli Israel na ol i mekim ol i sut long ol.

original: and made their lives bitter with hard labor in brick and mortar, and with all kinds of work in the fields. Every service they imposed was harsh.
translation: Na ol i mekim laip bilong ol i kamap biter wantaim wok hat long brik na mota, na wantaim ol kain kain wok long gras bilong planim. Ol i givim ol servicing olsem, na nau every servic em i kamap strong na hat.

original: Then the king of Egypt said to the Hebrew midwives, whose names were Shiphrah and Puah,
translation: Kina bilong Ejip i tokim ol meri i helpim bekim pikinini bilong Judi, em tasol Sifara na Puwa,

original: “When you help the Hebrew women give birth, observe them on the birthstools. If the child is a son, kill him; but if it is a daughter, let her live.”
translation: Wanpela taim yu helpim meri Iuda long karim bebe, kisim ka long ol meri Iuda long stol bilong karim bebe. I sori, bikos yu mas kisim ka long bebe. Sapos bebe i pikinini man, kilim em; tasol sapos bebe i pikinini meri, lusaim meri i stap.

original: The midwives, however, feared God and did not do as the king of Egypt had instructed; they let the boys live.
translation: Ol meri i givim biris i tekim ot long God, ol i no mekim olsem kingly Egipt i tokim; ol i livim ol man.

original: So the king of Egypt summoned the midwives and asked them, “Why have you done this? Why have you let the boys live?”
translation: King bilong Egip i kirapim olegreta meri i helpim bekim bebi, em i askim ol, "Wai yu mekim dispela? Bihaen yu no ken kilim man pikinini?"

original: The midwives answered Pharaoh, “The Hebrew women are not like the Egyptian women, for they are vigorous and give birth before a midwife arrives.”
translation: Ol nambis i givim tok bilong Pharaoh, "Meri Hebrew i no olsem meri Egypt, bikos ol i strong na ol i karim bebi bifo nambis i kam."

original: So God was good to the midwives, and the people multiplied and became even more numerous.
translation: Bikpela i givim gutpela to meri helpim bornim baby, na ol pipol i kalap, na i kamap moa planti.

original: And because the midwives feared God, He gave them families of their own.
translation: Na bilong ol meri i helpim birua ol i save long God, Em i givim ol pikanini na famili bilong ol yet.

original: Then Pharaoh commanded all his people: “Every son born to the Hebrews you must throw into the Nile, but every daughter you may allow to live.”
translation: Na Pharaoh i givim komando long ol pipol bilong en: "Ol pikinini man i kam long Hepri, yu mas pilim ol i go long wara bilong Nile, tasol ol meri yu ken lusim ol i stap."

original: Now a man of the house of Levi married a daughter of Levi,
translation: Man bilong haus Levy i marit meri bilong Levy.

original: and she conceived and gave birth to a son. When she saw that he was a beautiful child, she hid him for three months.
translation: Na em i karim na em i bikim bek. Ol i lukim olsem em i pikinini nais, na ol i tekewe em i hap long mun tri.

original: But when she could no longer hide him, she got him a papyrus basket and coated it with tar and pitch. Then she placed the child in the basket and set it among the reeds along the bank of the Nile.
translation: Taim em i no ken kaivim hem nau, na em kisim wanpela basket long ol papai, em pasim em wantaim tar na pitch. Em putim pikinini long basket, na em lusim em long bus, long sait bilong Nail river.

original: And his sister stood at a distance to see what would happen to him.
translation: Na susa bilong em i stap bek long wei bilong lukim husat bai kamap long em.

original: Soon the daughter of Pharaoh went down to bathe in the Nile, and her attendants were walking along the riverbank. And when she saw the basket among the reeds, she sent her maidservant to retrieve it.
translation: Susa Faraon i go daun kanam na wasim bodi long Nail, na ol i wok wantaim em i wok bout long raiva. Na when em i lukim biket em i stap among gras bilong wara, em i salim meri servist i go kisim.

original: When she opened it, she saw the child, and behold, the little boy was crying. So she had compassion on him and said, “This is one of the Hebrew children.”
translation: Taim em opim, em lukim Pikinini, na Pikinini i krai. Na em i kisim sofeli long en, ol i tok, “Dispela em i wanpela pikinini bilong Judi.”

original: Then his sister said to Pharaoh’s daughter, “Shall I go and call one of the Hebrew women to nurse the child for you?”
translation: Susa bilong em i tok olsem long dota bilong Pharaoh, “Inap mi go na kisim kol long wanpela meri Hebrew i kam sukim child bilong yu?”

original: “Go ahead,” Pharaoh’s daughter told her. And the girl went and called the boy’s mother.
translation: “Kam na go,” Dota meri bilong Pharaoh i tokim em. Na gitel i go na kisim mama bilong pikinini man.

original: Pharaoh’s daughter said to her, “Take this child and nurse him for me, and I will pay your wages.” So the woman took the boy and nursed him.
translation: Pikinini bilong Faraon i tokim em, "Kisim bek dispela pikinini na jikim han long en behalf blong me, na mi bai peim yu." Na meri i kisim man i go jikim han long en.

original: When the child had grown older, she brought him to Pharaoh’s daughter, and he became her son. She named him Moses and explained, “I drew him out of the water.”
translation: Pikinini i go big nau, em i kam bekim Pharaoh meri pikinini, na em i bikim pikinini bilong em. Em i givim nem Moses long em, na em i tok, "Mi pulim em long wara."

original: One day, after Moses had grown up, he went out to his own people and observed their hard labor. He saw an Egyptian beating a Hebrew, one of his own people.
translation: Wanpela de, long long bihain Mosis i kamap bikpela, na em i go aut go long ol pikanini bilong em, na i lukim ol i warka hat. Em i lukim wanpela Egyptian i paitim wanpela Hebrew, wanpela bilong ol pikanini bilong em.

original: After looking this way and that and seeing no one, he struck down the Egyptian and hid his body in the sand.
translation: Em i lukluk olsem na olsem, na i no save lukim narapela man, na em i kilim man bilong Ipig, na em i kisim bodi bilong man, i stap long san.

original: The next day Moses went out and saw two Hebrews fighting. He asked the one in the wrong, “Why are you attacking your companion?”
translation: Nekis dei Musu Moses i go aut na i lukim tu Hebrew i paait. Em i askim man long wrong, "Wai yu kaikai poroman bilong yu?"

original: But the man replied, “Who made you ruler and judge over us? Are you planning to kill me as you killed the Egyptian?” Then Moses was afraid and thought, “This thing I have done has surely become known.”
translation: Man i tokim, "God i mekim yu bos na jajman long yupela? Yu laik kilim mi olsem yu kilim Ijip?" Moses i bikim fear na tinkim, "Dispela samting em i kamap klia nau."

original: When Pharaoh heard about this matter, he sought to kill Moses. But Moses fled from Pharaoh and settled in the land of Midian, where he sat down beside a well.
translation: Taim Pharaoh harim tok bilong dispela matir, em bin serchim bekim Moses i dai. Moses ranawe long Pharaoh na em go sindaun klostu long kantri bilong Midian, na em sidaun besaid wel.

original: Now the priest of Midian had seven daughters, and they came to draw water and fill the troughs to water their father’s flock.
translation: Nau pries bilong Midian i gat seven daughters, na ol i kam bek long drawim wara na ol i filim trafs bilong wara long wara bilong ol biruk bilong papa ol.

original: And when some shepherds came along and drove them away, Moses rose up to help them and watered their flock.
translation: Na taim ol shepherd i kam na kisim bek ol, Moses em i kirap na halivim ol, na givim wara long ol animol bilong ol.

original: When the daughters returned to their father Reuel, he asked them, “Why have you returned so early today?”
translation: Tupela pikinini meri i go bek long papa bilong ol, Reuel, na hem i askim ol, "Ol i kam bek long moning, tede, why?"

original: “An Egyptian rescued us from the shepherds,” they replied. “He even drew water for us and watered the flock.”
translation: Wan man Egypt i saveim mipela from ol pasor, ol i tok. Em i kilim wara, na em i givim wara long ol kuk.

original: “So where is he?” their father asked. “Why did you leave the man behind? Invite him to have something to eat.”
translation: Papa bilong ol i askim, "Em stap we?" Ol i lusim man i go, papa i tok, "Kisim i go, givim em kaikai olsem tok bilong hap bilong welkam."

original: Moses agreed to stay with the man, and he gave his daughter Zipporah to Moses in marriage.
translation: Moses i tokim ol yet long stap wantaim man, na papa i givim Sipora, gel bilong en, long Moses olsem meri, na Moses i maritim Sipora.

original: And she gave birth to a son, and Moses named him Gershom, saying, “I have become a foreigner in a foreign land.”
translation: Na Meri i karim man i kamap, na Mosis i givim nem bilong em Gershom, olsem, "Mi go bek long kantri bilong otheman, na em i man bilong otheman."

original: After a long time, the king of Egypt died. The Israelites groaned and cried out under their burden of slavery, and their cry for deliverance from bondage ascended to God.
translation: Long taem igo pinis, king bilong Ijip dai pinis. Oli Israelites harim bikbus na kisim sori long wok hele long slavery, na olkaen ol kisim sori long resis long bondage i go antap long God.

original: So God heard their groaning, and He remembered His covenant with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
translation: Bikpela i harim toktok long ol yar bilong ol, na em i memorim kovenant bilong em long Abraham, Aisak, na Jakob.

original: God saw the Israelites and took notice.
translation: Bikpela i lukim Ol Israel na i save long ol.

original: Meanwhile, Moses was shepherding the flock of his father-in-law Jethro, the priest of Midian. He led the flock to the far side of the wilderness and came to Horeb, the mountain of God.
translation: Wanpela taim, Mosis i lukim ol sheep bilong papa bilong meri, Jetru, pris bilong Midian. Em i karim ol sheep go long sait bilong bus, na em i kam long Horeb, maunten bilong God.

original: There the angel of the LORD appeared to him in a blazing fire from within a bush. Moses saw the bush ablaze with fire, but it was not consumed.
translation: Long dispela taim, Ein angel bilong Lod i kamap long em insait long bus, na paia i bungim. Moses i lukim bus i bung wantaim paia, tasol em i no bin kisim.

original: So Moses thought, “I must go over and see this marvelous sight. Why is the bush not burning up?”
translation: Moses tingim, "Mi mas go kam lukim dispela sait bilong amaze. Wai ol bush i no bin katim na i no bin burn yet?"

original: When the LORD saw that he had gone over to look, God called out to him from within the bush, “Moses, Moses!” “Here I am,” he answered.
translation: Bikpela i lukim ol i go daun bek long lukim, God i singaut long bus em nau, “Mosis, Mosis!” “Mi stap hare,” em i ankam.

original: “Do not come any closer,” God said. “Take off your sandals, for the place where you are standing is holy ground.”
translation: “Nogat, no ken go klosap long yu,” God i tok. “Kisim sandal bilong yu na putim i go daun, bikos ples we yu stap yet em i graun bilong spirit.”

original: Then He said, “I am the God of your father, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.” At this, Moses hid his face, for he was afraid to look at God.
translation: Em i tok, “Mi bikpela, God bilong papa bilong yu, God bilong Abraham, God bilong Isaak, na God bilong Jakob.” Long dispela, Moses i kisim hes bilong en i go behain, em i bin pikinava long lukim God tasol.

original: The LORD said, “I have indeed seen the affliction of My people in Egypt. I have heard them crying out because of their oppressors, and I am aware of their sufferings.
translation: Papa God i tok, "Mi trai lukim siporo bilong ol pipol bilong mi long Egip. Mi hiam i harim ol kaikai long dispela toksave ol i bagarapim ol, na mi save long ol pilim na OGATAS bilong ol."

original: I have come down to rescue them from the hand of the Egyptians and to bring them up out of that land to a good and spacious land, a land flowing with milk and honey—the home of the Canaanites, Hittites, Amorites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites.
translation: Mi kam daun bilong save ol long han bilong Ijip, na karim ol i go apo long hap land, olsem long wanpela gudpela na spesolpela lan, wanpela lan we i flowe long milk na honey, em i ples bilong Kanani, Hiti, Amori, Perizi, Hivi, na Jebusi.

original: And now the cry of the Israelites has reached Me, and I have seen how severely the Egyptians are oppressing them.
translation: Na krai bilong Israel i kam bek long me, na mi lukim ol Ijipiti i bagarapim ol Israelite ole geta.

original: Therefore, go! I am sending you to Pharaoh to bring My people the Israelites out of Egypt.”
translation: Bihain, go na sen Gim! Mi sendim yu go long Faraon, i mekim yu kisim piple bilong mi, Israelites, na kamaut long Egip.

original: But Moses asked God, “Who am I, that I should go to Pharaoh and bring the Israelites out of Egypt?”
translation: Mosis tokim God, “Husait mi, bai mi go long Pharaoh na kisim Israelites i kam aus long Egip?”

original: “I will surely be with you,” God said, “and this will be the sign to you that I have sent you: When you have brought the people out of Egypt, all of you will worship God on this mountain.”
translation: “Mi stap wantaim yu tru,” Bikpela i tok, “dispela em i go bekim sain long yu: Wanpela taim yu kam autim ol pipol long Egip, yupela olgeta bai go lusim Bikpela long maunten dispela.”

original: Then Moses asked God, “Suppose I go to the Israelites and say to them, ‘The God of your fathers has sent me to you,’ and they ask me, ‘What is His name?’ What should I tell them?”
translation: Na Moses i askim God olsem, "Sapos mi go long ol Israeliti na mi tokim ol, 'God bilong tumbuna bilong yu, em i sendim mi kam long yu,' na ol i askim mi, 'Wanem nem bilong Em?' Mi mas tokim ol long wanem?"

original: God said to Moses, “I AM WHO I AM. This is what you are to say to the Israelites: ‘I AM has sent me to you.’”
translation: God i tokim Moses, “Mi yet, mi yet, olsem na mipela yet. Dispela em i tok bilong yu long ol Israel: ‘Mi yet i salim mi kam long yupela.’”

original: God also told Moses, “Say to the Israelites, ‘The LORD, the God of your fathers—the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob—has sent me to you.’ This is My name forever, and this is how I am to be remembered in every generation.
translation: God i tokim Moses, "Yu tokim ol Israelit, 'LORD, God bilong papa na mama bilong yu - God bilong Abraham, God bilong Aisak, na God bilong Jakob - i salim mi kam long yu.' Dispela em i nem bilong Mi foreva, na ol i mas remember Mif oreva long ol generesen.

original: Go, assemble the elders of Israel and say to them, ‘The LORD, the God of your fathers—the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob—has appeared to me and said: I have surely attended to you and have seen what has been done to you in Egypt.
translation: Go, asamble ol bikpela man bilong Isrel na tokim ol: LORD, Bikpela bilong tumbuna bilong yupela - Bikpela bilong Abraham, Aisak, na Jakob - igo kam long me na tokim mi: Mi go wai long yupela na mi lukim ol samting we i kamap long yupela long Egip.

original: And I have promised to bring you up out of your affliction in Egypt, into the land of the Canaanites, Hittites, Amorites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites—a land flowing with milk and honey.’
translation: Na mi promis baim yu kam bek long hia long laif i go daun bilong yu long sik bilong het bilong yu long Ijip, long laine bilong Kananait, Hitait, Amorait, Perisait, Hibait, na Jebusait – em i laine i go daun long susu na hanii.

original: The elders of Israel will listen to what you say, and you must go with them to the king of Egypt and tell him, ‘The LORD, the God of the Hebrews, has met with us. Now please let us take a three-day journey into the wilderness, so that we may sacrifice to the LORD our God.’
translation: Bikpela iet bilong Israel bai harim tok bilong yu, na yu mas go wantaim ol long king bilong Ijip, na tusim tok, ‘Bikpela iet, God bilong Heprew, em i kam kaikai wantaim mipela.’ Nau bipela iet, mipela i laik go long wik tri deh long bus, mipela i mas wokim sakrisi long Bikpela iet God bilong mipela.

original: But I know that the king of Egypt will not allow you to go unless a mighty hand compels him.
translation: Mi save king bilong Ijip, em no go givim yu go unless han bilong pawa i kam bekim em.

original: So I will stretch out My hand and strike the Egyptians with all the wonders I will perform among them. And after that, he will release you.
translation: Mi go stretim han bilong mi, na kilim ol Ijip wantaim ol wondas mi bai mekim long ol. Na bihain, em bai lusim yu.

original: And I will grant this people such favor in the sight of the Egyptians that when you leave, you will not go away empty-handed.
translation: Na mi bai givim dispela ples ia long ol pipol, ol i kamap strong long ai bilong Egyptian, na wän yü lusim, yü no go wai na emti han.

original: Every woman shall ask her neighbor and any woman staying in her house for silver and gold jewelry and clothing, and you will put them on your sons and daughters. So you will plunder the Egyptians.”
translation: Ol meri yet, bai yu askim neba meri bilong yu na meri i stap insait long haus bilong yu, olsem ya, bai yu askim ol long silva, gold, jeweri, na klos. Na bai yu putim olsem long pikinini man na pikinini meri bilong yu, na olsem, bai yu bagarapim Egyptian.

original: Then Moses answered, “What if they do not believe me or listen to my voice? For they may say, ‘The LORD has not appeared to you.’”
translation: Moses i tokim, “Sapos ol i no bilivim me o hapasim han bilong ol long tok bilong mi? Ol bai tok, ‘LORD i no kamap long yu.’”

original: And the LORD asked him, “What is that in your hand?” “A staff,” he replied.
translation: Na Papa God i askim em, "Wanem samting we i stap long han bilong yu?" "Em i stik bilong komiti," na em i mekim tok.

original: “Throw it on the ground,” said the LORD. So Moses threw it on the ground, and it became a snake, and he ran from it.
translation: “Trowe em long graun,” ol i save long Papa bilong olgeta. Na Moses trowe em long graun, na em i kamapim snek, na em i ranawe friom em.

original: “Stretch out your hand and grab it by the tail,” the LORD said to Moses, who reached out his hand and caught the snake, and it turned back into a staff in his hand.
translation: Bikpela i tokim Mosis, “Stretim han bilong yu na kisim em long tetem,” Mosis stretim han bilong en, kisim snek, na i kam bek gen long staf bilong en.

original: “This is so that they may believe that the LORD, the God of their fathers—the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob—has appeared to you.”
translation: Na ol i bilivim olsem LORD, God bilong tumbuna ol, God bilong Abraham, God bilong Aisak, na God bilong Jakob, i kam ap long yu.

original: Furthermore, the LORD said to Moses, “Put your hand inside your cloak.” So he put his hand inside his cloak, and when he took it out, his hand was leprous, white as snow.
translation: Bikpela i tokim Mosis, “Putim han bilong yu insait long klak bilong yu.” Na em putim han bilong en insait long klak bilong en, na bai em kamautim han bilong en, han bilong en i kamap sik bilong skina i brok, wei olsem snou.

original: “Put your hand back inside your cloak,” said the LORD. So Moses put his hand back inside his cloak, and when he took it out, it was restored, like the rest of his skin.
translation: “Putim han bilong yu bek gen insait lo bagarap bilong yu,” tok Bikpela. Na Mosese putim han bilong en bek gen insait long bagarap bilong en, na wannem em kam aut, em i kam bek gen olsem sken bilong em.

original: And the LORD said, “If they refuse to believe you or heed the witness of the first sign, they may believe that of the second.
translation: Na Bikpela i tok, "Ifraym ol i no bilip yu o ira hapim i go pasim witnes bilong sain em i kam first, orait bai ol bai bilip olsem long nambatu sain."

original: But if they do not believe even these two signs or listen to your voice, take some water from the Nile and pour it on the dry ground. Then the water you take from the Nile will become blood on the ground.”
translation: Bai sapos ol i no bilivim strong lo dispela tupela saen o no harim tok bilong yu, yu ken kisim olsem wata long Nil riba na putim wata long graun i drai. Na bai wata yu kisim long Nil riba bai kamap blod long graun.

original: “Please, Lord,” Moses replied, “I have never been eloquent, neither in the past nor since You have spoken to Your servant, for I am slow of speech and tongue.”
translation: Moses i tok bek, “Papa bilong olgeta, mi no bin saveman strong long tok, na bai sinds Yu tokim servant bilong yu, mi i go i slow long tok na mi i go i slow long maus.”

original: And the LORD said to him, “Who gave man his mouth? Or who makes the mute or the deaf, the sighted or the blind? Is it not I, the LORD?
translation: Bikpela i tokim em, “Husat i givim maus long man? Husat i mekim ol mute o deaf, ol i lukluk o ol blik? Em ino mi, Bikpela?”

original: Now go! I will help you as you speak, and I will teach you what to say.”
translation: Nau go nau! Mi halivim yu long tok, na mi skulim yu long dispela wan yu mas tok.

original: But Moses replied, “Please, Lord, send someone else.”
translation: Mosis i tokim, "Papa bilong mipela, yu salim wanpela man i go."

original: Then the anger of the LORD burned against Moses, and He said, “Is not Aaron the Levite your brother? I know that he can speak well, and he is now on his way to meet you. When he sees you, he will be glad in his heart.
translation: Na iara bilong Jehovah i bungim olsem ayogena long Moses, na Em i tok, "Aaron Levait, brotha bilong yu, em i no? Mi save olsem em i man i goht long tok, na em i kam nau long miksim yu. Wanpela em i lukim yu, em i belisim strong long het bilong en."

original: You are to speak to him and put the words in his mouth. I will help both of you to speak, and I will teach you what to do.
translation: Yupela mas tokim olsem long em, na mi putim wods long maus bilong en. Mi halivim yupela tupela long tok, na mi laik trainim yupela long ol samting yu mas mekim.

original: He will speak to the people for you. He will be your spokesman, and it will be as if you were God to him.
translation: Em bai tokim ol pipol long yu, na em bai kamap spikman bilong yu, na olsem yu God long em.

original: But take this staff in your hand so you can perform signs with it.”
translation: Kisim sta af long han bilong yu na yu ken wokim sain wantaim.

original: Then Moses went back to his father-in-law Jethro and said to him, “Please let me return to my brothers in Egypt to see if they are still alive.” “Go in peace,” Jethro replied.
translation: Moses i go bek gen long papa bilong wife bilong em, Jethro, na i tokim em, “Mi lak go bek gen long brata bilong mi long Egip ta see if ol i stap yet.” Jethro i tokim em, “Yu go long peis.”

original: Now the LORD had said to Moses in Midian, “Go back to Egypt, for all the men who sought to kill you are dead.”
translation: Nau olsem LORD i tok long Moses long ples Midian, “Yu go bak long Egip, bikos ol man ol i lukim kilim yu pinis, ol i dai finis.”

original: So Moses took his wife and sons, put them on a donkey, and headed back to Egypt. And he took the staff of God in his hand.
translation: Na Mosese i kisim meri na pikinini bilong em, i putim ol long donki, na i go bek gen long Ijip. Na i kisim stik bilong God long han bilong en.

original: The LORD instructed Moses, “When you go back to Egypt, see that you perform before Pharaoh all the wonders that I have put within your power. But I will harden his heart so that he will not let the people go.
translation: LORD i givim instructin long Mosese, "Wanpela taim yu go bek gen long Egip, lumu yu wokim mahnet olgeta wondas we mi putim i insait long powa bilong yu. Baine mi bai strongim het bilong em, na em no bagarap letim ol pipol i go.

original: Then tell Pharaoh that this is what the LORD says: ‘Israel is My firstborn son,
translation: Tokim Pharaoh, Lod i tok olsem: Israel em i pikinini bilong me nau.

original: and I told you to let My son go so that he may worship Me. But since you have refused to let him go, behold, I will kill your firstborn son!’”
translation: Na mi bin tokim yu long letim pikinini bilong mi i go, bilong em i servisim mi. Tasol long yu no gat hevi long letim i go, lukim, mi bai kilim pikinini bilong yu we i kam first!

original: Now at a lodging place along the way, the LORD met Moses and was about to kill him.
translation: Long ples bilong stap long rot, Bikpela i go bekim Mosese, na i kam bekim em, bai i kilim em.

original: But Zipporah took a flint knife, cut off her son’s foreskin, and touched it to Moses’ feet. “Surely you are a bridegroom of blood to me,” she said.
translation: Na Sipora em i kisim nait ston, katim sken bilong pikinini man, na putim i go long lek bilong Moses. “Yu husban bilong shedim blod i ya long me,” em i tok.

original: So the LORD let him alone. (When she said, “bridegroom of blood,” she was referring to the circumcision.)
translation: Na Sina i lusim em. (Em i tok long "bridegroom bilong blood", em i min long circumisis.)

original: Meanwhile, the LORD had said to Aaron, “Go and meet Moses in the wilderness.” So he went and met Moses at the mountain of God and kissed him.
translation: Bikpela i tokim Aaron olsem, “Go na kam mitim Moses long bus.” Na em i go na kam mitim Moses long Maunten bilong God, na tupela i pis.

original: And Moses told Aaron everything the LORD had sent him to say, and all the signs He had commanded him to perform.
translation: Na Mosis i tokim Aron ol samting ya Papa God i bin salim em go tokim ol, na ol samting ya em i mekim olsem Papa God i bin givim em.

original: Then Moses and Aaron went and assembled all the elders of the Israelites,
translation: Na Moses na Aaron i go, ol i kam olgeta long ol big man bilong ol Israel,

original: and Aaron relayed everything the LORD had said to Moses. And Moses performed the signs before the people,
translation: Na Aron i tok olgeta samting we Papa God i tokim Mosis olsem. Na Mosis i mekim singsing ol long bihainim ol pipol,

original: and they believed. And when they heard that the LORD had attended to the Israelites and had seen their affliction, they bowed down and worshiped.
translation: Na ol i bilivim. Na wankain ol i harim dispela tok: OL i bin go wankain long Pipal Israel na ol i lukim katim ol i bin katim long, ol i paul ai klost long na ol i wosipim.

original: After that, Moses and Aaron went to Pharaoh and said, “This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: ‘Let My people go, so that they may hold a feast to Me in the wilderness.’”
translation: Bihaen long dispela, Mosis na Aron i go kam bek gen long Faraoh, ol i tok, “Dispela em i toktok bilong Bikpela, God bilong Israel: ‘Lusim pkin bilong Mi i go, naso oli ken kaikai bilong Mi long bus.’”

original: But Pharaoh replied, “Who is the LORD that I should obey His voice and let Israel go? I do not know the LORD, and I will not let Israel go.”
translation: Faraon i tok bek, “Hu na LORD, bai mi harim voiss bilong Em, na luskim Israel i go? Mi no save long LORD, na bai mi no luskim Israel i go.”

original: “The God of the Hebrews has met with us,” they answered. “Please let us go on a three-day journey into the wilderness to sacrifice to the LORD our God, or He may strike us with plagues or with the sword.”
translation: “God bilong Heprew i kam bek long mipela,” ol i anketa. “Plis, lusim mipela i go long wanpela jurney long bus, bai mipela i sakrifais long Lod God bilong mipela, o Em bai i givim mipela ples sik o sua.”

original: But the king of Egypt said to them, “Moses and Aaron, why do you draw the people away from their work? Get back to your labor!”
translation: King bilong Ijip i tokim Moses na Aaron, "Bai yumutupela i lusim ol manmeri long wok bilong ol? Go bak long wok bilong yu!"

original: Pharaoh also said, “Look, the people of the land are now numerous, and you would be stopping them from their labor.”
translation: Faraon i tok tu, " Lukim, ol pipol bilong kantri istap planti nau, na yu bai stopim ol long wok bilong ol."

original: That same day Pharaoh commanded the taskmasters of the people and their foremen:
translation: Olsem de bembe Faraon i givim tok long ol bos bilong wok na ol kap bilong ol:

original: “You shall no longer supply the people with straw for making bricks. They must go and gather their own straw.
translation: Yu no ken kisim bek long ol pipol nau, gras bilong makim brick. Ol i mas go na skulim gras bilong makim brick na wokim brick.

original: But require of them the same quota of bricks as before; do not reduce it. For they are lazy; that is why they are crying out, ‘Let us go and sacrifice to our God.’
translation: Bihainim ol long wanem kosi bilong bricks ol i mas mekim, no ken reduisim. Ol i nogut laik wok; ol i kirap strong long dinau, ol i lak na mekim bikos, ‘Mipela i go na sarim long God bilong yumi.’

original: Make the work harder on the men so they will be occupied and pay no attention to these lies.”
translation: Wok bilong ol man i kam harim, ol i busy olsem, na yu no ken tokim ol lis.

original: So the taskmasters and foremen of the people went out and said to them, “This is what Pharaoh says: ‘I am no longer giving you straw.
translation: Ol bos na ol kapten bilong ol pipol i go aut na tokim ol, "Dispela em toktok bilong Pharaoh: 'Mi no givim yu gras bilong makim haus gen'."

original: Go and get your own straw wherever you can find it; but your workload will in no way be reduced.’”
translation: Go na kisim ol stri long eni hap yu ina findim, tasol wok bilong yu bai i no kam daun in no wei bilong ting.

original: So the people scattered all over the land of Egypt to gather stubble for straw.
translation: Ol pipel i go daris long olgeta hap graun bilong Ijip na ol i kam bikim kalikai bilong givim strau.

original: The taskmasters kept pressing them, saying, “Fulfill your quota each day, just as you did when straw was provided.”
translation: Ol bosim poret mana i save katim ol i go, ol i tok, "Pilai wok bilong yupela long dei, olsem na yupela i mekim bipo stap straw i kamap."

original: Then the Israelite foremen, whom Pharaoh’s taskmasters had set over the people, were beaten and asked, “Why have you not fulfilled your quota of bricks yesterday or today, as you did before?”
translation: Ol bos bilong Israel, whosim taskmasters bilong Pharaoh i bin setim ol yet long pipol, ol i bin kisim bikhet long han na ol i bin aksim: "Wai yu no fulimp quota bilong bricks yesterday oa tude, olsem yu bin mekim bifo?"

original: So the Israelite foremen went and appealed to Pharaoh: “Why are you treating your servants this way?
translation: Ol bos bilong Israel i go bekim Pharaoh: “Long we bilong wanem yupela i wokim servan bilong yupela olsem?”

original: No straw has been given to your servants, yet we are told, ‘Make bricks!’ Look, your servants are being beaten, but the fault is with your own people.”
translation: Ino givim straw long servan bilong yumi, yet yumi harim tok, 'Wokim briks!' Lukim, servan bilong yumi i kamap bekim, tasol dispela hevi i stap long ol pipol bilong yu.

original: “You are slackers!” Pharaoh replied. “Slackers! That is why you keep saying, ‘Let us go and sacrifice to the LORD.’
translation: Faraao i tok, "Yupela i man i no warkim! Yupela ol i man i no warkim, na em i bekim olsem na yupela i go tok, 'Yumi go na yumi mekim sakrifis long LORD.'"

original: Now get to work. You will be given no straw, yet you must deliver the full quota of bricks.”
translation: Nau yu go wokim wok. Yu no ken kisim straw bilong yu, tasol yu mas bringim bikpela namba bilong bricks.

original: The Israelite foremen realized they were in trouble when they were told, “You must not reduce your daily quota of bricks.”
translation: Bos bilong Israel i save ol i kamap long hevi wanpela taim ol i tokim ol, "Yu no ken kisim i go daun bikpela namba bilong bricks we yu mekim bembe long dei."

original: When they left Pharaoh, they confronted Moses and Aaron, who stood waiting to meet them.
translation: Taim ol i lusim Faraon, ol i go bekim Moses na Aron, na ol i stap wait long harim tok bilong ol.

original: “May the LORD look upon you and judge you,” the foremen said, “for you have made us a stench before Pharaoh and his officials; you have placed in their hand a sword to kill us!”
translation: Papa God i lukim yu, bai em i jujumim yu, ol bosim tokpisin i tok, yu mekim mipela i kamap olsem smel bilong pok long ai bilong Faraon na ofisa bilong en, yu putim sord long han bilong ol i kilim mipela!

original: So Moses returned to the LORD and asked, “Lord, why have You brought trouble upon this people? Is this why You sent me?
translation: Mosese i go bek long LORD, na em i askim, "LORD, bai wanem yu bringim hevi long dispela ples? Em i bikos yu sendim mi?"

original: Ever since I went to Pharaoh to speak in Your name, he has brought trouble on this people, and You have not delivered Your people in any way.”
translation: Sinas em i go long Pharaoh olsem wanem nau long nem bilong yu, em i bringim hevi long dispela ples, na yu no save libreim ples bilong yu long wei narakain.

original: But the LORD said to Moses, “Now you will see what I will do to Pharaoh, for because of My mighty hand he will let the people go; because of My strong hand he will drive them out of his land.”
translation: Bareket LORD i tokim Mosis, “Nau yu bai lukim wanem mi bai mekim long Faraon; olsem em bai lusim ol pipol i go, bekas mi gat han bilong pawa, na em bai draivim ol long graun bilong en, bekas mi gat han bilong strong.”

original: God also told Moses, “I am the LORD.
translation: God i tokim Moses, “Mi em i LORD”

original: I appeared to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob as God Almighty, but by My name the LORD I did not make Myself known to them.
translation: Mi bin i kam bek long Abraham, long Aisak, na long Yakob olsem God bilong olgeta pawa, tasol long nem bilong mi LORD, mi no bin givim ol i save long mi yet.

original: I also established My covenant with them to give them the land of Canaan, the land where they lived as foreigners.
translation: Mi tu setim pakt long ol, long givim ol kantri bilong Kanaan, kantri we ol i stap bilong olsen ol bikmus.

original: Furthermore, I have heard the groaning of the Israelites, whom the Egyptians are enslaving, and I have remembered My covenant.
translation: Na mi harim tok bilong ol Israelites i skirapim, husat Ejipitas i mekim wark long taim ol i no laik, na mi remember long kaan triani bilong mi.

original: Therefore tell the Israelites: ‘I am the LORD, and I will bring you out from under the yoke of the Egyptians and deliver you from their bondage. I will redeem you with an outstretched arm and with mighty acts of judgment.
translation: Oleh tokim long ol Israelit: ‘Mi em i God, LORD, na mi bai kisim yu long ndagat long yok bilong Egyptian na bekim yu long hapsait bilong Egyptian. Mi bai bailem yu na kilim yu fri long arm stret, na mi bai wokim dispela long strongpela wok bilong jusis.’

original: I will take you as My own people, and I will be your God. Then you will know that I am the LORD your God, who brought you out from under the yoke of the Egyptians.
translation: Mi bai tekim yu olsem pigin bilong mi, na Mi bai kam bek long yu olsem God bilong yu. Na yu bai save olsem Mi em i Lod God bilong yu, we i bin karim yu naura long hambak bilong Egyptian.

original: And I will bring you into the land that I swore to give to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. I will give it to you as a possession. I am the LORD!’”
translation: Mi bai bringim yu go long graun we mi bin tok pak long givim Abraham, Isaac, na Jacob. Mi bai givim yu graun bilong yu olsem propati. Mi em i LORD!

original: Moses relayed this message to the Israelites, but on account of their broken spirit and cruel bondage, they did not listen to him.
translation: Moses i kam tokim Israelites, tasol bilong ol dispela spirit i bruk na bondage i stap strong, ol i no harim em.

original: So the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Bikpela i tok long Moses,

original: “Go and tell Pharaoh king of Egypt to let the Israelites go out of his land.”
translation: Go na tokim Faraoni king bilong Egip, lusi Israeliti i go aut long kantri bilong em.

original: But in the LORD’s presence Moses replied, “If the Israelites will not listen to me, then why would Pharaoh listen to me, since I am unskilled in speech?”
translation: Long bilong pesens LORD, Moses i tokim, "Israelites i no ken harim mi, orait Pharaoh bai harim mi nau, mi no save tok gut?"

original: Then the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron and gave them a charge concerning both the Israelites and Pharaoh king of Egypt, to bring the Israelites out of the land of Egypt.
translation: LORD i tokim long Mosese na Aron na i givim ol dispela wok, olsem wanem: long ol Israel pipol na Pharaoh king bilong Ijip, i bringim Israel pipol i go long laine bilong Ijip.

original: These were the heads of their fathers’ houses: The sons of Reuben, the firstborn of Israel, were Hanoch and Pallu, Hezron and Carmi. These were the clans of Reuben.
translation: Dispela i ol hed bilong hap bilong ol tumbuna: Pikinini bilong Ruben, pikinini namba wan bilong Isrel, em i Henok na Palu, Hezron na Kami. Dispela i klan bilong Ruben.

original: The sons of Simeon were Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jachin, Zohar, and Shaul, the son of a Canaanite woman. These were the clans of Simeon.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Simeon em i Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jachin, Zohar, na Shaul, pikinini bilong meri Canaan. Dispela ol lain bilong Simeon.

original: These were the names of the sons of Levi according to their records: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari. Levi lived 137 years.
translation: Nem bilong pikinini Levi olsem ol i save long stori bilong ol: Gershon, Kohath, na Merari. Levi i lavim 137 yia.

original: The sons of Gershon were Libni and Shimei, by their clans.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Gershon em i Libni na Shimei, ol ikam long ol clan bilong ol.

original: The sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel. Kohath lived 133 years.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Kohath em i Amram, Izhar, Hebron, na Uzziel. Kohath i stap 133 yia.

original: The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi. These were the clans of the Levites according to their records.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Merari em i Mahli na Mushi. Dispela ol lain bilong Levai ol i kamap long store bilong taim bipo bilong ol.

original: And Amram married his father’s sister Jochebed, and she bore him Aaron and Moses. Amram lived 137 years.
translation: Na Amram i marit Yocebod, susa bilong papa bilong en, na meri i karim bek long en Aaron na Moses. Amram i stap 137 yia.

original: The sons of Izhar were Korah, Nepheg, and Zichri.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Izhar em i Kolah, Nefeg, na Zikri.

original: The sons of Uzziel were Mishael, Elzaphan, and Sithri.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Uzziel i Kol Mishael, Elzaphan, na Sithri.

original: And Aaron married Elisheba, the daughter of Amminadab and sister of Nahshon, and she bore him Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
translation: Na Aron i mari wantaim Elisiba, daughter bilong Amminadab, na sis bilong Nahson, na em i karim bekim ol pikinini bilong em, olsem Nadab, Abihu, Eleaza, na Ithama.

original: The sons of Korah were Assir, Elkanah, and Abiasaph. These were the clans of the Korahites.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Korah em i Asir, Elkanah, na Abiasaf. Dispela ol lain bilong ol Korahite.

original: Aaron’s son Eleazar married one of the daughters of Putiel, and she bore him Phinehas. These were the heads of the Levite families by their clans.
translation: Eleazar, pikinini bilong Aaron, i marit wanpela daughter bilong Putiel, na mama i karim Phinehas bilong em. Ol dispela i bikpela hap bilong famili Levai ol ikam long klan bilong ol.

original: It was this Aaron and Moses to whom the LORD said, “Bring the Israelites out of the land of Egypt by their divisions.”
translation: Em i Aaron na Moses husat Bikpela i tok long ol, “Kisim Israel ol i go nau long laine Egypt, ol i kam bek long ol grupp bilong ol.”

original: Moses and Aaron were the ones who spoke to Pharaoh king of Egypt in order to bring the Israelites out of Egypt.
translation: Mosis na Aron i tokim Pharaoh king bilong Egypt olsem wanem, long tinbai bai yumitupela kisim Israelitis i kamaut long Egypt.

original: Now on the day that the LORD spoke to Moses in Egypt,
translation: Long dei Bikpela i tokim Moses long Ijip,

original: He said to him, “I am the LORD; tell Pharaoh king of Egypt everything I say to you.”
translation: Em i tokim em, "Mi bilong Jehovah; yu tokim Farao king bilong Ijip olgeta samting mi tokim yu."

original: But in the LORD’s presence Moses replied, “Since I am unskilled in speech, why would Pharaoh listen to me?”
translation: Long bilong LORD, Mosis i tok bek, "Mi no save tok gut, Pharaoh bai harim tok bilong mi?"

original: The LORD answered Moses, “See, I have made you like God to Pharaoh, and your brother Aaron will be your prophet.
translation: Bikpela i tokim Mose, "Lukim, mi mekim yu olsem God long Pharaoh, na bros bilong yu Aaron bai i go prophet bilong yu."

original: You are to speak all that I command you, and your brother Aaron is to tell Pharaoh to let the Israelites go out of his land.
translation: Yu mas tokim olsem mi tokim, na brotha Aaron bai tokim Pharaoh long lusim Israelities lusuim na lus go long graun bilong em.

original: But I will harden Pharaoh’s heart, and though I will multiply My signs and wonders in the land of Egypt,
translation: Mi bai strongim het bilong Pharaoh, na maski mi bai kisim singsana na mak bilong mi i go antap long namba long kantri bilong Ijip.

original: Pharaoh will not listen to you. Then I will lay My hand on Egypt, and by mighty acts of judgment I will bring the divisions of My people the Israelites out of the land of Egypt.
translation: Faraon no go harim yu. Olsem na, mi go putim han bilong mi long Egypt, na mi go usim ol wok bilong maji na bosim, na bringim ol clans bilong piple bilong mi, ol Israel, nating long graun bilong Egypt.

original: And the Egyptians will know that I am the LORD, when I stretch out My hand against Egypt and bring the Israelites out from among them.”
translation: Na Egipita bai save olsem LORDE nau, wanpela taim mi stretim han bilong Mi long Egip na kisim Pipol bilong Isrel i go aut long ol.

original: So Moses and Aaron did just as the LORD had commanded them.
translation: Mosese na Aron i mekim olsem olgeta Jehovah i tokim ol.

original: Moses was eighty years old and Aaron was eighty-three when they spoke to Pharaoh.
translation: Mosis em i gat eighty yia na Aron em i gat eighty-tri yia wanpela taim ol i tokim Pharaoh.

original: The LORD said to Moses and Aaron,
translation: Bikpela i tok long Moses na Aaron,

original: “When Pharaoh tells you, ‘Perform a miracle,’ you are to say to Aaron, ‘Take your staff and throw it down before Pharaoh,’ and it will become a serpent.”
translation: Wanpela taim Faraon i tokim yu, ‘Meekim wok mirakel,’ yu mas tokim Aron olsem, ‘Kisim stik bilong yu na katim i go daun bifor Faraon,’ na em bai bagarap i kamap sneak.

original: So Moses and Aaron went to Pharaoh and did just as the LORD had commanded. Aaron threw his staff down before Pharaoh and his officials, and it became a serpent.
translation: Mosese na Aron i go klostu long Faraoh na ol i mekim olsem Jehovah i bin tokim. Aron i kisim stik bilong em na i tropim i daun bifor Faraoh na ofisa bilong em, na em i kamap olsem snake.

original: But Pharaoh called the wise men and sorcerers and magicians of Egypt, and they also did the same things by their magic arts.
translation: Bare Faraon i kolim ol wisman, sorsera, na magisian long Ejip, na ol i mekim ol samting olsem long nau na ol i usim magic bilong ol.

original: Each one threw down his staff, and it became a serpent. But Aaron’s staff swallowed up the other staffs.
translation: Ol i kisim stik bilong ol na i pilai i daun, na ol i kamapim snek. Tasol stik bilong Aron i kaikaim ol stik narakai.

original: Still, Pharaoh’s heart was hardened, and he would not listen to them, just as the LORD had said.
translation: Hati bilong Pharaoh i stap strong olsem ston, na em i no lisnen go long tok bilong ol, olsem LORD itok.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Pharaoh’s heart is unyielding; he refuses to let the people go.
translation: Na LORD i tokim Mosis, “Hati bilong Pharaoh i harim strong; em i no wanpela lusim ol pipol i go.”

original: Go to Pharaoh in the morning as you see him walking out to the water. Wait on the bank of the Nile to meet him, and take in your hand the staff that was changed into a snake.
translation: Go long Faraon long moning, olsem yu lukim em i go wokabaut long wara. Wail long banis bilong Nail, na kisim long han bilong yu stik bilong yu, em i bin chanj long snek.

original: Then say to him, ‘The LORD, the God of the Hebrews, has sent me to tell you: Let My people go, so that they may worship Me in the wilderness. But you have not listened until now.
translation: Bai yu tokim em olsem, 'LORD, Bikpela God bilong Judi, em i salim mi kam tokim yu: Lusim pkin bilo mi go, olsem na bai oli i servisim Mi long bus.' Bai yu no harim nau yet.

original: This is what the LORD says: By this you will know that I am the LORD. Behold, with the staff in my hand I will strike the water of the Nile, and it will turn to blood.
translation: Dispela em i tok olsem long LORD: Bikos long dispela yu ken wel em mi LORD. Yu lukim, wantaim stik bilong mi han mi go kilim wara bilong Nai, na wara bai i kamap bloo.

original: The fish in the Nile will die, the river will stink, and the Egyptians will be unable to drink its water.’”
translation: Ol pis i stap long Nil yu bai dai, wara bai bilong en i kamap strong smel, na pipol bilong Egypt bai no inap drinkim wara bilong en.

original: And the LORD said to Moses, “Tell Aaron, ‘Take your staff and stretch out your hand over the waters of Egypt—over their rivers and canals and ponds and reservoirs—that they may become blood.’ There will be blood throughout the land of Egypt, even in the vessels of wood and stone.”
translation: Na Lod i tokim Mose olsem, "Yu tokim Aron, 'Kisim stik bilong yu na stretchim han bilong yu long wara bilong Egypt—long wara, kanal, pona, na tanki wara—ol bai i kamap bloo.' Bloo bai i stap longen gras bilong Egypt, even long bikpela tupela vessels long diwai na ston."

original: Moses and Aaron did just as the LORD had commanded; in the presence of Pharaoh and his officials, Aaron raised the staff and struck the water of the Nile, and all the water was turned to blood.
translation: Mosese na Aron i mekim olsem Bikpela i tok, long hap bilong Faraon na ofisal bilong em, Aron i kilim stik bilong tok na i paitim wara bilong Nai, na all wara i kamap bled.

original: The fish in the Nile died, and the river smelled so bad that the Egyptians could not drink its water. And there was blood throughout the land of Egypt.
translation: Ol pis i dai pinis long Nil, wara i smell i go longwey, ol Egipcan i no inap drinkim wara bilong en. Na bloo i go olabaun long kantri bilong Egip.

original: But the magicians of Egypt did the same things by their magic arts. So Pharaoh’s heart was hardened, and he would not listen to Moses and Aaron, just as the LORD had said.
translation: Majisi bilong Ejip i mekim ol samting olsem bai majik arts bilong ol. Na hat bilong Pharaoh i bin harden, na em i no lisin long Moses na Aaron, olsem LORD i bin tok.

original: Instead, Pharaoh turned around, went into his palace, and did not take any of this to heart.
translation: Faraon i kam bek gen, i go insait long haus bilong en, na olgeta samting dispela i no bin givim en bel.

original: So all the Egyptians dug around the Nile for water to drink, because they could not drink the water from the river.
translation: Ol Ejipcen i wokim hol long sait bilong Nai, long ol i kamaukim wara bilong dring, wantaim ol i no inap dring wara bilong Nai, warasait.

original: And seven full days passed after the LORD had struck the Nile.
translation: Na wen sewen i go pinis bihaen long taem Lord i paitim wara bilong Nai.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Go to Pharaoh and tell him that this is what the LORD says: ‘Let My people go, so that they may worship Me.
translation: Na Lod i tokim Mosis olsem, "Go long Pharaoh na tokim em, olsem Lod i tok: 'Lusim pkinini bilong Mi, nau ol i mas servisim Mi.'"

original: But if you refuse to let them go, I will plague your whole country with frogs.
translation: Bain nasim ol i no inap go, mi bai bagarap kantri bilong yu wantaim krokodai.

original: The Nile will teem with frogs, and they will come into your palace and up to your bedroom and onto your bed, into the houses of your officials and your people, and into your ovens and kneading bowls.
translation: Nai river bai i kamap long ol frog, na ol i go long stretem, bikim ol i go insait long haus bilong yu, go apost long rum bilong yu, go antap long bet bilong yu, go insait long haus bilong ofisala na ol pipol bilong yu, na go insait long oven na bol husim ka bilong yu.

original: The frogs will come up on you and your people and all your officials.’”
translation: Rop bai kam antap long yu na ol pipol bilong yu na ol ofisal bilong yu.

original: And the LORD said to Moses, “Tell Aaron, ‘Stretch out your hand with your staff over the rivers and canals and ponds, and cause the frogs to come up onto the land of Egypt.’”
